Usually in this style of movie at least one of the skits works, sadly not in this film.For the Americans out there Possibly suggest this for Thanksgiving, because it is a massive turkey!

reviews.review_title: Easily one of the stupidest and worst movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: Plainly put Movie 43 was utter garbage. I knew it would be bad...I was prepared to dislike it a great deal but this didn't even come remotely close to meeting my already disgustingly low expectations. This was filth the likes of which I have rarely seen. I have seen so many gross out comedies but this takes that to new levels. I can't even fathom why some of these people would even do this. The movie starts out shockingly gross, and I even chuckled a couple of times at the stupidity but then it just got worse and worse and it wasn't even remotely funny. Even someone who loves Seth Rogen or other extreme gross comedians could not possibly find this amusing...could they? I mean how many disgusting sex jokes, body jokes...I mean we are talking everything from bestiality, to a couple crapping on each other, to a cartoon cat masturbating and then sodomizing itself...no I'm not kidding. Who made this garbage. I honestly think this might be the worst movie I have ever seen. Not only is it disgusting but it uses all these Hollywood stars in ways that I can't figure out why they would do this.I won't bother going into details about who is in this film. You can look at the cast yourself. No one does anything worth mentioning. Some of the bigger stars try to shock you by being in filthy skits but why would anyone do this or make this trash. I get that filthy comedy is "in" now but this is just smut. I have to wonder if this is all some big giant gag because I cannot understand why most of these stars would affiliate themselves with the worst trash I have ever laid eyes on. The very first skit with Hugh Jackman and Kate Winslet was dirty and strange and awkwardly funny. Then everything goes straight downhill after that. These people are parents for crying out loud.The only director out of the eleven of them that I wasn't surprised to see on this list was Peter Farrelly. I am not a prude by any means. I am as filthy as the next person and amongst good friends I could make a sailor cringe BUT...to put this on film and release it in theatres and expose people to this level of garbage is unforgivable. I have watched bad movies...believe me I have. Read my reviews and see how many movies I watch every year...hundreds...this goes into at least top three of the worst things I have sat through. This isn't comedy, this is garbage of the utmost. Please don't waste your time with this. Don't give this crap anymore promotion than it already has. Fortunately it bombed and I can't even imagine how angry I would have been if I had paid money in a theatre to see it. A big, well deserved, fat, HUGE ZERO!!

reviews.review_title: Funny Funny Funny!!!! All Skits were well done!
reviews.content: Ignore these neg reviews...Go watch this!! Very funny stuff here.. Top notch actors/actresses..At least they have a sense of humor for doing this! I respect each one of them even more!! Jackman's chin scene -- just so funny Park and Rec guy skit with girlfriend//Emma Stone looking and acting so hot...Super girl...It goes on and on...Basketball team..Forget teamwork!!! You are...Cat Beezle at end..hahahahand the home school kid getting it from his parents..literally..hahahah

reviews.review_title: Mental age of this movie: 12 years old
reviews.content: Is just sad when you see very stupid people spending a lot of money to do childish and impotent comedies like that. Even more using nice actors. 26 "writers" and 4 years to make this? Besides that, there'a a contradiction: the humor feels like anybody over 12 years old could like the movie, but at the same time the jokes with sex are inappropriate to younger than 16 years old. Congrats Hollywood, sometimes you really know how to waste money.

reviews.review_title: The worst movie of 2013... or ever
reviews.content: I don't even know what to say about this movie, it's so... so... so terrible Holy crap I didn't believed in the things I was seeing. How could anyone working on this movie thought those "segments" were funny. Seriously someone should have said "maybe this isn't has funny has you guys think it is" and just scrap it.I wanted to see this because, like everyone else there are a lot of great actors in it......but... just... NOOO! It goes to show that you don't need a great cast for a film to work. I had high expectations and the main reason I thought I was going to like it was because of seth macfarlene. But as soon as the "segment" with hugh jackman (I think it's the 1st one) appeared my expectations lowered, they dropped. And it just kept going from bad to worse. The most unfunniest thing that I ever saw was the final scene with josh duhamel, how could he agree to that?!I immediately thought that when the actors saw the finished "movie" they would want to erased it from everyone's mind... Damn, just... Don't see it, reallyps: or see it to make fun of the movie :D

reviews.review_title: Were you really expecting anything smart?
reviews.content: Every review that I have read for this title has said nothing but bad things. Of course, I think the people who often take the time to go on the internet and review movies are usually looking for something a little more in their cinema than jokes about poop and mangled penises. Anyway, the point of a raunchy comedy like this one isn't to leave you feeling like a better person afterward. The point is to simply entertain and that is exactly what it does. But of course, if you are looking for wit, try Silver Linings Playbook instead. The jokes in this movie are gross and totally inane. They're absolutely stupid and very offensive. But that's what's great about them. Like I said, it's going to take a certain kind of person to actually find this a great movie, and most are going to chuckle quite a bit. I can't say it was one of those "so bad it's amazing" movies. I can't say that it was amazingly hilarious. But despite what everyone else says, it was worth the 8 or more dollars you pay to see it.

reviews.review_title: Where do I start? I was embarassed for the actors!
reviews.content: I had never heard of this movie before seeing it on Netflix. Star studded cast made me press play. Wow (and not in a good way)! A few of these very weird stories were kind of funny, but more were so off color they were hard to watch. And to end it with Elizabeth Banks being killed by a kid with a plastic knife? Seriously? I wanted that disgusting cat to be killed, in the worst way possible, but he wins? Ruined what good feeling I might have had. This review might have been 2 stars except for that. I have such a bad taste in my mouth, I'm afraid this thing is going to give me nightmares. YUCK!

The trailer of Movie 43 is extremely misleading. There is nothing funny about this film and the jokes are horrible. I was so disappointed that I almost walked out of the movie if I hadn't payed for it already.. A waste of the cast that was very promising. This film is a HUGE disappointment. It is by far the worst film I have ever seen. BY FAR. It was awful, it had no storyline, every attempt of being funny was a failure and it was almost to painful to watch because there were so many great actors that were playing such stupid roles. They promise you a film that is refreshing, funny and new. But instead it is racist, not funny at all and overall just very stupid. The short films didn't really tell a story or storyline. They were just made to shock people, but even that was a failure. A waste of cast if you ask me!

reviews.review_title: If you saw the trailer, you're an idiot for trashing it. Ignore the bad reviews!
reviews.content: OK folks.Either everyone in the world is unobservant/ignorant, or you didn't see the trailer nor know ANYTHING about this film going in. Who sees a movie they don't even know what it's about? No one.You saw the trailer. You saw Halle Berry blow out the candles on a blind kid's cake, you saw Gerard Butler play a profane and violent leprechaun, you saw those teenage stars try to stop up a girl's period with frozen peas and a sponge, you heard Emma Stone admit to blowing a wizard for magic beans, you heard Anna Faris ask her boyfriend to poop on her.HOW can anyone say this trailer was misleading? Based off the previous paragraph ALONE, you KNEW what this trailer was representing. Raunchy comedy. This film didn't advertise to be anything else, therefore 99% of the bad reviews on here are invalid. If you are looking for a movie with a story, this isn't it. If you're looking for a giant, ADD episode of Robot Chicken chock full of terribly gross jokes, toilet humor, uncomfortable scenes, and tons of "oh, that's just WRONG", then go see it! My boyfriend and I were DYING laughing. It's a lot of fun if you're into movies like 40 year old virgin.WATCH THE TRAILER FIRST SO YOU KNOW WHAT TO EXPECT.

Wow. So many big names in the worst movie of all time. Let's forget the vulgarity it stupidity. I've watched and enjoyed many vulgar and stupid movies. Having said that, there was absolutely nothing funny about this movie. I laughed once in the whole movie. If it were funny and hilarious, you would not care that it was stupid and vulgar. There is nothing funny about this. Acting is terrible, humor is nonexistent, story is ridiculous. I'm amazed at all the big names in this movie. Why would they have given their name to such a dismal project??? Are they so desperate for the 10 bucks they were paid to perform? This is a modern day attempt at a Mel Brooks comedy. Only the comedy is missing.

I've heard review of it before going in. People said it was really bad, possibly the worst of this year. I went in because on the good cast and living the history of seeing theatre "the worst movie of the year".Basically, if it's not your type, it sucks. In a sketch, they give you one joke, then slaps you with one more of the same tone, then one more, then one more. If you don't get one, you'll hate the rest. And basically saying, most of their jokes sucks. The only reason I gave it a 2 stars is because I liked blue humor, and the basketball it a 5 minutes job of it pretty well. Then again, I paid to see an hour and a half, and got only 5 minutes of goodness, which is pretty dumb. I didn't walk out because of that, and if I have had torrented it, I probably delete it in the first 5 minutes of the movie.To summarized, it sucks; if their jokes don't hit, the movie doesn't, and most of them don't.

I can't understand why this movie has such a low rating. It was so funny from start to finish and maybe even a little cringe. I stumbled across this on Netflix and glad I did. Even the girlfriend enjoyed the humor.

The storyline is really disconnected and forced. The jokes might be funny if you're in pre-K but for anyone else they're disgusting and awful.Even if you thought Epic Movie and the rest of those movies were the greatest ever you may have trouble laughing.This is the kind of movie where you spend most of it trying to figure out why anyone would consider going through the process of writing and directing it.I can't imagine why these great actors would agree to do such an awful movie.

A group of Irish Monks needs to make payments on their belfry, so they decide to sell flowers to make money. For weeks they sell flowers, and it's going well. Too well in fact, they've begun to run the local florist, Patty O'Flannigan out of town. Well, a bit cheesed at the monks jumping in on his territory, he decides to confront them. He asks them to step off, politely, but they simply respond that, "That's no way to talk to men of God!", and throw him out of their monastery. For weeks this goes on, the monks selling flowers, and the florist getting more and more desperate to make them stop. Finally, he goes to Hugh Mactaggart, the biggest, baddest man in town -- he could get anyone to leave town -- so Patty decides he's the best way to get rid of the monks, gives him the rest of the money, and retires to bed, wary of the results. In the morning, a knock on his door reveals Mactaggart, offering a firm handshake and saying, "They shan't be botherin' ya again Patty." The moral of the story is, Hugh, and only Hugh, can prevent florist friars.I tell you this joke because it is infinitely funnier than the entirety of Movie 43.

This is a skit comedy movie with a big A-list cast that really falls flat. The skits have a few,very few, funny moments but fail overall. This movie is basically a copy of better more successful skit movies like "Inappropriate Comedy" & The original skit classic "Kentucky Fried Movie". The cast they assembled should have been able to pull of more laughs but most big names they got are not normally comedic so I assume that was why the humor just wasn't there.

reviews.review_title: I don't know what to write in this part
reviews.content: Wow! Like is this movie blackmail? Like did all the stars in the movie each get caught in separate individual acts of humping a goat, y'know and whoever made this movie has the dirt, and he's all you're gonna appear in movie 43 or I show the tabloids what you did to that goat? I have so many questions.

reviews.review_title: A movie I found very funny but it is very offensive so be prepared. You will see things you may never have wanted to. I say B.
reviews.content: "This video is so illegal that it has been banned by every country in the world, including Amsterdam." After an older brother and his friend are pranked by his younger brother they come up with one of their own for payback. What starts off as a joke quickly balloons out of control into something that can destroy the world. There really isn't much to say about this. It is more of a series of vignette's staring some of Hollywood's most famous doing the weirdest and grossest things you can think of. Think to yourself what is one thing I thought I'd never see in a movie...it's probably in here. Personally I thought the movie was very funny and watching with the right group of people would make it even better, but be warned...it is extremely offensive! If you think you may get offended then by all means avoid this. If you have a wide sense of humor and are looking for something to just watch and not have to think about then this movie is for you. Overall, I thought it was funny but be prepared for what you are about to experience. I give it a B.

In film making, to break the rules is the key to create amazing new experimental products. Ultimately, it is the freedom of the film maker to bend and break the laws. Movie 43 is an experimental comedy movie containing a couple of short films, some are curious and watchable, some don't make any sense. At the end of the day, you wonder what was it all about.

reviews.review_title: The Difference between Comedy and Amateur Hour is Timing.
reviews.content: I was caught off guard how A list movie stars were appearing in this poorly executed sketch comedy film. Some reviews I read believe the reason people reject it is for the ribald humour. Audiences are willing to be offended if it is funny. There are some good premises, such as Hugh Jackman having a scrotum for a chin. But the joke was drawn out too long, and otherwise the sketch had little else to it. Kind of like a one joke SNL sketch that unfortunately doesn't know when enough is enough. Each sketch suffered from the same lack of depth or follow through. Each sketch also showed lack of professional production, direction, editing, etc. Nevertheless, I HAD to watch this curiosity because of the number of recognisable movie stars it featured. I was quite aghast at the willingness of these worldwide celebrities with an image to protect appearing in infantile crude sketches. See Halle Barry bare her oversized breasts! See Kate Winslet act her way through an embarrassing elongated sketch featuring men's genitalia! Richard Gere objectifies naked women! Each sketch seems to deliberately find something vulgar and then not try at all to expand on the idea. Like the offensive gag is enough to hold the film. Sadly no. This film is so bad but surprising it could qualify as camp/cult. I normally don't give high regard to films that TRY to be camp/cult, because they are too self aware and look for gimmicks they believe will earn cult status. A real cult film believes in itself and only the adoring fans can claim it as such. As for the jaw dropping parade of actors ruining their reputation, one wonders if there was some fine print in their contract that they had to appear in this dreck.

reviews.review_title: One of a kind movie - Must watch.
reviews.content: I just don't get it, how this movie get just 4.2 stars? I laughed so hard, I just had to watch it for the 2nd time. I recommended this movie to a lot of people and most of them told me that it's one of the funniest movies they watched.You don't need a plot in all movies, this movie is based on a few non-related clips that will leave you in tears (from laugh of course).Just give it a chance and watch it. Thank me later.

reviews.review_title: The worst film I have ever seen.
reviews.content: It's sad that you can give 10 on a scale of 0 to 10 but not 0. I would give this zero. I saw a review from someone saying it's sad everyone seems to have lost their sense of humour. Believe me, I love dumb comedy, like dumb and dumber, something about Mary, airplane movies etc ... this, I was excited about watching it. I don't like to give bad reviews, if I devote any of my time to anything I want to enjoy it. I hated every second of this ordeal. I would rather spend a day in prison being abused by the sisters all day than go through watching this again. Avoid avoid avoid. No idea how it's registered such a high score, 4+/10 anyone not giving this a 1 needs their head examined.

reviews.review_title: There's an alternate cut that actually makes sense.
reviews.content: The movie we got was of an unhinged screenwriter pitching a movie to a couple movie execs. The sketches are the parts of the movie. As it goes on it gets worse and finally at the end it's revealed the entire thing was being filmed as a kind of movie within a movie. End credits. This makes no sense.But there's an alternate version of it. I don't mean it's like an unrated cut and the sketches are all the same and in the same order but this one actually has a narrative that makes sense given what we actually see. It starts off with two guys who want to be internet famous so they film themselves having a load of Jackass type stunts and are getting huge views. Thinking they have it made it's revealed all to be a joke by the younger brother of one of the guys. There is no website, the views are fake, they're not internet famous. So, to get back at him they ask him to find a banned movie only known as "Movie 43". As he's doing this they load up his laptop with a bunch of viruses by going to a lot of free porn sites. Although if the younger brother is that smart to create a fake Youtube type website for them, he's smart enough to know how to get rid of viruses. And it's being done on an apple laptop. You know, the ones that are harder to get viruses on?Anyway he finds a bunch of sketches he says are part of this movie and that's what we see. That's the movie. It's not any better as the sketches are all sophomoric crap but it makes sense. Plus the ads we see playing during the movie now make sense I mean when was the last time you watched a motion picture, in a theater or on a DVD and there was an ad in the middle of it? You do see that on Youtube however.This movie is not good. It's really bad. The sketches tend to be really simple with one joke that is then beaten over and over until it's dead. Like the first one. Hugh Jackman is the most eligible bachelor in the city but can't find the right woman. Why? He has balls coming out of his neck. That's the joke. Something that South Park did years ago and this movie stole from them as their first joke. Are you laughing yet? How about the one where Anna Farris and Chris Pratt are a couple and we think they're getting ready to propose to each other. Except Anna wants Chris to poop on her. That's the joke. Are you laughing now? No? Didn't think so. How about the couple that home schools their son but to give him the "true high school experience" bully him in the process? If that wasn't bad enough his mother comes onto him. Are you laughing yet? You better not be because that's not funny. It's disturbing.Also the IMDB really needs to work on a way to get rid of fake reviews. Ones that call this a masterpiece and give it 10/10 because they think they're being clever are not helping. Luckily the weighted average seems to show a more accurate rating even though it should be lower.Do not watch this. There is no reason to watch it.

Worst thing i have ever seen, the only thing i could actually stand watching was the Halle berry segment. I did not find this movie funny or even slightly entertaining.How could anyone in their right minds use so much money on this garbage, and with these great actors.Don't waste money on this, not to encourage piracy but if you really want to see what the fuzz is about then go watch it there. Or walk out of the movie theater when you can still get your money back.(Random filler so i can post this review and prevent future time waste).....

reviews.review_title: If you don't think Movie43 is funny...we can't be friends.
reviews.content: Myself & my best friend watched this at the cinema and howled with laughter. Whilst a few other people walked out! It's possibly the most random film ever. But it's funny. Gross out funny. I've made so many people watch this with me...and so far everyone has enjoyed it!

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone says
reviews.content: What keeps this movie from being a total disaster is the short segments within it. If this was one movie with one storyline, one plot, etc., it would be one of the worst movies ever made. The main "plot" (if one can even call it that) is so brainless and stupid I almost quit watching. But I'm glad I hung in there for the first few minutes, which were terrible. Things picked up from there, with some monstrous laughs. Each short segment has absolutely nothing to do with the next, and that's what makes it work.Now, that being said, a couple of the segments are stupid, unfunny, gross, and boring. But most of them are a hoot. Talk about random, silly, impossible, hilarious situations. What I will never understand is why people go into a movie like this expecting perfection. This movie does not try in the least bit to be intelligent. It just tries to be funny and entertaining, and for the most part, it succeeds. (With a few exceptions.)Another thing I enjoyed was the use of many talented cast members. It's fun to see these people in a movie that isn't to be taken seriously. I'm sure they filmed their parts in less than a day, and got a laugh out of it. A lot of reviews will tell you it was a waste of talent. In my opinion, everyone needs to goof off and do something silly once in a while.I know my review cites mostly good things about this movie, but my 5/10 star rating is with good reason. While there are many gut-busting hilarious parts to it, the bad parts are so bad, they offset much of the good, and somewhat ruin what could have been an 8 star movie.While Movie 43 will not even come close to winning an Oscar, it deserves more credit than most people give it.

reviews.review_title: It's nasty and offensive, no pretentions
reviews.content: This movie is offensive, politically incorrect and disgusting. But it's meant to be like that, so if that's the kind of humour you like and you can handle it and have fun, it's not that bad.The movie doesn't fail at what it tries to do, so it's not really the worst movie as so many claim. It's worst when a pretentious film tries hard to be serious or cool and it isn't.This movie doesn't have great acting (even though there an incredible number of big actors in it!), great story of fancy cinematography, it's just a series of gags to watch and spend a while with no expectations of a masterpiece.And it definitely goes far in all the wrongs it's meant to show, believe me. If you're easily offended, don't watch this.

I had heard a good review from a YouTube channel from which I had previously gotten good information. However, this time the movie did not meet up to the review. It looks like the directors and screen writers have lost their sense of reality. No human being with an IQ over 40 would enjoy this film. There is no true story line. It looks like they just tried to string together a group of shorts which were originally filmed as a joke. It is just plain stupid. The lack of plot is balanced by a remarkable cast of big name stars. They must have had a huge budget to get all of the big name actors, but this movie drops my opinion of every one of the actors. Other than the big name stars, the directors tried to raise interest in the movie by adding a few topless girls as the "iBabe," but even this was painful to watch. The movie may be tolerable if you turn off the sound so you don't have to listen to the nonsense.

Long story short, this is one of the absolute worst movies that I have ever had the displeasure of sitting through and attempting to endure because, well, unfortunately in this case, I don't like to turn off a movie in the middle of watching. Oh, how I wish I did though.It was filled with random scenes of "movies" that were raunchy, made no sense to anything (was all random filler), and were just completely not funny. At all.Now I don't care how raunchy, bloody, s**t filled, or whatever else a movie can be, but you seriously have to be dumb as rocks to think this is funny. The scene with Johnny Knoxville, Sean William Scott, and Gerard Butler (as 2 leprechaun brothers) got a giggle out of me, but that was about it.The balls on the neck, the incest (technically 2 separate instances), the defecating for sexual pleasure, the long drawn out truth or dare, and especially the DISGUSTING scene with the animated cat at the very end made for a ABSOLUTELY HORRIBLE FILM.Don't waste your time watching this. I know I wish I didn't.

reviews.review_title: The Oscar Winner of Offensive & Unfunny!
reviews.content: I'm not going to waste too much time, so I'm just going to say it. This is the worst film I've EVER seen. I know my rating says 1/10, but I would personally give it a 0.5/10 only because I kinda chuckled once. That's it. Now before I start talking(spoiling) the segments, I must say I didn't pay for this "film". There's a segment called "The Pitch" and has Dennis Quaid in it and I didn't watch this one. I had an alternate version with a different sketch instead of "The Pitch" That's all, now let's dive into this minefield . . ."The Thread" - This was the sketch instead of "The Pitch" and was the one I got a chuckle at. I don't remember what line it was, but i chuckled. Now this segment is about 3 teenagers who try to find "Movie 43" online because it's the most banned film in the world. They piece together the following segments trying to find it. It ends with "Movie 43" leading into world destruction. Only one laugh, so yeah. Rating- 0.5/10"The Catch" - This one's about Kate Winslet going on a blind date with Hugh Jackman. He's a great and nice guy, but there's a catch - he has a scrotum on his neck. He has a scrotum on his neck and Kate Winslet is shocked and seems to be the only one to see it. That is the whole segment. Kate Winslet being shocked by what Hugh Jackman does with his neck. No laughs, just pain. Rating- 0/10"Homeschooled" - Easily one of the most offensive ones. This one's about Leiv Schrieber and Naomi Watts homeschooling there son by humiliating them and also having Naomi Watts give her son his first kiss. Eventually the son becomes a psycho and has a doll who is his only friend. Isn't that HILARIOUS? No, it's offensive and unfunny. Rating- 0/10"The Proposition" - Easily the most offensive and disgusting one. Anna Farris wants Chris Pratt to defecate on her. Eventually, he gets hit by a car and his feces go all over the road. Hilarious. Rating- 0/10"Veronica" - Kieran Culkin is a convenience store when his ex(Emma Stone) walks in and they talk dirty while the intercom microphone is on. That's it. Stupid. Although, Emma Stone is gorgeous, but didn't deliver anything. Rating- 0/10"iBabe" - Richard Gere plays a boss for an Apple rip-off when he finds out that his "iBabe" which is an iPod in the shape of a naked woman is destroying male genitalia because the males try to make love with the iBabe. Richard, and his team put barb wire on the iBabe so males won't try to do anything with it, but listen to music. Stupid and unfunny. Rating- 0/10"Superhero Speed-Dating" - Justin Long goes speed-dating as Robin from Batman. While speed-dating with women like Lois Land(Uma Thurman) and Supergirl(Kristen Bell) Jason Sudeikis is Batman and keeps messing with Robin's dates. It turns out the Penguin is there and will blow up the place, but they stop him and Robin kisses Supergirl. Offensive to superhero films and comic book fans. Rating- 0/10"Machine Kids" - A fake commercial saying that people shouldn't beat machines because there are children in them. Stupid and wasted potential because it's an alright idea. Rating- 0/10"Middleschool Date" - This teenager home alone with his brother(Christopher Mintz-Plasse) is on a date with Chloe Grace-Moretz and Chloe gets her first period. The teenager and the brother plus the Chloe's father and the teenager's father(Patrick Warburton) all freak out and don't know what to do, but they do make offensive period jokes. Hilarious and clever? NO! Rating- 0/10"Tampax" - Another fake commercial having two women being eaten by a shark and the commercial is for Tampax. So stupid and not clever. Rating- 0/10"Happy Birthday" - Seann William Scott is mad at Johnny Knoxville for sleeping with his girlfriend. Knoxville apologizes and captures a leprechaun as a gift for Seann's birthday so they can take it's gold. The leprechaun's brother comes in and tries to rescue him, but Knoxville and Seann kill them. They take the leprechauns' gold and also have a fairy who provides sex. Boring and unfunny. Rating- 0/10"Truth Or Dare" - Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant are on a blind date and decide to play a bizarre game of truth or dare. Eventually, they dare each other to get plastic surgery so Berry has a fish face and Merchant becomes Asian. This could have been funny, but it's so stupid and disgusting that it's not funny. Rating- 0/10"Victory's Glory" - Set in 1959, Terrence Howard plays a basketball coach for a black team. The team is scared because the other team is white and that's who the audience is rooting for. Howard tells them because they're black, they will win. They lose. Offensive black jokes and just boring and unfunny. Rating- 0/10"Beezel" - In the middle of the credits, this segment shows up. Elizabeth Banks is dating Josh Duhamel. Josh has an animated cat who fantasizes about him and Josh together. However, Beezel hates Banks and pees on her and also tries to kill her. The segment ends with Banks trying to kill Beezel, but fails and a bunch of kids stab her with forks. But don't worry, Beezel and Josh are still together. This could have been funny. If the whole segment was animated, it would have been hilarious. The fact that it's real life with this animated cat in it just makes it look like they were too cheap to animate the segment and make it funny. Wasted potential. Rating- 0/10.Overall Thoughts: To end this review, this "movie" is awful and deserves no money at all. It's the worst movie I have EVER seen and it's disgusting just to think about this "movie". Overall Rating- 0.5/10.

I think a movie like this is criminal. There has to be some basic threshold for making a cinematic release. This was really quite terrible. I can't believe so many great actors tied their name to this garbage.

Yes I GIVE this MOVIE a 10 out of 10 WHY? Because I am a MOVIE LOVER and this Movie is TOTALLY AWESOME, STUPID, TRASHING, SMASHING, GROSS, RIDICULOUS, MAKES NO SENCE AT ALL.
Sometimes you just need a Little Bullcrap to Watch.
Was 12 when I saw it and thought it was terrible, and trust I like dark humor and messed up situations but they over did it to the point it wasn't funny

I preface this review by saying that the only saving grace to this movie is the fact that I extorted money out of my best friend to pay for the ticket, and it did not come out of my own pocket. Had I paid for this movie myself, I would have probably stormed the box office, and demanded my money back.That being said, I appreciated one joke from the whole ninety minute (and thank whatever deity you worship that it's not any longer) run time. It occurred during the Superhero segment, and is so subtle that I was the only one in the theater who laughed at it, and then had to turn and explain it to those I was with as they looked at me weird. That should be an indication.The cast SHOULD be the saving grace of the movie, but instead, you just wonder why they agreed to do something of this caliber. Hugh Jackman is just coming off of a Golden Globe win and is preparing to clinch the win off of his Oscar nomination. He shouldn't need to cash a paycheck that badly that he is willing to don the vulgar prosthetics that he does for the segment. The movie (for film is far too charitable of a designation for this) features a whole myriad of extremely respectable actors and actresses that should not be slumming. The entire budget, I'm sure, was spent on hiring quality talent to mask the complete lack of quality in the movie. It is cinematically boring, and quite awfully written. Anyone who found this movie humorous should be tested to see if they even have an IQ. The jokes come in onslaughts so brutal you would think you were under heavy fire, and it's about as pleasant as that scenario. You will most likely be physically uncomfortable watching it. The level of sexually explicit material and unsavory language is through the roof, and even if you like raunchy, the amount is simply too much. It is unbelievable, some of the things they make light of, and the situations they depict. None of it is witty, or subtly metaphorical, or smart. The worst part is that just when you think it's over, you're wrong. If you have any smidgen of self-respect, please run screaming from the room if you are ever asked to watch it. I would easily say it was the worst movie I have ever had the displeasure to view, and that by the end of it, I was questioning if I was sane enough not to begin clawing my own eyes out. Needless to say, my best friend had his movie-choosing privileges revoked until further notice, as punishment for his decision. Please take my advice, I beg you. Do not watch.

reviews.review_title: Do not waste a single minute of your life watching this movie
reviews.content: The worst movie I have ever seen in my life. Truly disgusting on all levels. Makes you wonder what kind of world this is that we live in. There was a line at the customer service desk - everyone asking for their money back.I was thinking that a support group might be necessary for those subjected to the disgraceful chain of events that took place in this horrid movie.You'd be better off staying at home watching a blank screen than to watch a single minute of this waste of a film.P.S. I have never written a review. We were so disturbed we went to a local bar and got drunk!

Can't figure out how they got an all-star cast to appear in mostly unfunny skits. Sophomoric humor can be great, but it needs to be funny. Aside from a few scenes, this barely made me chuckle. A throwback to the sketch comedy movies of the '70's (Kentucky Fried Movie and The Groove Tube) but it completely misses the mark.

Apparently this is not for the easily offended - but thats just an excuse for people/the makers who like it to say anyone who doesn't like it is a prude. But thats not the truth. I didn't like it as it had no laughs in it at all. None. I like sh*t jokes, c*ck jokes, p*ssy jokes and the rest - I like offensive. However Movie 43 is like a potentially funny story told by someone who can't tell a joke. Slightly embarrassing and awkward. That's how I felt for the actors...embarrassedAvoid.

Most of the jokes in this film have been done before. The ball-chin guy gag was pointless and although it looked funny, I was as confused as Kate Winslet as nobody else ever alluded to it. You might as well just have a photograph of a guy with balls on his neck as nothing ever came of it. It was very childish toilet humour gags which have all been done in some form or other on various cartoons in the past. The central story line was rubbish and boring and a flimsy excuse to tie all these short films together. The guy at the end discovering he had been jacking off to his mother, would have probably jacked off to his mother all his life if his mother was as sexy as that. Poorly done, cheap jokes, and I personally think the big names in this film (apart from Emma Stone and Anna Faris who do every single movie they are offered) were just jumping on the Family Guy band wagon because shock toilet humour dick and fart jokes are "in" at the moment.

reviews.review_title: Should have watched Jack and Jill instead
reviews.content: Movie 43 is a load of 5 minute sketches. (There not all 5 minutes, could be 6 minutes could be 7. It doesn't matter. Why? Because it's a sh*t film that's why)! Movie 43 is a load of 5 minute sketches in a random order thrown together to make what some people call a movie. I don't call it a movie I call it an abomination. Someone obviously thought this up while drunk or on drugs... (It doesn't matter. Why? because it's a s**t film that's why)! ... and had good enough celebrities in there contacts list to make a film. There are worse movies than this which I have had the misfortune of seeing. But this is the most painful movie I have ever had to watch, i didn't have to watch it I just heard that some people who can be quite funny sometimes were in it. disregarded the extremely bad reviews ( for example this has a 4% on Rotten Tomatoes) and searched Movie 43 Full Movie Online. About 90 minutes later I wished I had watched Jack and Jill instead. Out of the-something like 12 sketches, I don't know how many there are. (Why? Because it's a s**t film that's why)! Out of the 12 sketches i properly laughed at 1! And only because Christopher Mintz Plasse who's Red Mist from Kick Ass was in it. I mean he is a seriously funny guy. And in this one sketch Chloe Grace Moretz is there too, who is Hit Girl in Kick Ass! I'm a huge Kick Ass fan so I hated how they were only in a sketch together to cash in on Kick Ass's success. Another reason why this is a bad film is because it's not funny, all of the jokes are about feces, farts, vomit, urine, sex and even more farts. Well not all of them, there's probably about 5 which are proper non Adam Sandler jokes and aren't totally disgusting. (When I say 5 that's not a definite I didn't stop to count. Why? Because it's a s**t film that's why)! When you use a scatological joke in a movie it's alright if there are other actual jokes to back them up. Like in Superbad they balance toilet humour and clever jokes perfectly so it remains funny. But in this, there are so many stupid (written by 5 year olds) jokes that it's not even the slightest bit amusing. Maybe if you live in a mental asylum and you find stupid jokes absolutely hilarious. Then I strongly recommend this to you, but if you live in the real world with me and the 96% of critics who didn't like this on Rotten Tomatoes then you will hate it.I'll start off at 10 and minus 5 points for all the jokes being stupid and unfunny. Then minus 3 points for Hugh Jackman having balls on his chin. But plus 1 point for Chris Mintz Plasse and Chloe Grace Moretz appearing in the movie. So I give MOVIE 43 (lets just nickname it pile of crap) I give this pile of crap 3/10 and 1.5 stars. Do not watch this unless you enjoyed Jack and Jill and (not or) was hit round the head very hard as a baby. Luke Dobson

I had no idea what "Movie 43" was when I picked it. I just wanted a diversion for a couple of hours. During the first half hour or so of the film I came close to turning it off three or four times. It was gross, low brow, juvenile and offensive... but then a joke would appear and I'd be laughing. I don't know whether I got used to the movie or it got better, but after that first half hour I was laughing often, sometimes so hard that I had to pause to get my breath. In the end, "Movie 43" was the funniest I've ever seen, including "Up In Smoke".Sure, a lot of people can't stand this kind of film. I almost couldn't stand it myself. But once I let go, I laughed and laughed and laughed.You can criticize "Movie 43" and give it one star, but that doesn't mean anything except that it wasn't for you. All of the marvelous actors in the movie didn't sign up to make a dog, and they didn't; they made a hilarious film of a type that viewers either love or hate.I loved it.

Don't waste your time or money. The movie, if you can call it that, is just terrible. Awful Not funny No plot Waste of time It's what I've come to expect when there are several good actors/actresses in a movie. Which doesn't make a lot of sense. Guidelines won't let me submit review w/o 10 lines..... Horrible Appalling Repulsive Unpleasant Characterless Lifeless Stale Unexciting Dull Uninteresting. Don't watch it. Don't waste ur time the movie is a group of movie plots written by a wanna be writer who holds someone hostage at a movie studio and tries to force him into buying his screen plays by holding him at gun point. So as you can imagine, there's no real plot to the movie. Instead, it's a bunch of short, terrible movie ideas that no one with real sense would put in a decent movie and this was the only way to get the ideas into a movie. Btw, the rule about having to submit reviews with at least 10 lines is ridiculous.

reviews.review_title: Worse than Plan 9 From Outer Space
reviews.content: At least this former movie did not claim to be trying to be good...This film is now my all time favorite worst film because it meets that criteria on every level except maybe for some of the actors and I imagine many never knew that this would be the finished product or would have never have signed up for it.I love fellow Aussie, Hugh Jackman, but "what were you thinking, mate?" Fair dink-um and stone the crows, this movie will haunt you and everyone else involved for the rest of their lives and maybe a few decades beyond that. It is unfunny, tasteless and makes a Benny Hill show look like Shakespeare. I cannot find one redeeming feature except the earnestness of some of the actors.I am sure many have offered good money to have every print of this film destroyed.Sad, sad, sad and even misery could not endure a night watching this catastrophe.

Movie 43 is an enigma. It has famously terrible reviews and the concept of 'searching for Movie 43' is weak and barely ties the movie together. Beyond that it is basically a sketch show and you can decide if each sketch of funny or not.For me, the kid bullied Bullied by his parents is funny, the iBabe stuff is amusing, the ball chin is ok, the defecting is grim and the period and basketball stuff is just offensive.It's a real mixed bag but at times it is so bad it is... ok.
Don't make it a family night movie, don't make it a date night movie, make it a night with the guys kind of movie.

Do not watch this. It is the worst movie I've ever seen and I've seen lots and lots of movies. Double features, too easy, I enjoy triple features. Be wary of anyone who rates it any higher than awful. I think less of everyone in it. The world is a worse place. It may challenge your views on free speech. Should it be illegal? Can we jail those responsible? Perhaps not but it's really bad. So bad, that until I get the chance please add one to my previous reviews. This is a whole new level of awful. It should not have been made. Once it was made it should never have been released. Those implicated should have paid off anyone & everyone to make it disappear.

reviews.review_title: Movie 43 is just awful and an absolute waste of time that makes one shameful of this movie's very existence.
reviews.content: I want to let each and everyone reading this review know that I created this IMDb account for the sole purpose of writing a review for this very movie, Movie43. First, I would like to start by mentioning how the movie trailer is very misleading and provides people with false hope and expectations. From public defecation, to having one's testicles on one's neck, and even incestuous relationships are only a few of the many examples of the dark and rather disgusting sense of humor that along with the imagery of the movie create a rather repellent and false portrayal of sex and other universal themes. Additionally, Movie 43 consists of several unrelated scenes that do nothing in terms of both the plot and characters' development of the movie. This movie is so bad that it has the ability to infect one's nerve cells with both aids and cancer, creating a new type of nerve cells that reproduce at an exponential rate and possess the ability of causing one's IQ level to drop dramatically. If you don't want to waste your precious time and intelligence, then listen to what I and many others have to say about this movie and simply don't waste your time watching it. Every user that claims that this movie is nothing else but absolute rubbish is telling nothing else but the honest truth. There is this saying that seems very appropriate given the main message that I am trying to convey; "Curiosity killed the cat". This saying serves as a warning declaiming to not let your curiosity get the best of you! A great number of people, myself included have fallen prey into this very trap and have made the very mistake of disregarding many of the wise reviews proclaiming that this movies is complete balderdash as it lacks plot development and many more elements crucial to a movie's reputation and watch-ability. Just like Plato, a well known Greek Philosopher said: "A wise person learns from his mistakes! A wiser one learns from others' mistakes!" I hope this review came in handy and opened your eyes to the harsh reality that is Movie 43. I wish each and every one of you the best of luck!!! Trust me, you will need it!!! XD

reviews.review_title: Hit or Miss Sketch Comedy Film
reviews.content: Well this film is really just a movie. Its not great. But its not bad enough to make it unwatchable. This movie has enough jokes (and sketches based off one joke) that it will probably make you laugh or cringe pretty consistently throughout the movie although maybe not very often.The sketches could have been just YouTube videos by themselves and the meta storyline of finding the infamous "Movie 43" is pretty unredeemable. But they fixed it all together and here it is. In your face and raunchy sketch comedy.Worth a watch for the uniqueness but I wouldn't rush to see it.

I should be allowed to put ZERO stars. Not even worthy of one star.
Disgusting Movie. Who funded this? How did they get actors to agree to participate in this embarrassing MESS?
The worst movie I have ever seen in my entire life.

Gross film.Actors and actresses should feel embarrassed of having been part of it.I had to stop the DVD, could not watch more than 15 min.Gross film.Actors and actresses should feel embarrassed of having been part of it.I had to stop the DVD, could not watch more than 15 min.Gross film.Actors and actresses should feel embarrassed of having been part of it.I had to stop the DVD, could not watch more than 15 min.Gross film.Actors and actresses should feel embarrassed of having been part of it.I had to stop the DVD, could not watch more than 15 min.

45 Minutes pain before I escape. All actors one year to Alcatraz. "I don't know what is wrong with the previous reviewer of this movie but apparently he/she is blind, deaf or was reading a book during this movie." YES "It is simply awful." YES "The ideas are completely absurd, uninspired and not at all funny in any way. It's a shame that all these top-name actors are so desperate for money to make such a film." YES " Bigger shame is they won't get a dime! Save your money and your valuable time and don't see this movie!" YES YES YES. Never before I finished watching a movie before it ends. I am still paralyzed. Don't waste your time watching such a trash.

don't go see this movie....EVER!!!!! if you like movies that waste your money and you possibly want to ruin your first date with scenes that will make you and your "companion" uncomfortable, then please watch this movie. I can only assume this movie was made for people who enjoy poo, balls, and cats jerking off to pictures of their owners. now it may seem funny at first but believe me when i say this movie sucked. Now with that said i laughed harder walking out making fun of the movie then i did for the entire one hour and thirty minutes of painfully awkward moments. other then that though it did had a really good cast, even though it seemed like this might of been a movie for them to just let off some steam and not be so serious. DON'T GO SEE THIS MOVIE.....PLEASE.

reviews.review_title: Makes you reconsider Twilight as a good movie
reviews.content: After seeing the movie I just can't help but wonder why all those movie stars agreed doing this? Sitting through the entire movie made me feel very proud, afterward i felt really stupid.The main plot was terrible. I'm not going to explain anything because I don't want people spending their money on this and frankly I couldn't pay attention anymore. The funny jokes you already saw in the preview and since you see them coming a mile away and the movie is an enormous buzz kill you won't even laugh. If you do decide to go to Movie 43, prepare to sit back, yawn, roll your eyes and if you're lucky you have to go to the bathroom twice. I encourage you to get drunk.A special mention goes to Gerard Butler, who as a leprechaun does the best work of his career in a segment so stupid it makes you want to kick every leprechaun you will never see.This was by far the worst movie I've seen in a while.

You have chance in the U.S. because this movie was rated R. In my country, it was restricted to 12 year-old people only ! Could you imagine young people of 12 watching this crap ? It's definitely not cinema, it's money-making process with always the same crude humor dedicated to retarded teenagers. Hopefully, Movie 43 was hated by all critics but I still have a question in mind : how can this type of movie be allowed to release in theaters ? Face to such insanities and deviant footages, why don't the MPAA ban this kind of movie ? In the U.S., associations of child protection should act in order to prevent children and teenagers from watching these movies.

I think folks giving this film a bad review should chill out. This film wasn't made to be taken seriously, and I loved every bit of it.There's much similarities to Jordan Peele's YouTube original, Weird City and I guess that series was somewhat inspired by Movie 43.I really enjoyed Movie 43, and I didn't want it to end.

reviews.review_title: I do have a sense of humour but this was something else....
reviews.content: The British version is very different to the US version, imagine the wrap around story to be like This is The End, and as rotten, and your almost there.Two teenagers try and trick their younger brother into finding an imaginary movie, while they secretly try and put a virus on to his computer. They start to find different movies, but soon they are pursued by some scary looking people who believe that this movie will end the world....It gets two stars for the cast alone, and the Halle Berry/Stephen Merchant segment, because she blows out a blind child's birthday candles (the only funny thing in the film). Otherwise, it really is the pits, believe the reviews, and I'm sorry, if you find this funny, you need to see some Mel Brooks, Marx Brothers, Zucker, and some Ealing movies.Even the Carry on movies are comedy gold compared to this.The makers of this movie must have something on the cast, because there is no way that some of these would have anything to do with this mess.All the regular things, bodily functions, strange requests, and profanity galore are here because hey, that's what makes great comedy.An awful experience, worse than fracturing ribs.

reviews.review_title: Hands down the worst movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: I never write reviews but I really had to for this thing that pretends to be entertainment. Why any decent actor would choose to be associated with this is beyond me. This kind of movie is what's wrong with our society. It touches on absolutely everything that's really really wrong. We hoped that with the cast there would be some redeeming value but there definitely is not. I'm not sure why we have to write 10 lines for a review because I hate to even give it this dignity but it was simply appalling. I'm reevaluating what I think of Kate Winslet, Elizabeth Banks, Emma Stone, Dennis Quaid, Naomi Watts, Liev Schrieber, Josh Duhamel, et al. You really did not need to lower yourselves to this utter trash. PLEASE DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME!! Horrific!!!

As an avid and very frequent movie goer.. Its with great sorrow that I have to tell you this movie made my "Top 5 worst movies" list.. It has no valid point. the "jokes" are absolutely horrible. Why everyone hates it. Couldn't tell you. But then again people think Seth Rogan is talented and that Superbad was a good movie. This is way better.

I can't believe that they would stoop so low for this movie. Don't see it! It will ruin your mind.

This movie is so bad,don't know what to say,i only watched it because of Emma Stone.There were good stars but it's such bad movie i mean it's like "The Expendables" filled with stars but filled with bad lines,only a person under the age of 15 can think this is funny.I do not recommend that you watch this movie if you like good or normal rated movies but if you have time and nothing else to do or just love Emma Stone(like i do)you should watch it,or just if you are under the age of 15.You will be bored to hell while watching this movie,i mean they had a good idea,good stars starring in the movie,but so bad lines,i mean so bad.Yes,the movie is worse than the "Lord of the rings" or every other normal rated movie that has got these great actors,but it's not the worst movie ever seen.Like MaryAnn Johanson said "Oh, this is adorable! Well, I say "munchkins," but it's pretty plain from what these kids did that it was more a "Bring Your 12-Year- Old Son to Work" day I guess just to maintain the typical gender balance in Hollywood".Again i just watched it because of Emma Stone.

reviews.review_title: Seriously? I'm embarrassed for our country and what it is producing.
reviews.content: A mother kissing a son, pretending to be his girlfriend and a father simulating a crush on his son as if he is a male classmate? This movie is sick. I walked out after a woman requested that someone poop on her. I'm so disappointed that Hollywood movie stars would actually agree to star in a movie like this. Really, have they no heart at all? Do they not have children to which they feel responsible? Do any of us believe in God anymore? Everything is such trash now. If it's not graphic violence, it's disturbing nuances on sexuality....and we wonder why people are so "confused" and "messed up" that they would "randomly" bomb people in a marathon where there are innocent people? What about all the innocent eyes watching this filth on the big screen. Keep watching it America. We're going to hell in a hand-basket. Not EVEN in a hand-basket.

reviews.review_title: Know what you're getting into. Let me help you.
reviews.content: STOP!!! Read this before you see this movie! Trust me, I'm looking out for your best interests.MOVIE 43 is similar to two previous films, KENTUCKY FRIED MOVIE, and AMAZON WOMEN ON THE MOON, in that it is basically a series of comedy sketches.One difference between MOVIE 43 and the others is that MOVIE 43 is more vulgar and scatological. The skits are VERY vivid dramatizations of the kinds of dirty jokes teens and old guys tell each other. The other difference is that all of the skits feature big-name stars.It is gross-out humor. If you like that, you'll love the film. If not, you won't. Don't think something like, "Oh, that nice Elizabeth Banks does shampoo commercials and played Laura Bush! She's classy. I'm safe seeing this movie, she wouldn't do anything gross!" EVERYONE does something gross.With that, you have all you need to know whether you will enjoy this movie or not. Good luck :)

I have a weakness for movies like The Kentucky Fried Movie and Amazon Women on the Moon. Big huge paens to MAD Magazine stupidity, they're the cinematic equivalent of Fiddle Faddle to me.Then there's Movie 43, a movie that took a decade-long odyssey to get made, as most studios rejected the script. The end result was shot over a several year period and included some actors who refused to appear and others, like Richard Gere, who worked hard to escape the project.Movie 43 was the brainchild of Charles B. Wessler, whose career goes from starting way down here as a production assistant on the film Can I Do It... 'Til I Need Glasses? - suddenly this is all making sense - and ends up all the way up here by producing Green Book.Wessler then recruited three pairs of directors - South Park's Trey Parker and Matt Stone, Something About Mary's Peter and Bobby Farrelly, and Airplane!'s David and Jerry Zucker - to make a third of the movie each. Yet weeks before shooting, writers Parker, Stone and the Zuckers backed out. The film ended up with thirteen directors and nineteen writers.That said - the movie did make money. $32.4 million on a $6 million dollar budget, yet you have to consider that every single actor was working for scale. Therefore, we can't even comprehend the true budget of this film.What we can calculate is the vitriol and hatred that critics heaped on the film, crowned by it winning worst director, worst picture and worst screenplay at the 34th Golden Raspberry Awards.Peter Farrelly directed the wrap=around story - as seen in the U.S. cut of the film - called The Pitch. Here, a writer not so subtly named Charlie Wessler (Dennis Quaid, and no, I'm not saying "who deserves better" because honestly, everyone involved in this movie deserves better and willingly made this movie) pitches his movie to producer Griffin Schraeder (Greg Kinnear). Somewhere in all of this, Common, Charlie Saxton, Will Sasso and the gigantic dome of Seth MacFarlane all appear.Movie 43 feels like MAD TV the movie. You remember that show? It was the original home of Keegan-Michael Key and Jordan Peele. And all I remember is that the audience would be reacting to the show as if Jesus himself had walked out on set, yet nothing funny ever really seemed to happen. Seeing Sasso in these segments - he was also on the show before he turned his John Madden impression into an industry - reminds me of just how grating those shows were.In the U.K. and the Netherlands, another wrap-around called The Thread posits a world where Movie 43 is the most dangerous film ever made and its discovery destroys civilization. We should all be so lucky. Fischer Stevens shows up, thankfully not as a culturally inappropriate character such as the one he played in Short Circuit, but then again, with bad taste being thrown at you for this movie's entire running time, why they didn't go this route is beyond me.Next is The Catch, which was the scene that was filmed to convince other actors to be in the film. There's one joke: Hugh Jackman has balls on his chin. Somehow, Kate Winslet is in this as well, getting paid around $800 for a role that by all rights would have decimated careers in the past.In Homeschooled, Liev Schirber and Naomi Watts homeschool their child but take it too far. I wish I could tell you there was another joke, but nope. That's the joke.Steve Carr, who fostered such cinematic turds as Dr. Dolittle 2 and Paul Blart: Mall Cop onto screens everywhere as if they were commodes, brings the fecal-obsessed story The Proposition, in which Chris Pratt and Anna Ferris (who were a couple at the time) basically take a dump upon one another.Some day, I'm going to have a chat with Griffin Dunne about making Practical Magic, a movie that I have suffered through numerous times. I'm also going to discuss Veronica, the next segment, whereupon Kieran Culkin and Emma Stone graphically discuss their sex life in a rundown grocery store.Steven Brill, who was the hatchet man called in to reshoot the movie Fanboys by Harvey Weinstein, directed the next sequence called iBabe. Yes, the force that made Little Nicky is here to do an overly long sketch about a robot girl (Kate Bosworth) whose internal fans cut off penises. This is probably the most embarrassing thing Richard Gere has ever done, I said, ignorant of the veracity of that urban legend.Superhero Speed Dating has Justin Long and Jason Sudekis as Batman and Robin, trying to woo Kristen Bell as Supergirl, Uma Thurman as Lois Lane and Leslie Bibb as Wonder Woman. It's a marvel of restraint and timing compared to the rest of the movie.Machine Kids is a throwaway about kids who get stuck inside machines.Elizabeth Banks directed the next part, Middleschool Date, which is a period piece. No, really, it's a drawn-out tale of menstruation starring Christopher Mintz-Plasse, Chloe Grace Moretz and people who only two names like Jimmy Bennett, Patrick Warburton and Matt Walsh.Have you ever wanted to watch Johnny Knoxville and Seann William Scott beat up a leprechaun played by Gerard Butler? Then you must be Brett Ratner and you made the next story, Happy Birthday.Truth or Dare involves, well, truth or dare between Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant. You know, this week of failures has two Halle Berry movies in it. This one somehow beats out Catwoman, which speaks so, so much about this movie.Victory's Glory is directed by Rusty Cundieff, who turns in a cute tale of an all black basketball team against a team of all white guys. Terrence Howard makes it work.Elizabeth Banks and Josh Duhamel are in love, except Josh's cat won't have her in the house in the final story, Beezel. It's animated and James Gunn directed it, but somehow didn't even get to edit the movie.There were some scenes cut, like Bob Odenkirk's Find Our Daughter, which has Tony Shaloub and Julianne Moore as the stars and The Apprentice, a movie in which a mortician has sex with a corpse and brings her back to life. Anton Yelchin, who died before his career could go past the Star Trek films, was in this segment.Comedy is a touchy subject. Not every joke lands. But man, never have so few jokes landed so never, as they don't say. I saw this in the theater and while I laughed at some of the incredulous moments, it soon turned into a clock watching affair. Then again, it was a forced fun team bonding work experience, which never lends toward enjoyment. Subsequently, viewings have only made me dislike this movie so much more.

reviews.review_title: Just another dirty movie, only it has big-name stars.
reviews.content: The first question that comes to mind is "Why was this movie made?" Perhaps the obvious answer is "Money", but there's maybe 10 minutes of worthwhile viewing in the almost 90 minutes of running time. I found this one at my local public library, I usually see whatever they buy, but I would never recommend this to any of my friends. With stars like Dennis Quaid, Greg Kinnear, Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, and many others, you would expect it to be at least a good movie, if not great. But no, it is just one dirty scene after another, some of it sexy dirty, some of it body function dirty. Would a girlfriend really want you to "poop on her" to validate your love? Quaid is a desperate wanna-be movie maker and he is pitching ideas to producer Kinnear. We see the pitches acted out in a series of "shorts." The first is a blind date (Winslet and Jackman) that seems ideal, but as they arrive at their restaurant table and he takes the scarf off his neck, it is revealed that he has a full-size scrotum hanging, in plain view, right below his chin. Everyone knows him, it seems to be no big deal, but his date has a hard time processing what she is witnessing. Very inventive and funny.The other funny scene was "Superhero Speed Dating" where Robin and Lois Lane are meeting up, but Batman shows up to spoil everything, especially when he phones Superman, who shows up in the blink of an eye. Supergirl shows up later. That one was also inventive and funny. As were the fake commercials showing that machines, like ATMs, cola vending machines, and office copiers actually have small children inside to dispense whatever comes out of the machine. But so much of it was just "dirty" for the sake of being dirty and that spoiled most of the scenes.

reviews.review_title: Not funny, only 1-2 segment has potential
reviews.content: This is a movie of small segments of outrageous humor except none of it is funny. The segments are stories being pitched by Dennis Quaid to producer Greg Kinnear.The first main segment has Hugh Jackman with his scrotum hanging off his neck. HA HA HA! You're suppose to laugh at this sight gag from Peter Farrelly. Why? I'm not sure.The second segment has Liev Schreiber and Naomi Watts homeschooling Jeremy Allen White.The third one has Anna Faris asking boyfriend Chris Pratt to poop on her. At least in this one, it is interesting to see some husband and wife chemistry from the usually funny actors.The fourth has Emma Stone battling verbally with grocery store clerk Kieran Culkin. It's curious for about 2 minutes and then the mannerisms get tiring.There are segments of iBabe about music players that look like naked models. It is about the least funny use of hot girls.Super Hero Speed Dating has Justin Long as Robin trying to do speed dating and encounter various other comic book characters. This is probably the one with the most potential. The direction just needs to be better. This was almost good.Then there is the fake PSA where kids are in everyday machines doing the work. Not funny and boring.Chloë Grace Moretz is making out with Jimmy Bennett only to be interrupted by his brother Christopher Mintz-Plasse. Then she starts to have her period. Like so many other segments, this is an one joke premise being stretched way too thin. It could be a funny joke in a better movie. Here it is a cute moment that the actors flail around to try to keep the moment going.Happy Birthday has Johnny Knoxville has captured leprechaun Gerard Butler for Seann William Scott's birthday gift. I think this would be better as a Tale from the Crypt.Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant are on a blind date and they start playing truth or dare. It has a charming rom-com feel to the beginning but turns into tired ridiculous territories.Victory's Glory is a 1959 segment of an all bad basketball team playing an all white team. Terrence Howard plays coach Jackson. It's very repetitive.Then there is a final segment with an animated cat called Beezel. The movie has nothing left and this is just beating a dead cat.The disjointed nature of the movie takes away any way to built any relationships or discover the characters' nature. This is simply shock humor for the sake of shock humor. In the end, the shocks are boring and the humor is lacking.

reviews.review_title: worst movie.. couldn't even finish it
reviews.content: I only joined IMDb to write this review. worst.movie.ever! disgusting.. boring.. no story line.. an all round shocking movie. do NOT waste your time. The trailer was deceitful.. I actually thought there was some sort of story line. My friend fell asleep after half an hr and I had to sneak out of her house to get away from what is by far the worst movie ever made. what a waste of some good actors. horrible. awful. terrible. why do I have to write 10 lines?!!!! ahhhhhhhhhhhh I JUST HATED THIS MOVIE. NO ONE WATCH IT. that is all. nope still not 10 lines...... OK um if you like balls hanging off someones neck to be a main part of a plot then maybe you are stupid enough to enjoy this movie.. otherwise don't bother.

reviews.review_title: Worst movie I've seen. Description and trailer are a lie.
reviews.content: Omg, I'm very open person but for the first time I went out of a movie after 30minutes. Feeling sick. We didn't know what to do with ourselves. Went to a shop to buy anything and everything to reset our brains. :) I just made an account here, only to express that it is simply not fair! I feel cheated. How people can lie so much in the description of the movie. I can't believe those actors took part in it. What a shame. Why? Why! This is only for people who laughs at obscenities and profanity. And defecation. But if you surprisingly don't, it's not funny at all. I was waiting for any story behind it but.. no. There was nothing there.Wait for a DVD or sth if all those negative reviews made you interested. Really don't pay for the cinema ticket. Really.

It's not often I see a movie with so much talent that has so little going for it. I can't say that I went in expecting high quality for a movie released in January, but I really didn't believe that actors like Richard Gere, Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslett, Halle Berry, Emma Stone, et al, could all have elected to be in a film as mind-insultingly bad as this movie was. The problem wasn't that it was a sketch movie - there are sketch movies that are pretty good, see, e.g. Kentucky Fried Movie. The problem wasn't with the crudity, as there have been crude movies that aren't bad. The problem, really, is with the scale of the crassness and crudity. It's brazen, and not in a humorous way. The writing fails, the jokes fail, the acting fails (though Winslett does do well with what passes for the material she's given). The movie is rife with scatological and fellatious "humor," which leaves you wondering why, exactly, you are sitting here watching this dreck. I found myself wondering if there was any redeeming piece to this movie, and, with the exception of Kate Winslett's efforts, and Terrence Howard as a 1950's basketball coach, which is why this movie gets 2/10 from me, there is nothing in this movie that really can be argued as quasi-quality.Avoid at all costs.

reviews.review_title: Complete and utter waste of time
reviews.content: My girlfriend was feeling a bit depressed so I decided to take her to see this "comedy" and now regret every second that I spend watching it.It is one of those movies, which show all the interesting bits in the trailer and then fill up the rest with idiotic stuff. I laughed a bit for 2-3 seconds and then the entire movie was like .. dull. Pointless.Yes, there is a variety of stars appearing in the scenes, but that ain't gonna stop me from trying to make anyone who wishes to see it skip movie day.Much to my amazement (i thought it's just me that feels stupid about it), the entire movie theater looked relieved when the movie ended. From the chat with the others after watching it I found out that nobody liked it.So yeah.. thanks for the waste of time.

Movie 43 sparkled with the promise with being a top class comedy, unfortunately this was definitely NOT the case. After a handful of mildly humorous opening sketches the entire film rapidly declined, becoming a complete shambles with unnecessary vulgarities, violence and a distinct lack of plot. If the seemingly impressive cast suggests to you as it did to me, that Movie 43 would be an outrageous yet classic comedy to rival films such as 'American Pie' then you will be categorically and whole heartedly disappointed. Without a shadow of a doubt one of the most poorly directed, constructed and orchestrated film of it's kind.

I need a sequel for this. Every sketch was amazing and entertaining. I can only imagine how dull the lives are of those who hate on this movie.
If you want a laugh and aren't a bitter person, you should check this movie out.

There is a place for "offensive" humor. South Park, Team America, Amazon Women on the Moon, anything featuring Sacha Baron Cohen - all have their merits in spite of being completely tasteless. Movie 43 has no redeeming qualities whatsoever. It isn't even funny, unless you're stuck at the mental age where anything dealing with poop and/or penises is hilarious. I cannot begin to fathom how or why this abomination was made. Given the writers and the cast, it should have at least been watchable. Was there blackmail involved? Did the writers and cast think this was "edgy"? Did they have a bet that they could actually have the script written by lobotomized monkeys and still get people to see it? Thank goodness I watched it on Amazon and didn't pay for a theater ticket. I'm used to having my intelligence insulted by Hollywood, but this is beyond the pale. No wonder the studios are going broke.
I didn't finish the film because it was badly done, extremely stupid and boring.

It's pretty simple. If you're an older guy who grew up on Kentucky Fried Movie, National Lampoons etc you will most likely find this funny like I did. If you're a millennial and you love dry clever humor you'll probably hate this. I wish more movies were still made like this. GREAT. A shining light in cesspool of lame modern comedy films. Reminds us of the good old days. Highly recommended for those not easily offended.

reviews.review_title: Went to see this thinking it would be like The Kentucky Fried Movie- It's NOT
reviews.content: As a fan of parody/comedy movies from the trailers this looked like it would be OK. My advice- don't watch it in the theaters, don't wait for the video, but if your trapped on a plane and can't fall asleep consider watching it. There are a few funny parts in the movie but certainly nothing that is worth sitting through the entire movie to watch.If you've seen the preview/trailers you've probably seen the best parts of the movie. As others have said the funny parts are funny the way a immature junior high school kid would find "what's grosser than gross?" jokes funny. Those of you that remember "The Kentucky Fried Movie" style of short skits and that genre of comedy may make the same mistake of going to see this movie thinking it's going to be something along those lines. It's not. It's not even close. One positive thing is how they managed to get so many big name actors on-board to perform in the skits is pretty amazing. Had the directors found a better way to tie everything together it might not have been so bad. In the movies defense however there were some genuine moments of laugh out loud funny. Most were in the sense of "that's so disgusting" or "ewww" that you couldn't help but be repulsed and laughing at the same time.

"This is a movie with a weird, dumb, but very interesting concept and i loved it, it's very entertaining, and look at the cast, there's a lot of big cast that i didn't expect in here, it's truly enjoyable and funny, Movie 43 is a movie that just don't take it so seriously and just enjoyed it"

reviews.review_title: Awful movie, people are giving 10's to increase score
reviews.content:
Title says it all. Every human needs to know how utterly horrible this movie is.All the 10 ratings are edgelords trying to falsify the ratings. I love all kinds of humour, the filthiest stuff but this movie is just utter trash.
one good joke at the very end."I got in by giving him head.""Hes not gay is he?""No, hes not. He fought be every step of the way."There skip this garbage

reviews.review_title: In the movie theatre, no one can hear you scream
reviews.content: Movie 43 is just an updated version of Kentucky Fried Movie with bigger stars. There are at least two Oscar winning actresses in it.It is a bad taste gross out film with sex and nudity which would keep adolescents happy. Some of the short skits are a bit hit and miss but they keep on coming.The best sketch is the Batman and Robin one with Robin speed dating. The real bad taste one is Anna Faris asking her boyfriend to poop on her. The most fun one is Hugh Jackman with testicles under his chin that no one notices apart from his date Kate Winslet.It is a film not to be taken seriously.

I have been wondering why no one, including the company that released the film, has given the ACTUAL plot line for this film. The one posted above is even a lie. Here it is: Three kids frantically scour the darkest corners of the internet in a search for a film that doesn't exist.I loved it. It reminded me of Southern Fried Movie and other classic montage comedies of this type. Fans of stoner films. 70's comedy, slapstick, or even the show SNL should get a kick out of this film.As long as your underwear isn't too tight and you're not full of yourself you should enjoy a good laugh with this one. The only complaint I've had was the existing plot line being a blatant lie.

I would pay money to not see this movie. Honestly, these wonderful actors deserve a better plot line and script.I was disappointed that so many of my favorite actors where in it. Its just a disgusting film. In reality, most of the actors were forced to act in this due to legalities and contracts. Also,a good rule of thumb: do not see a movie where the top three words to describe it are the following: shame, embarrassment, and gross-out. Why would a director think it would be a good idea to throw in a scene where parents sexually harass their kid? Regardless of humorous intent, this film is mean. Please do not let your kids see this movie, unless you want to have to deal with the repercussions.

this was not as funny as I thought it was going to be. It seemed to be more about exploring (and breaching) boundaries of behaviour. Observing what people do in embarrassing scenarios. Things you must not do, like have sex with your mum. When you're a kid (female) - thinking of a scenario where you'd die of embarrassment, and in movie 43 it happens.Also taking the mick of just how stupid our society is, and some of the completely brain-dead things that not only get done - but then lots of folks go and do it too. A kind of societal blindness to what's in front of your nose.I found bits of it funny, bits shocking, thought provoking, boring, over the top, interesting.I'm glad I went to see it.

This movie was so bad I created an account here to warn people. I have never seen anything like it. It felt like watching (poor) youtube clips for 2 hours while paying for the privilege.Many of the actors were of the kind whose careers have crashed and will do any movie, regardless of how demeaning the role. And the role in this movie were demeaning. Quite a few of the actors seemed to cringe while acting out some scenes. Hopefully the silver ling of this movie will be the writer/director bring his/her career to a sharp close. Removing themselves from the movie business can only improve things for the rest of us.

reviews.review_title: I don't even know what I just saw
