reviews.content: Alright, I'm gunna spare you the paragraph This movie was god awful I mean, yes this the latest in the line of (unfortunately) high grossing films portraying the ever downwards spiraling of Hollywood, but I mean come on people Each vignette slowly pulled me closer and closer to the power button on my TV, and yet the sheer crudeness of the acting and LSD infused script sat me back down to stomach the best this film industry could give me. What do I have to say? Spare yourself kiddos, this is 94 minutes of my life I could have spent on doing more productive things, like shovel cow manure or kill whatever god forsaken producer decided this would be a well-off production

reviews.review_title: worst film i have EVER seen
reviews.content: I visit the cinema on a regular basis and the trailer for this film looked good as it contained lots of famous people so i thought why not, oh how wrong i was. This film is by far the worst thing i have EVER!seen, the acting was bad the story lines were bad it was crude and just plain awful. I would say to anyone who is going to see this film or wants to DON'T . About 40 minutes in to this diabolical film I had, had enough and just walked out of the screen which i NEVER do. If i wasn't an unlimited card holder and had paid for this movie I would of demanded a refund. Worst film EVER.
Absolutely and horrendously terrible. It took 5 margaritas to get through.

The process that I had to go through in order to leave a review is ridiculous but I want to save all the people who haven't yet wasted their time both paying and watching this awful movie. I WARN YOU ALL IN ADVANCE that this is by far the sh*ttiest film of life. The fact that these famous actors/actresses wasted their time creating this is ridiculous. Its pathetic on their parts and pathetic on the part of the producer who even came up with this stupidity. It may give you a chuckle, but overall, it is the worst movie of time. Such a lack of creativity ... You'll regret going to see it 20 minutes into the movie.. and it only gets worse.. For those of you reading this, I advise you to change your mind. It's honestly sh*t.

Movie 43 is Absolutely Horrible!!! Hands-down could be the worst movie of all time. It was so bad, that I'm actually going online for the 1st time to write a movie review.Here are just a few of the things that made Movie 43 sooooooo f-ing bad, the over all plot, the movie set, the costume design, the lighting, the food services truck and everyone that name was in the credits. Everyone involved in this movie should be ashamed and blacklisted from Hollywood. I mean everyone!!! Including the security guards at the studio that let these people on the lot to make this film.I would highly recommend that you avoid this movie, like you would avoid herpes. That's probably not a good analogy. Since herpes would probably be more enjoyable then having to see Movie 43.

reviews.review_title: Very smart modern comedy that may not look that way to unprepared audience
reviews.content: Movie 43 is really not your typical comedy. It starts very aggressively immediately giving a shock to audience with some of the most insane scenes involving top Hollywood actors ever shown in cinemas (Hugh Jackman scene is the one I am talking about). All jokes here are Very aggressive and some sweet girls (or boys) would definitely find themselves unprepared and may even leave the cinema. Movie 43 contains short unconnected stories (what we could derive from trailer), which use different typical social settings. Each story is filled with jokes that may appear to be "out of boundaries" or "too stupid/harsh" or something to someone who is willing to only look at them this way. However while you are laughing your a#$ off or thinking "omg did they really say that" (depending on how you choose to perceive this movie) it is important not to forget to be thinking about each story, and actual idea or message behind it. Two things that are common about stories is that they cover some challenging but well known to anyone social topic and that they use a lot of dangerous jokes and 18+ words/scenes. I believe most important topic of movie 43 skit is approach to tolerance and some "real" principles of "good" and "bad", definitions which become more and more blurry as we move in 21 century. With the right words mass media can help its audience to view any problem from desired angle, essentially making black white and vice versa. Here we can see that there definitely has to be a limit to acceptable, allowed or reasonable behavior and some things actually are not acceptable, should not be allowed or tolerated. When you try to challenge someones view on those topics usual words may not be enough due to depth of someones beliefs, but artistic instruments from Movie 43 arsenal can actually deliver those messages in a very clear and straightforward manner.All in all Movie 43 will definitely split audience. Some will say that they have never seen more stupid, "shit humor" comedy, while others will really enjoy the form and elegance and actual wit and depth of the movie.It probably wouldn't work at all if those star actors weren't there, people would simply not watch it past couple of scenes.I suggest people who go to watch Movie 43 to open their mind a little bit, prepare to be challenged at some of their core values and have some really good time. If you aren't ready to look for forest behind the trees you probably wouldn't enjoy it.Its definitely an outstanding movie and there aren't many like it around so I really think it is a must see.

I have only walked out of 2 films in my life and this was one of them.Me and my partner only watched about 45 minutes before I turned to her and said "I'm leaving!". This wasn't the comedy I was promised in the trailer (which looked quite funny) and did I find it funny? No, I didn't! The first sketch is about a man who has a pair of balls on his throat. Slightly humorous and watchable, although it becomes tiresome! Second sketch is about two people saying something together but one says something bizarre. Is it some hill billy misunderstanding, a play on words? Nope it's not and starts setting a trend.The third sketch about home schooling starts off fairly funny but they take it too far. It's simply not funny at the end and the downward trend continues! The super hero dating could be brilliant but when Lois starts talking about superman's explosive man muck, it sets the tone! The only funny bit is where supergirl talks about Batman hiding under the table, ruined by pointless text about her nether regions! Ibabe sketch was pointless, could have been funny but ruined by the desperate need to show naked women bits.The last sketch in which we walked out after was the young girl having her first period. Yes I see what they tried to do but it wasn't funny at all!! The film claimed to offend but it wasn't... Jimmy Carr is offensive! You could see the 'funny' situations in each sketch but every time it was ruined by the need for vulgarity, crassness and nudity. If you were a 12 year boy who finds poo, boobies and lower girlie parts funny then they will prob enjoy this. I am 35!

reviews.review_title: One of the worst movies I have ever seen
reviews.content: This movie urged me into writing a review, hopefully by helping the rest people not to fall in the same trap and waste their time. While watching it in the cinema you could actually see people walking away halfway through the movie and I don't blame them at all. Bringing together all these famous actors in a movie was not enough. It starts with a kid searching through the net to find a movie named 'movie 43', and keeps finding random videos of the 10-minutes stories it shows. The key points let's say from the first video was a boy being home-schooled, bullied and harassed by his parents. His first kiss was his mum...how funny. All in all, a pointless movie without any sense of actual humor.

Movie 43!!........what the hell did i just see?! Movie 43 is a film i am not going to explain the plot of this movie because i don't want to put you through that kind of pain. In fact i can't explain the plot because there IS NO STORY TO IT!! This movie purely makes me angry. Whenever i think about it i personally feel angered on the inside. Movie 43 is filled with every problem that movies. The biggest problem with this film is the content is absolutely disgusting! As i said i won't spoil it because if you haven't seen it i don't want to make you know a thing about this complete piece of garbage. As Richard Roeper said about this film "The Citizen Kane of Awful" That what should be on the poster. In case you haven't seen this just take my word when i say THIS IS THE WORST MOVIE I HAVE EVER SEEN!!!! I have seen many movies throughout my life and this is easily the worst. A comedy with not a single laugh that is made to steal your hard earned money from your pocket. Movie 43 is WRONG.

This was a terrible movie, i can not believe i spent the money on going to see it. If i was at home i would of turned it off after ten minutes. I really did not know what to make of it, i was so confused, having to reintroduce yourself basically into a new movie due to the amount of short clips. clips that had no relevance to each other! They could have made an awesome movie out of just one of the sketches, for example they took the kid who was home schooled and made that into a full length movie it would of been hilarious! but no, you got 5 minutes, then confusion again. Nothing funny happened at the start which related to the end, I've never seen a movie like it. oh, and beezel or whoever, the cat with a crush, was just wrong. whoever rated this movie a 15 was out of there mind, if i went to see this movie at 15 i would of ripped my eyes out. Utterly terrible. The trailer was so misleading, I complained the whole way home about it and made a IMDb account just to write a review on this movie. The only reason I'm not saying its the worse movie I have ever seen is due to the actors, who I pity, due to their now ruined reputations. Please don't go see this movie :)

Rating: **** Out Of ****. Rated R For Srong Pervasive Crude And Sexual Content Including Dialouge, Graphic Nudity, Language, Some Violence And Drug Use.1hr 37min/97min.73 uses of the F-word.What is it that makes critics turn away in disgust at Movie 43? Is it because it's not funny? Is it because it's vulgar? Is it because it's tasteless? Yes. Critics turn their noses at this film because they can't have fun. I went into this film expecting nothing but pure garbage. When I came out I was pleasantly surprised. The film is a sketch comedy film. People often compare it to The Kentuckey Fried Movie, Amazon Women On The Moon and The Groove Tube. However the way critics are treating it remind me of a terrible sketch comedy film from 1999 called The Underground Comedy Movie. That film had terrible sketches that felt like work to sit through. This film makes me feel joy-us that I sat through it. Is it a perfect movie? No. But it is a fun movie to sit down and have a good laugh.The film has a wraparound story to tie all of these sketches together. This is called "The Pitch". Charlie Wessler (Dennis Quaid) is an aspiring screen-writer. He takes his new script to Griffin Schraeder (Greg Kinnear) and pitches him his script which are the sketches in the film. When Griffin doesn't want to listen to his script anymore, Charlie pulls out a gun and threatens to kill him unless he listens to the rest of his script. If you live outside of the United States, then you got a sketch called "The Thread". This features a group of three teenage boys who want to search for the most banned film ever made, following the 43rd rule of the internet which is, "You can find anything you are looking for as long as you keep looking". The first sketch is called "The Catch". Beth (Kate Winslet) is going on a blind date with the city's most eligible bachelor Davis (Hugh Jackman). Ther's only one problem. Davis has a scrotum hanging from his neck, to which only Beth acknowledges."Homeschooled" has a group of parents (Naomi Watts and Leiv Scheiber) Who feel that their homeschooled son (Jeremy Allen White) is not in a normal high school environment unless he has all of the negative aspects rolled right in. "The Proposition" Features Anna Faris who wants her boyfriend (Chris Pratt) to defecate on her because she is a coprophilliac. "Veronica" has Veronica (Emma Stone) having a loud, rude and vulgar conversation with her ex-boyfriend Neil (Kieran Culkin) over the intercom of Neil's store. "The Proposition", By the way has a very ending, if you know what I mean.﻿In "iBabe" Richard Gere plays the head of a company that makes a music player in the form of a naked woman. However they have problems with it when boys try to have sex with it and get hurt due to a fan in the womans (whistles). They decide to move the vent to the ear. "Superhero Speed Dating" has Batman (Jason Sudekis) and Robin (Justin Long) are at a speed dating event to try and defuse a planted bomb. "Middleschool Date" Has a boy (Jimmy Bennet) and a girl (Chloe Grace Mortez) on their first date. But the date goes awry when the girl starts having her period and neither the boy, his brother (Christopher Mintz-Plasse) or his father (Patrick Warburton) Know the proper thing to do. In "Happy Birthday" Pete (Johnny Knoxville) gets a leprachaun (Gerard Butler) for a birthday present to his buddy Brian (Sean William Scott) But alls not well when the Leprachauns brother (also Gerard Butler) shows up.In "Truth Or Dare" Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant are playing a game of Truth Or Dare to make themselves more comfortable, but the game rapidly gets out of hand. "Victory's Glory" Has a basketball coach (Terrence Howard) coaching his all black team to victory in the year of 1959. The last sketch is called "Beezel" which has a 2D animated cat getting in the way of the relationship of Elizabeth Banks and Josh Duhamel. The film has a lot of jokes that hit but the humor in the film is questionable. I love films that take risks and is a big, giant "Screw You" to Hollywood. Actors can get stereotyped. This film proves that actors can be vulgar yet funny while doing it.

This movie is the Aristocrats joke put to film....that is the only thought I had watching this movie....which would not end.If I'm right with this being the Aristocrats joke....it is missing Gilbert Godfrey, and Bob Sagat... They did the joke better.Strange movie...very strange...and I'm now I'm being forced to add another few lines to my review...which can not end either...Right now I'm watching Elizabeth Banks beat a cartoon cat, then get attacked, and stabbed by a group of kids.....Is it over now??? potentially....The credits are rolling.......it is so much like a car accident I wish I'd read the reviews before spending $3 on this movie for rent....Bob...Gilbert....why did this movie have to get made?? make it stop....
Don't waste 94 minutes of your life on this rock-bottom so called movie. This is not a bad movie, it's even worse.

I understand that everyone has different tastes. I understand that some people might enjoy serious, thought provoking films while others might enjoy the movies that are ridiculousness enough to make you laugh. It's even possible to like a mixture of these. But this is appalling.There is a difference between mindless, silly comedy that is just so out there that you can't help but belly laugh for hours and a couple of hours of absolutely disgusting nonsense. This was just disgusting, lacked any sort of direction and was a waste of a good cast. I was interested in this movie because of the star studded cast. I kept watching praying it would get better but it didn't.Maybe it was just something I didn't understand or see in the movie, I don't know. But my personal opinion (which I know not everyone will agree with) is that it is rubbish. I hope people don't waste their money or effort to watch it.

What the hell did I just watch. That's what I first thought when I finished watching the movie. That was with no doubt the most absurd and senseless movie I have ever seen. There is not a second in which the movie attempts to portray any glimpse of sense. Every aspect of this movie can be criticized. At a very few circumstances one may suspect that the movie twists into some form of coherence, but all of a sudden it goes back to the no-sense premise.However, I honestly could not stop laughing throughout the entire film.This is with no doubt, a ridiculous movie, but it's not bad made. It serves its purpose perfectly. At no time the movie tries to distance itself from the absurd. Beholding the greatness of this absurdity, one waits desperately for the movie to provide a coherent explanation. But this explanation never comes. This is why this delirious comedy is a success.Most reviews are all-out mortifications of this movie that try to find sense and coherence, when the whole point is that there isn't any. However, if you don't find this absurd delusions funny, then this movie will be hell for you, because that is all there is in it. In my case, I found it absolutely hilarious. And if you are into this kind of black- ironic-absurd humor, then this movie will blow your mind.

reviews.review_title: Idiot, horrific, pointless and yet so much fun!
reviews.content:
This film is essentially if Family Guy did live adaptations of Peter's day dreams. Completely insane, but shocking in their own ridiculously funny way. Don't take the negative reviews too seriously, even the idiots that thought they could write a synopsis for the film couldn't even match the creators name and blamed it on other people in their bitterness.
This film is a laugh! WARNING - You need a sense of humour in order to laugh at this film. Might seem obvious, but some people missed the memo.

I'm in my 40s and my daughter is 18 and together we laughed uncontrollably throughout this ridiculous adventure. We don't care that that we had no idea what was going on, all that matters is that we were wholeheartedly entertained for the duration of the movie, even if some of the humour played with the boundaries of "how far is too far". As two women, we found the menstrual cycle short absolutely hilarious. We're not silly enough to be offended by something that is obviously a parody of the way men cope with periods. The whole thing was a refreshing, confusing and unexpected journey that made us laugh our arses off.

This show was horrible! Nothing redeeming or funny about it. The funny parts were the ones shown on the trailer. So maybe three minutes out of an hour and thirty-seven minutes. We left at an hour. Thanks Warren Theaters for refunding our money. They didn't have to...but they weren't surprised to have anyone asking for a refund.We love silly, stupid humor. I.E. Monty Python, Airplane (roger, Roger), even American Pie got a few laughs. We were hoping for that kind of funny. But there was very little that was funny in this show. It was very uncomfortable to watch and more than a little sad that actors of such name were involved in it. Don't Waste Your Money!!!!

reviews.review_title: Misleading trailer and worst movie I've ever seen
reviews.content: I've never written a review on anything but this i think needed my opinion and next time I buy a movie i will look up the reviews!!! My husband and I were looking for a movie to watch this evening and came across this one on his x box. We watched the trailer and thought it looked hilarious! We couldn't rent it so we had to buy it but we thought it looked so funny we would watch it again so why not? Paid $15 dollars for 90 minutes of crap. It didn't tie together and i understand that was the point of it but I there was no sign of that in the trailer at all. I will admit some parts were funny but we didn't understand most of it and all the parts that were funny were already in the trailer. I am very surprised all of those stars were in it. I'm very disappointed!!

If this film had starred and been made by a middle school class, it would be a triumph. It is funny in the way farts are always funny, but the thing I couldn't quite get my head around was how it could have been made. How do you get an mostly 'A' list cast to show up for this sort of puerile sketch humor?My guess is that there's some rich Hollywood wannabe funding some charismatic kid who got snowballing attachments based on the concept, and that folks committed to a day then were professional enough to turn in the work even after they finally saw the script.A documentary deconstructing the development of this would be hilarious, a sort of IRL Bowfinger with stars musing on the development process and consequences of selecting material.

reviews.review_title: this is what you call a "try hard" failure
reviews.content: move enlisted lots of a-list stars, however fell on its face with over the top horrible production, goofy stupid and groan inducing shorts, that are just not funny. movie tries hard to get a laugh out of you, but really its just a horrible collection of poorly written skits, that very well could have been written by the pot head losers that starred in this movie. do not see this movie."it was awful" simply put, go watch any other comedy or goofy movie out there and it will be better then this garbage. 4.2 is a generous rating for this trash.this is the kind of garbage you can expect to see online, the acting wasn't even good, special effects poor, and most of the skits were not funny in the slightest.

reviews.review_title: This is a HUGE disgrace to the entire MOVIE INDUSTRY
reviews.content: THIS MOVIE IS SO SO DEGRADING TASTE makes me wanna sign up IMDb account and write this review!!!Whoever gave this SH*T so high rating or positive comment IS ONLY BECAUSE THEY WORK FOR THIS F**KING LAME SH*T PROJECT!!!! OR THEIR BRAIN TISSUE IS EATEN UP BY A FLESH EATING BACTERIA WORST THAN RETARDED!!!!!!!!Please do not waste any films and people's time to make this kind of awful movie again, okay? I beg those poor stupid film makers change your job! Stop poisoning our mind and eyes! Good taste vulgarity is not executed like this. You guys don't have the talent, then DON'T do it. I rather you make a mediocre comedy than making this... Those screenplay writers must smoke pot while writing. I don't even want to call it a movie.This is just a huge assemble of low taste clips.

I bought the DVD judging from the cast that it would be an "acceptable" movie... but no! I must say that the most disappointing part in this movie is the actors... I thought I could trust their taste. I can't believe they actually accepted to be a part of this yuck movie! I mean Kate Winslet, Gerard Butler, Hugh Jackman.. what were you thinking? do you realize that you disgusted us with those unfunny pervert sketches? yes pervert! I could not even smile I had this "yuck" expression on my face all the time! I watched it through just to find out who are the lame actors who participated in it... this is the last time I'll see them on screen I guess. very disappointing!

I have watched this 4 times over the years, what a hoot!! stupidly funny if you just relax and lower your expectations, however the presence of the A list cast is what makes it funnier, why would Richard Gere agree to talk about teenage boys having sex with machines?? I am baffled why it has been so poorly thought of, childish immature, slapstick funny. Its along the lines of Hot Shots, Airplane or Flying High, Police Academy or any parodies, which of course can rate lowly but still entertain and summon a laugh. My recommendation, chill out and sit back and have a laugh.
No story bad acting just some awful scenes that aren't even connected not funny at all I had a hard time watching it

This movie has NO plot at all it is seriously lots of sick scenes jumbled together without making any sense AT ALL. They talk about Pooh's a lot and period jokes, there were a couple of scenes that were so gross I closed my eyes and covered my ears..don't watch it. I was DYING to see this for so long now I am disappointed...wait for DVD peoples trust me. there was at least 20 people in the cinema and 45 minutes into the movie it was me my friend and a couple of other people left..IM NOT KIDDING. it was that bad that half of the people in the cinema left. I don't know 1 person that actually enjoyed this. I work at a cinema and I m URGING people not to watch this. SAVE YOUR MONEY PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF GOD.

reviews.review_title: A new low in the movie industry
reviews.content: I never wrote any review in my life, but I registered to review this one because I really need to get the anger out of my system. This is the sickest movie I've ever seen. I walked out of the theater in a very bad mood. My number one question is how this movie ever got out of the studio? Did anyone put a gun at the producer? What were those big name actors thinking? I was baited to this movie by those big names. Well, shame on them! I really wonder who would think this movie is funny. I was so disgusted by all the low class sickening offending bad jokes they try to make. This movie is so bad that I feel I will be haunted by this movie for a while. It probably takes another 10 really good movies to wash this bad memory away. Please do yourself a favor, don't go to see this movie!

reviews.review_title: try to avert your eyes from this mess
reviews.content: So-called comic anthology isn't so much a movie as it is a sloppy, discombobulated series of skits, each reeking of desperation and landing with a thud as blind dates, fetishes, social media, homeschooling, and product marketing are jumbled together in a tasteless attempt to generate laughs, and yet somehow it managed to reel in an A-list cast! The question is how so many good actors agreed to appear in such a foulmouthed, haphazard display of bodily fluids, lame stereotypes, weak parody, homophobic and racial slurs, perverse animation, etc., which grow more agonizing the longer this goes on...one can only presume they had no actual idea what they signed up for; infantilized, scatological clunker plays out like a series of badly written, readily rejected SNL sketches. *
I was looking for a silly distraction, I wasn't really sure about this film, but I'm so glad I put it on because I found I ended up finding it so funny xD

I love offensive comedy. MOVIE 43 is a very good one.(Not for easily Offended People) Funny, Original, outrageous,tasteless, sophomoric,mean-spirited,no holds barred comedy that will have you leaving the theater wanting more.I'm already ready for the next one if they decide on (Part 2). The audience definitely enjoyed the movie i could tell by some of the gasp, and nervous laughter. Its more enjoyable than a regular Hollywood comedy where only about half of the movie is funny. This film is funny for the duration of 90 min. The film is actually 12 short comedy films intertwined into one film. You just never know what the next joke will be. Of course, not for people that are easily offended. This film will deal with any subject matter to get a laugh. Very effective.One story deals with Halle Berry Playing Truth and Dare with her date. Another deals with a teenage girl having her first period......

This movie was just terrible. I don't even have other words. For starters there's no plot whatsoever. It's just a bunch of stupid skits all strung together. I didn't even make it through the whole thing.

The movie is incredibly crude and offensive as you can somewhat witness from the reviews. Some people can't take a joke or are easily offended and if you're one of those people then please, don't waste your time. But there are some really great "wtf" laughs. The acting is of course amazing, and I personally believe that the story line, although seemingly nonexistent, is also a great work of art, no matter how random and arbitrary it is.I love this movie. it's not a movie for anyone under the age of say 15 or over the age of 35, unless you too have that sick sense of humor most young adults and teens have. I loved it,that's my take. Hope I helped.

reviews.review_title: This is the WORST movie I have ever seen. In my whole entire life
reviews.content: If I were acting in this movie, I would be embarrassed.This movie is awful, completely stupid, made NO SENSE whatsoever. I actually feel ticked off that I wasted an hour and a half of my life on this. The previews are terribly misleading, they show the only semi funny parts of the entire movie in the previews. I like raw comedy like family guy, will Farrell movies, Adam Sandler movies, snl, parody movies, Austin powers movies... I'm just like speechless over this movie. It's that badIm surprised at how many a-list stars took part in this terrible movie. Please don't waste your time or money on this movie.... It's just awful.

If you looked at the list of stars in this film, you'd think it is one of the greatest movies ever made: Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, Dennis Quaid, Greg Kinnear, Anna Faris, Common, Seth MacFarlane, Naomi Watts, Liev Schreiber, Emma Stone, Kieran Culkin, Richard Gere, Kate Bosworth, Jack McBrayer, Aasif Mandvi, Justin Long, Jason Sedeikis, Uma Thurman, Kristen Bell, John Hodgman, Leslie Bibb, Katrina Bowden, Chloe Grace Moretz, Patrick Warburton, Gerard Butler, Seann Willian Scott, Johnny Knoxville, Halle Berry, Stephen Merchant, Terrence Howard, Elizabeth Banks, Josh Duhamel. In reality, however, it is incredibly bad.It was really just made to gross people out. The first two stories are bad enough to stop you watching any further. However, there are some funny stories among the crap. The Batman & Robin, iBabe and basketball stories were quite clever and funny and if the whole movie was like those the movie would have been OK.Has its moments, but mostly utterly crap.

reviews.review_title: I thought it would be good.
reviews.content: First you need to know that I don't care for any reviews. Many of my all time favorites are badly reviewed movies so I didn't care with what I've read before watching it.The problem is that it was nothing like I was expecting. I was expecting stupid jukes, yeah, but not a awkward and idiotic main story and 5 or 6 independent sketches that are presented in the trailer. I can't understand how so many talented and experienced people could thought this was fun and went through with it.My advice? Watch the trailers as much as you can and you will laugh (all the funny parts are there) because the movie is, in my opinion, plain bad.Cheers

reviews.review_title: Registered just to save you from this garbage
reviews.content: I registered just to save you from this garbage This is without a doubt the worst movie I have ever seen.I never saw so many people leaving the theater during a movie.After half an hour the theater was half empty! The only reasonable part of the movie was after the credits.Do not watch this crap it is a waste of your time.They tried to make a controversial movie but didn't succeed one bit.How can anyone think this is funny? Even do we had some drink we still didn't even chuckle at the "jokes" in this film.I was flabbergasted that this movie even scored this high.

reviews.review_title: What a strange set of sketches... 2/10
reviews.content: Review: This is a really strange movie which is built up with various sketches with famous actors. People should just watch it for the shock factor, which doesn't necessarily mean that all of the sketches are good, but they are definitely something that you haven't seen before. I am amazed that actors like Richard Gere, Hugh Jackman, Halle Berry etc, actually agreed to do the movie because, as a whole, the film is quite silly and immature. I mist admit, I did laugh at some of the sketches but you do have to take the movie lightly to get it. The whole concept of why they are looking at the sketches, is ridiculous but you can't fault it's originality. You will be playing some of the sketches to your friends just to see there faces, which is why I gave it a couple of stars, even though its completely crazy. Strange!Round-Up: I must admit, I was anxious to see this movie because I didn't understand how they were going to put the cast together, but after seeing the Hugh Jackman & Kate Winslet mad sketch, I knew what road the whole movie was going to take. There are a lot of takes from other movies, which you have to watch out for, and the bonus sketch on the DVD is worth a watch. In all, you really have to watch it to get it because a movie review is not big enough to explain the madness in the film.Budget: $6million Worldwide Gross: $30millionI recommend this movie to people who have a warped sense of humour and the like movies that are built up by various sketches. 2/10

This film is embarrassing. I felt so bad for the actors while i was watching it. I Love all those actors and it's terrible to see them in such stupid, vulgar not funny situations. It's traumatic. I hope to erase those images of my memory. Saying "sh*t di*k sper*" every 2 words doesn't make a comedy it makes a sh*ty embarrassing movie. While watching 2 things happen: first i was wondering if it wasn't better to run away and secondly I was wondering ...how?? how could this sh*tty ideas could go through all the process of making a film to end up to a screen. How?? And i finally got the answer at the end of the credit: The Farrelly it's-time-to-go-back-to-the-white-room Brothers thank "everybody who has dirty thoughts". So i think they have sold this package of sh*t with a freedom speech on the rights of thinking differently. Except that if, in deed, everybody has dirty thoughts, everybody don't make a film out of it without any artistic transformation!!! This freedom speech is a fraud to allow them-selves to be freely gross. To summarize it i'll say: Run away from this film and save time and money!!
How and why this movie happend ? there is not a good thing in this so called movie

This is a crappy film that tries to combine bunch of crappy skits into a movie with the main story going on as an excuse. It's like the makers of this movie just thought up an idea to make a malicious, messed up, grotesque, repulsive and vulgar into a comedy that just isn't funny. And this movie has a lot of messed up moments but it's just not funny. Few parts is I guess slightly humorous but the rest of it is just trash. And the origin of how this movie got started is laughable. Especially since I thought this movie might have a chance because of all the well known actors and actresses that are in it. This movie is just not worth the time, go see "42" instead.3.3/10

I had to register here to post this review...Well, if you want to enjoy nice and soft comedy - don't choose this movie, or you will be disappointed.This movie is a very intense compilation of dark comedy, mixed with border-line erotica. I can't explain why, but this movie reminded me both an "American Pie" (first one) and "Sin City", although it's neither of those. My guess is - "Movie 43" is an artistic protest against modern life and modern cinematography.My opinion is that "Movie 43" is a very strong movie, and you will definitely enjoy it if you can remain open-minded while watching it.

I love this movie. Not every skit. But the moments in certain stories I enjoy I'm over the top laughing. I can watch the basketball skit over and over and.... over. Okay maybe I'm crazy. Two thumbs up.

reviews.review_title: Funny In Some Parts, Just Disgusting in Others!
reviews.content: Movie 43 is a better movie than all the people who have been ripping on it. It's filled with gross-out gags, some that are actually clever. I would also like to praise the unique idea of how this film was formatted into a bunch of segments. I'm not sure if that worked out entirely though. As for these segments, some were great and funny. But others were just plain awful and very disgusting. My favorites were the homeschooled and the middle school shorts as well as the leprechaun short. But I despised most of the others especially the robin/batman one and the Hugh Jackman one.As mentioned earlier, this film is just a bunch of segments running together. There isn't much of a plot, but it seems like it's about a guy who went to a movie exec to pitch his movie, but this movie very offensive and something no one has ever seen before.I have no idea how they managed to get this kind of cast for this kind of film. I guess it was cool watching many of these A-listers make fools out of themselves for an hour-and-a-half, but eventually it does grow old.Overall, Movie 43 doesn't live up to it's incredibly negative hype, but it's nothing to bring home. I managed several chuckles and even some full blown-out laughs. I liked how this film managed to push boundaries and I found it gleefully offensive, but perhaps it went a little off the deep end. But for every good laugh in this film, there are two or three awful jokes and that's not good. But then again, it could have been worse. I rate this film 6/10.

Idk how this got such low reviews. It's not a great movie, and it wasn't trying to be.If you like random comedy: this is a good one. To be fair, it's not a gem, but well worth the time. Definitely will get a laugh or two. Also, getta see Hugh Jackman teabag his own food. 😂

reviews.review_title: Stuck up pansies need not review.
reviews.content:
I'm a 49 yr old woman with a conservative background and I can not understand why people don't see the extreme hilarious humor this movie is all about. It is so far out of left field whomever wrote these stories really let it swing. Thank God for Sick Effing writers. I agree wholeheartedly with another reviewer. I live Will Ferrell. But how many gags do we have to suffer through that we started to actually believe it was comedy? The audience is SO CONDITIONED that anything outside their tight little boxes is considered offensive?? Grow up for God's sake. Watch it with the idea that this is all done tongue in cheek and making fun of entertainment today. Like Jim Morton says - sure Tarantino is entertaining and THIS is offensive??
If you think you have a sense of humor - you'll know if you watch this and laugh. If you are offended and DONT laugh? You. Are. The. Problem.

reviews.review_title: This story sure jumps around a lot . . .
reviews.content: . . . and I'm not sure it all makes sense. For zamplers, did the megashark bite the girl on the left in the black swimsuit in half cuz she was wearing some brand other than tampax that still leaked, or was tampax trying to do one of those pubic service announcements telling customers that if they had any OLD tampax they had better to get rid of them before gointa swim in any oceans where there might be sharks an such, seeing as how the older models were prone to leaking, in tampaxes official view (now that they have the newer ones available; slogan "tampax: they no longer leak)? It said in the credits at the end of this show (and i mean the credits that come AFTER Elizabeth Banks tries to kill her husband's pet cartoon cat, which was about 15 minutes of MOVIE 43 that 8 of the 11 people at my showing MISSED, cuz there was 5 minutes of credits and THEN the movie started up again with no warning from the theater cleaner-uppers or anyone!) that there were 2 product placement people for MOVIE 43, which I assume means this is a REAL message from the tampax people they want to get out there to save some girls in real life (and ta sell more plugs, of course).P.S.--Does anyone know where to watch the first 40 movies in this series?

This is far from a typical comedy that most people will be used to.It's not American Pie or a rom-com.It's an art form that is funny in a very dark fashion and while some segments are better than other, it is till funny - even when it is rudely sick.I've co-written a comedy movie like this many years ago, so I know how this plays out and what it takes to make the skits work.I found it funny, not that I will view it over and over again, nor will I call it anywhere in my favourites, because it's not.It still is far better than one of the movies I've seen a few days ago, which I can never say was written with any thought to it and was just stupid to all proportions...unintentionally.Most of you will never enjoy this movie, because you have been brainwashed into liking TV shows like "FRIENDS" and "Sex and The City" reruns - and you think that is what comedy is...Well this is comedy, without the laugh track. It's written well, but it's not for everybody. In-fact, even though it's written well, it's still not great or even good...because it's so off the usual which what we are accustomed to.All I can say is, it's crafty and I'm glad that I didn't have to pay to see this - otherwise I too would be bashing it more than I did.

I will keep this short and to the point:I wish I had read the reviews here before deciding to go catch a movie. This must be one of the worst movies I have ever seen. There was probably 2 funny lines in the whole movie.The format of the movie is good, many stories crammed into a movie, but the stories were too ridiculous, and clearly not funny. I cannot understand why some of the better known actors took part in this movie.I have a warped sense of humor, but I feel totally ripped off. The group I was with all felt the same way.Do not waste your time or money seeing this one.

reviews.review_title: I gave this movie a 2 because I laughed twice
reviews.content: But I think that was overly generous. Don't get me wrong, I enjoy lowbrow humor but this movie is just absolute trash. Some other reviewers compared it to American Pie or Something about Mary - those movies were absolute comedic masterpieces in comparison to this. It's not funny, it's certainly not clever and it has absolutely nothing to say - don't waste your time.

reviews.review_title: Actually pretty funny, but pretty gross at the same time
reviews.content: I had heard lots of terrible reviews of this film and seen a few clips. I was intrigued to know why so many Hollywood A listers would star in such a poor film. I wanted to see just how bad it really was. I didn't wan't to spend even a couple of $$ renting this movie, so I managed to borrow it free from the local library. I actually feel quite dirty and ashamed for saying it, but I laughed out loud all of the way through this movie - I really enjoyed it. The movie, is actually not really a movie at all, but a collection of sketches that have no connection with each other. Some are better than others, some cruder than others, but they all made me laugh to some extent. All of the sketch ideas are original, I'm sure you will never have seen them before. I'm not even going to attempt to describe the them, as the shock value is one of the best things about them. All I will say, is the that some of them rely pretty heavily on 'toilet humor' and 'gross out value' and one sketch in particular is pretty bad taste - but still funny. If you don't offend too easily you could do worse than watch this film. 7/10

This is the "Kentucky Fried Movie" or "Groove Tube" for this generation. Normally this type of crude humor is done by unknowns looking to start a career and not by Hollywood's elite looking to end their career. There are numerous skits, most of which concern sex in one way or another. Some are cruder than others, some are out right funny while others you might find disgusting.If you are turned off by crude humor, you should avoid this film. However, if you love the crude humor of modern films, this one will keep you in stitches.Parental Guide: F-bomb and nudity.

reviews.review_title: One true and honest word to describe this horrid excuse of a movie -- Garbage
reviews.content: Movie 43 is the one of the number one, if not the number one, movies that leaves pondering the questions of why so many talented actors of the A-list category to commit themselves for something so abhorrent and exceedingly tasteless as this. This film succeeds as one of the cinematic entities that feels far more like a contest to see far these actors could reach in the level vileness than a coherent story. Everything that transpires within this hour-and-half project is an endless barrage of absurd vulgarity and an unflinching approach at over-the-top gross-out humor, with no efforts on actually making it funny. With the Farelly brothers, Elizabeth Banks, Steven Brill, and many others serving in the director's office, the movie is as raunchy and vulgar as many R-rated comedies go. But it all contributes for the purpose of drenching audiences in its endless shock value, and not for laughter. This film follows an anthology of shorts following the misadventures of a cast including Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, Liev Schreiber, Naomi Watts, Emma Stone, Kieran Culkin, Chloe-Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz-Plasse, Seann William Scott, Gerard Butler, Johnny Knoxville, Hallie Berry, Chris Pratt, Anna Faris, along with other many talented actors who thought were apparently coaxed into committing to this dumpster fire. This series of shorts are presented by a Hollywood screenwriter (played by Dennis Quaid) who tries pitching his scripts to a Hollywood producer (played by Greg Kinnear). But when the producer (unsurprisingly!) rejects his ideas, Quaid goes to extreme measures to convince him to greenlight his projects, one of which involves holding him at gunpoint. This movie, telling a story in a vignette-style that echoes such works like 'Kentucky Fried Movie', suits as the epitome of balls-to- the-walls trashy and offensive to every degree. To add insult to injury, it is quite hard to believe someone would have a fun sitting through the end of this before walking out counting how many brain cells were depleted. That's right! This movie is actually that dumb. Although it is horrifying difficult to determine who would compelled to see things like Kate Winslet going out on a date with Hugh Jackman who has a male scrotum on his chin, Naomi Watts share an incestuous first kiss with her teenager son, Chloe-Grace Moretz plunge into a ridiculous debacle over her first period, Emma Stone and Kieran Culkin engage in a repulsive sexual conversation, or Anna Faris asking her boyfriend to, ahem!, defecate on her; it grows abundantly clear that the directors and writers have zero care of how vile the humor gets and how far they push the boundaries with an excess of toilet jokes, penis jokes, and other such gross-out gags before viewers grow brain-dead. As a whole, the entire story is just embarrassing. While television shows like 'South Park' and 'Family Guy' are no strangers to pushing the envelop with their humor, there is at least sense of cleverness and smart lying beneath the raunchiness, whereas here; these actors only aim to shock value while letting their efforts at evoking laughter crumble to the ground. Seriously, how ugly can you get away with splashing moviegoers with such rancid humor? Come on Hollywood! You are better than that. And the same should be said all of these actors. None of them are funny, none of them are charming, and most importantly, none of deserve to subject themselves to this sort of abuseMovie 43 is a vile, unfunny comedic misfire that boasts no value for laughter and plunges cinema-goers in 94 minutes of lifeless abuse. It is more than safe to say that is marks the absolute low point of every single actor, especially the Oscar winners, in his and her career. There is only thing Movie 43 accomplishes, and that is wiping the bottom of the barrel of cinema.

reviews.review_title: 1 rating is even to much for this film!
reviews.content: This is the first review I have ever written because I usually don't care enough to write anything... but I so Strongly hated this movie and I would hate to see anyone else waste their money on this film. IT IS THE WORST MOVIE OF THE CENTURY, I can NOT believe I spent my hard earned money on this piece of crap of a movie... seriously hands down worst movie I have EVER seen... and I have seen some pretty Awful Films. I left the theater feeling sick to my stomach with the last little short that they played because it was so disgustingly Stupid.I can not believe whoever watched this film before it came out in theaters gave the go ahead for it the be released I really have no other words other than...PLEASE PLEASE PLEASE Do NOT waste your Money or your time... you will be very disappointed.

This movie had no plot but I have to say I laughed the whole time! I really enjoyed it. The cast is incredible. I like the idea of the short stories because It keeps my attention . I am the type of person who loves Half Baked and Zoolander so if you like to laugh you will love this movie .

I haven't laughed this hard since ...can't even remember when I did actually laugh this much, this hard, so much I started coughing violently after only 15-20 mins of movie time. This feels like there was a deep ulterior motive when all this ensemble of top notch actors, writers and directors, decided to make this seemingly extreme raunchy version of a comedy movie. After laughing non-stop for the duration I'm remembered of one thing that contributes to your overall physiological and psychological health: being able to laugh at yourself and to not take yourself too seriously. Maybe that was the point, or maybe the whole thing was born out of a dare or a bet, one thing that's obvious to me at least is that I'm sure EVERYONE involved in making this flick, thoroughly enjoyed the process, and for some of those with star status, I'm almost certain, it had been a while since they'd been able to work without as much pressure to deliver, pressure even from themselves as they are not known to have a comedy background or had worked in a comedic film whatsoever. Read some of the critiques by "professionals" from various publications across, and could not find one who tried to consider such a perspective on this film. Some of these people in here have gone to great lengths to write this lengthy essays on how disgusting and filthy and on and on, my question is: what the hell did you watch the whole movie for if, in fact, you were so outraged and revolted by it? I think asking a similar question does tend to uncover a lot of the latent intrinsic motives and reasons behind most of the rhetoric behind most of the online, print, or publishing of any kind, nowadays. Hey, if it makes you laugh as hard as it did me, then put on some slippers and enjoy, otherwise, someone taking the time and being so passionately and vehemently inclined to criticize ANYTHING, points, to me at least, to a seated dark issue more within themselves than with the target of their banter.

On January 22nd, 2013, Richard Roeper posted a ZERO STAR review of this movie, calling it "The Citizen Kane of Awful." That's quite a statement, and looking up clips on You Tube can confirm such a claim. I happend to find a unopened Blu-ray of it at Salvation Army yesterday, so I bought it and watched it before bed, out of curiosity.Movie 43 is a bizarre movie, that's for sure. It focuses on Dennis Quaid pitching a skit film to Hollywood, and he makes different producers hear the script. People sit in horror at his ideas, which include but are not limited to:*Chloe Grace Moretz getting a period on a date around some idiotic boys.*Kate Winslet on a blind-date with Hugh Jackman, who has his neck, unbeknownst to others.*Parents bullying their child that they home-school.*A staff meeting on the IBabe, an IPod that looks like a nude woman, which teen boys use for sex and get their privates mangled in.*A couple plan to defecate on each other for a date, but things don't go as planned.These are 5 examples of the 13 skits that this film contains. If you are already turned off by this movie, then you will most likely loathe it. But if you had a long day at work like I did, or you just need something silly, Movie 43 may be the movie you need.Look, Movie 43 is not great. It's no Blazing Saddles or Airplane! and it definitely should not be compared to Citizen Kane by any means. Some of the skits are gross(like the defection one), so I didn't love all the skits, but I got some ironic enjoyment out of watching it.If you hate it, I understand, and to an extent I actually agree. But with the right mindset, this is a movie you could laugh at with friends-at the quality, not so much the jokes.Like my title states,this movie is self-aware of how bad it is. When Dennis Quaid pitches some skits, people turn him down, wondering WHO WOULD SIT THROUGH THIS MOVIE HE WANTS TO MAKE? Get the joke? WE are watching his train-wreck of a movie. But no one wants to MAKE it! That's partly why this kind of worked for me.Sure there are 42 movies that are better than Movie 43. But compared to trash I've witnessed, like Night Patrol, I would prefer this.Hate on this critique all you want. I didn't care for the poop skit or the intercom one much, but I enjoyed the period and blind date skits. I'm sorry, have mercy on me. I'm sure there are times I would watch this and hate it, but I watched it with a proper mindset and enjoyed it.I thought this would be terrible. I changed my mind. You can take it or leave it. I've voiced my thoughts, now judge it for yourself.

reviews.review_title: To cross the line in a bad way.
reviews.content: This movie is a provocation. I understand that. But it is a bad kind of provocation. I remember some time ago, I read about a famous french or Italian artist that sold his sh*t. My point is that this movie has such a high rating not because of quality or meaningfulness, but because of the great artists(that BTW don't do anything worthy of their performance) that participate. And just as the artist was able to sell his sh*t, just because it's HIS famous as* sh*t, the same way the actors managed to sell us their sh*tty movie(no pun intended). Sometimes when you try to send a message all you do is put pressure on yourself, and put some more, and more, until you fart, and you end up a little bit empty and dead inside. The Idea is quite clear and understandable, however trying so hard to be grotesque and actually succeeding at it, means that in the end you are contributing to what you are fighting against. And this motion picture is great at it. I remember a movie called Idiocracy, or something like that, that was actually a good kind of provocation. This one right here is more likely contributing to the social reality of the for-mentioned title. The worst part was when the credits rolled in. You are relieved it's over and you can go home and forget about what happened. But NOOO, you must continue being a subject of the twisted mind of the makers of this repulsive movie. You must watch a yet another short that's disgusting and just plain bad. At this point you really want it to just end and forget about it, run outside and kill somebody, just to do something, anything else than see another second of this movie. In conclusion this movie should have not been made. It is awful and crosses the line in a bad, bad way. It is still funny though, which of course does not make it OK!!!!!

Has anyone ever seen Amazon Women on the Moon? Probably not. It's a very dumb but yet funny movie that is basically just a bunch of random skits with famous people. No really story. I love that in a movie. You don't find it very often. It can either be done very well (The Onion Movie) or very poorly (The Underground Comedy Movie). So, because I like those kinds of movies, I actually thought Movie 43 looked kind of fun.Then, the reviews came out. And the critics tore it to shreds. They called it one of the worst movies of all time. So once I heard of this, I knew I had to see it. It was in theatres for maybe a week, then it was gone. It's July now, and I've finally seen it. I am one of the few whose seen it. I survived Movie 43. I don't think it's one of the worst movies ever, but it was bad. I love movies like this, and I hated this one.Again, this is a sketch comedy without a plot. There is sort of a plot but I didn't get it. One sketch involves a blind date between Kate Winslet and Hugh Jackman, and Jackman has a ballsack on his chin. O-kay then... Anyways, the best sketch in with Liev Schreiber and Naomi Watts where they give their home schooled son a taste of teen life. They bully him, they teach him, and even hit on him. That one is very over-the-top but yet it actually worked. But those aren't even the worst ones. There is one where Anna Faris asks Chris Pratt to poo on her. There's another where Chloe Moretz has her period and everyone finds out about it.There are three, maybe four sketches (out of probably 15) that I actually sort of liked. The rest of them are either strange, disgusting, repulsive, or creepy. Some of them have good ideas, but like most, none of the jokes ever seem to take liftoff. The idea just works. It's sad that when you gather 13 filmmakers (including Griffen Dunne and Elizabeth Banks) and nearly 30 writers, this is the best you can come up with. Also, it feels like every one of the filmmakers is trying to outdo each other in repulsion. It's pathetic.It's hard to believe that a movie like this could even get made. How are all of these famous people in this movie? How did they get Oscar winners and nominees on board? Were they all blackmailed? Or were they just bored? If it wasn't for the few skits that sort of worked, this would be a truly terrible movie. Instead, it's just bad. Not just bad, but also sad. One of the worst movies of the year so far. Believe the hate.C-

reviews.review_title: The movie is over no not yet! A spoof and slapstick parody that's raw, gross, and unhinged!
reviews.content: "Movie 43" is just one of those movies that you watch just to get some odd and far out laughs out of. And it sure does deliver on those as it's parody and slapstick comedy scenes of interconnected shorts really have you as the viewer amazed at how current pop culture can get mocked! It features an all star cast too of Dennis Quaid(the man who's trying to get a film made!)and Greg Kinnear, Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, Emma Stone and ending or should I say coming back with Elizabeth Banks! Still the gross scene of a ball jaw on Hugh Jackman and seeing Emma Stone suck her lover's finger rocked! And the Batman and Robin parody of Robin trying to lose his virginity with Wonder Woman was crazy only he finds he kissed a hidden Riddler! And just when you think this film ends it comes back with an Elizabeth Banks skit! Raw and outrageous parody a film that doesn't take itself to serious is just a way for a viewer to pass his or her time in a feel good far out manner.

reviews.review_title: The reviews are worse than the movie....
reviews.content: Not sure why this movie had such incredibly low ratings.Granted, I saw the three teenagers version and thought it was the weakest piece of the entire movie. I wish I had seen the one with Quaid and Kinnear, actually.I hate to say that this movie is misunderstood, but I see no other way to put it.I also don't see how the shock factor was too high and turned people off because by movie history standards, we have seen much worse in the disturbing department.So I'm left to think that reviewers were expecting something they didn't get.Movie 43 is closer to a movie like Holy Motors in which the completely abstract approach to the various parts of the movie correlate to a package that is either appealing or not.Consequently, trying to explain why it appeals to you or not is futile considering how completely over-the-top most of the parts turn out to be.It's also why it is most hilarious to see the various critics and reviewers pointing out the type of humour and how it was repulsive to them, while not really talking about the actual movie itself. It was interesting to see how some of the actors carried the various sketches on their shoulders. I even thought Emma Stone's bit was a pretty fine piece of comedic acting, actually.Why it was funny for people to see Cameron Diaz smear semen in her hair and unfunny to see Hugh Jackman going on a date with a scrotum attached to his chin is puzzling, to say the least.It reminded me of Forehead Tittaes with William Fichtner and Marion Cotillard which gathered a surprising 6.6 rating despite being about women walking around with breasts protruding from their heads.I wasn't exactly amused by every sketch in the movie either, but all of the sketches had something memorable in them.While not necessarily that funny, the iBabe part was a witty parody of how an entire board of supposedly brilliant product designers and marketers can sometimes spend so much time and money coming out with a terrible consumer product. People pointed out the naked girl aspect of it because they were visibly repulsed by the sketches preceding it, but as a standalone short film, this would have gotten above average reviews.Same with the Homeschooled part which was completely disturbing and cringe worthy, but at the same time still relevant as a depraved parody of americanized parenthood.People who are reading this review will raise eyebrows, thinking that I'm trying to dig deep to defend a crap movie by reaching for the meanings of abstract sketches that go out of their way not to have any, but that would be equal to saying Movie 43 is the worst film ever made strictly based on the puerile humour in it and leaving everything else out. They aren't necessarily wrong, but I think the overwhelming majority of scorching reviews on this movie are grossly miss focused.It goes to demonstrate that no matter how people say they have evolved and are ready for anything, they visibly are still not willing to consider things on more than one angle.While this movie is nowhere near as bad as the ratings make it out to be, it's no Godfather.It will still contribute to inspire other movies despite the negativity surrounding it and I wouldn't be surprised to see Movies 43's influence in future films based on abstraction.Movie 43 is the comedic and non-pompous equivalent to Holy Motors. This will floor a lot of people, but it isn't that far from the truth when you clear your mind, take a step back and really think about it for what it is : A collection of abstract shorts, tied together by, and completely outshining a really underdeveloped and crappy main plot.I think that in future years, Movie 43 will probably grow to be some kind of cult classic just for the novelty alone of seeing so many huge stars so far out of their element.

This movie was so funny it made me cry! The part with the homeschool son with "Ray Donovan" as his dad was so funny! Hugh Jackman was hilarious in it too! It's vulgar and disgusting just the way I like! Don't listen to all the bad reviews from prudes. Keep in mind it is rated R for a reason. If you like movies like grandma's boy, Step Brothers or any Seth Rogan films then you will enjoy this movie.

Re: A jumble of big name actors embarrass themselves to add decks to their summer houses.Outstanding: I actually thought the Chloe Moretz sketch was pretty funny, the reactions of the boys/men to a girl's problem was pretty spot on. I chucked a couple of other times, mostly due to initial surprise or cussing leprechauns. The actors, of which there are many good ones, totally committed to their roles.Unacceptable: Like every sketch show ever, nearly all of the skits went on too long and relied too much on gross out comedy. And bad writing.Summary: Not worth watching again in any real way shape or form. Ugh.1/5
Stupidest movie ever and hard to follow. That is all I have to say.

reviews.review_title: It's funny, what can I say
reviews.content: Not perfect and it hits some and misses some. But when it hits it really hits. I'm talking about the second sketch (with the homeschooling parents) and the third sketch (with a couple taking "the next step"). Vulgar but very funny. People who rated this 1 star obviously never watched or liked Scary Movie which makes them squares.

reviews.review_title: The absolute worst movie of all time.
reviews.content: Whoever financed this movie should be permanently banned from even ever seeing a movie again it's so awful. I can't believe what I just saw actually exists, I would rather watch A politician give a speech.

reviews.review_title: High Cinema it ain't but a great time it is
reviews.content: There are some films that I will only go to see on the other side of town, that is, the theater that is in the part of town where most of the viewers are black. Why would I do that? Because I like to laugh out loud, and doing it in a white theater is like trying to fart in church. I went to the $3 matinée in the slums and watched with glee as major movie stars debased themselves without worrying about why or how. Looking at this movie for higher meaning is stupid, for plot connectedness is even more thick. This was a movie designed to match up to the way we watch most of our video watching anyway. 3 min interludes that we peek at, at our desks or home offices when we should be doing something else. I am completely floored by why SO many people were astounded by the way each segment was more outrageous than the last and how it pulled no punches just went for the throat. What were you expecting, a kind and gentle gross out movie? Come on! All of that aside I love the fact that the actors are what really sell it. The fact that many of them have been nominated for academy awards and international acclaim and were still willing to go and make a movie that was FUN was just really cool to me. So if you're looking to go and see a "whole" movie you wont, but if your willing to get up go out and see something that is totally raunchy, as totally raunchy as that youtube video you just finished then go right ahead. But remember, go to the cheap theater, they will laugh with you, and truly that's the point anyway.

Did I mention that this movie is horrible? I want back the time I wasted, the money I lost, and the brain cells that were killed by watching this toxic menagerie of filth. I should have listened to the other reviews. My mistake..........I'm now going to binge-watch every X-Man movie in order to get the grotesque images of Hugh Jackman's scrotum-chin and Halle Berry's ginormously disfigured face and boobs driven from my memory. I really hope it works!

George Clooney dodged the bullet by staying away from this one. I read the blurb on Netflix, "In the spirit of Groove Tube and Kentucky Fried Movie." Let me tell you, I was ten when I saw those movies in the 70's and they were groundbreaking. They were so freaking funny they made your sides split. This movie, 43, could have done better if a college fraternity had made it. And with different short stories. This thing was so self-conscious, self-serving, and overbearing, I thought that I was being pranked. I thought that it would start making fun of itself for how bad it was. How they ever got all of these top names to buy into this thing, I will never know. That's one the most interesting mysteries about the movie.

reviews.review_title: This will kill 99% of your brain cells.
reviews.content: I'm just gonna be honest: I did chuckle for a couple times in the movie, but DAMN, this is AWFUL. To me, 43 is not a movie. If you ask me what Movie 43 is about, I don't know how to answer. All I can say is that Movie 43 has a bunch of funny (sometimes it isn't even funny) YouTube clips played by stars all combined into a full-length movie. First of all, I would rather watched a bunch of videos on YouTube that I would enjoy rather than watching this. Each clip in Movie 43 has nothing to do with one another, not even a link. All it gives you is a crappy premise that a bunch of ass-kids are finding Movie 43 and that it will end the world. Seriously, nothing makes sense in this movie. It involves time traveling, apocalypse, and explosions that will just leave you thinking WTF. One thing that I hated the most is that how did so many celebrities ended up in this movie? In the first clip, Kate Winslet is having a dinner date with Hugh Jackman who got balls hanging on his chin. C'mon Hollywood, having an Oscar- nominated actor and an Oscar winning actress in this garbage isn't a good idea. All I can say is that Hugh Jackman does have balls taking this role.Basically, each clip after the first one is either the same level with the first or even worse. I might even considering the first one as one of the funnier ones. Later in the movie, you got Naomi Watts and Leiv Schreiber humiliating their homeschooling son, Chris Pratt shitting on Anna Faris, Johnny Knoxville and Seann William Scott kidnapping Leprechauns for gold coins, and Halle Berry making guacamole with her boobs.That's all you got from Movie 43 and now I spoiled it so that you won't have to see this movie. You're going to thank me later. Just sayin'.

reviews.review_title: I've seen worse but this is pretty bad!
reviews.content: O the joy of rented weekly movies!Skip, skip, skip, skip, and skippety skip! I feel sorry for all those people who watched this mess in a theater and could not skip any sections.The one or two skits that perhaps had some humorous promise quickly devolved into very bad crudeness or unnecessary violence.A very interesting fact to note is that the actual instigator of this whole pile of dog crap appears in a bit part in a segment as a crude and disgusting cartoon cat given the name of Beezel. Though very appropriate, they have slightly mis-spelled his name. And just in case anyone doesn't get it, the correct spelling for his name is Beelzebub.And this is the reason why the Beezel segment is run during the end credits. He IS actually taking full credit for this movie!!And some more on this... Beelzebub or Beel-Zebub ... is another name for the Devil. Wikipedia.BEELZEBUB or BEELZEBUL: (2) The word "Zebul" (from "zebel," dung) is a cacophonic corruption of "Zebub," in order to give the name the meaning of "god of the dung." It is more likely that the name "Beelzebul" is a dialectic variation of "Beelzebub," as "Beliar" is of "Belial"; ...From the Jewish Encyclopedia see article 2732-beelzebub.Yeah, he really deserves this appellation too. And it shines through in this movie.

I stumbled upon this movie from a 'worst of' list, so some would say I had a preexisting bias toward it - knowing what it was I was going into. However, no review could prepare me for what I was about to see. Movie 43 is a culmination of 'comedy' skits directed by a multitude of talented people - talented people that decided to bang their heads against a wall and create a script after they had acquired a multitude of seizures and other types of brain damage. Movie 43 is weak, no new jokes are present here. The type of humor that exists in Movie 43 is the type of humor your troubled 13-year-old son would find in the dark side of Youtube. This movie isn't a comedy, it's a horror-drama. You're sad that you're watching it, and horrified when it ends. I feel bad for the people that were excited for this movie going in if there were any.

Listen, you have to be in the right frame of mind to watch this movie and"appreciate" its humor. It's vulgar, unnecessary, and in some parts just too obscene to laugh at. But if you know this going into it, don't be surprised when it turns out like this website's reviews tell it to be . Either people give it a 1 or 2, or a 9 or 10. That has to tell you something. Which is why I'm giving it a 5. It's like SNL with all big name actors, a big budget, and a no network to sensor anything. Peter Farrelly directs half the skits. This is what you're in for when you see it. Don't watch it on a second date, or with your 16 year old son who you've been trying so hard to connect with and Ted sort of broke the ice, but was pretty awkward. Watch it after you've smoked a bowl with your significant other who doesn't mind repulsive humor with little content.

reviews.review_title: Smart Actors, But Foolish Choice For a Movie
reviews.content: As you look at all the talented actors and filmmakers sadly wasting their time in this "sketch comedy" of "Movie 43," you want to ask yourself "What are such great talents like these doing here?" In fact, no words can even describe how bad this movie is. Richard Roeper, the esteemed film critic, was well on the money when he described this movie as "TheCitizen Kane of Awful" and "The Worst Movie of All Time." If there is any worse movie than "Movie 43," does anyone know what it can be?Take great actors and filmmakers like Richard Gere, Greg Kinnear, Hugh Jackman (you should see what his neck looks like), Kate Winslet (sitting in embarrassment as she stares at his neck), Common, Elizabeth Banks (a sexy intellect who has to reduce herself to acting and directing two different execrable sketches), Josh Duhamel, Halle Berry, Stephen Merchant, Seth MacFarlane (an expert in the cutting edge humor who can burst an envelope), Kate Bosworth, Anna Faris, Kristen Bell, Uma Thurman, Justin Long, and the list goes on and on. Does everyone here really need an extra paycheck with this? Are they just cavorting with friends? Haven't some of these actors already done this brand of humor, only better, in previous projects?There is no meaning or substance to this "comedy," just a series of gross-out, scatological jokes that pile up on top of one another. There are breast jokes, genitalia jokes, blood meant for sick humor, unflattering depictions of people with physical disabilities, cruelty to animals, even of an animated cat in the "Beezel" segment, jokes about death, and they just keep repeating themselves that after a while, the viewer loses track of what just happened, as I did. The plot is around failed movie moguls pitching in for a new movie, with the worst ideas surrounding that movie. "Movie 43" is supposed to be an homage to the raunchy 1970s anthology comedies of "The Groove Tube" and "Kentucky Fried Movie." In 1987, there was "Amazon Women on the Moon," a retread of "Kentucky Fried Movie" featuring well-known talented actors of that generation including Steve Guttenberg, Rosanna Arquette, Sybil Danning, and Carrie Fisher, to name a few. All three of these movies were pop-culture satires and worked so well they became cult classics. "Movie 43" is in no way becoming a cult classic as the years pass. "Movie 43" is not about pop culture. It is just one disgusting joke after another, and that does not make a comedy. And I don't know how on earth any studio could possibly green-light this at all.I'm glad I did not spend $10.00 or more to see this movie at all in the theaters. So I watched this on movies on demand for about $5.00. If you want to know my excuse, Iadore Elizabeth Banks and I like to check her out anywhere because she is pretty, smart, and funny. But like all of us, she is not perfect. For ardent fans of the stars, it's hard to fork over your hard-earned cash for "Movie 43" in this recession era. Everyone deserves better, and we hope they get bigger and better projects later on. Best of luck to all.

This movie was just crude humor all the way, the only part I thought was funny was Hugh Jackmans segment and that was barely that good, it is also the only reason why I gave it a 2. I do not know why any good actor would agree to such a filthy movie, I am a fan of good comedy and this was not good comedy all it was penis and vagina joke with swearing. I would rather chop the tips of my finger off and dip the wound in salt than watch this movie again. Since I saw it I regretted, I found the trailers for other movies much funnier than this. I would not recommend this move to anyone, not even the people I hate the most, I give it a 2/10 and that is being too nice.

If not for Justin Long's Robin segment: "Super Hero Speed Dating," the Chris Pratt butt shot, the one line: "We don't have many Jewish people in Europe, anymore, because of the 'trouble,'" or the fact "JJ" (Adam Cagley) was cute, this Movie 43 would be the biggest waste of an enormously casted, adolescence and pot-induced "humor" film of all time.How this got green-lit, how this attracted absolute talent, including some of my all-time favorites, how this was said: "Oscar winners, we have a wiener for you, ha ha" and they cameis so beyond me, I can't even comprehend.Okay, maybe I can. A little.Perhaps these big stars, this talent, purposely set out to make one incredibly bad film with less than preteen humor. Maybe this is all a joke? Possibly they intended to act stupid to "get back at critics"? I don't know.What I do know is: One soul was sold to the Devil to get all these greats into this so-called anthology of "comedy." Yeah, I'm using quotes a lot here. It's only because a lot of the humor, sets, contracts and sober-less writing is as incredibly fake as the ideas for Junior Junior High School internet ideas.While most anthologies are of the horror genre, and this does have a minute amount of suspense/sci-fi/stupidity, this one is basically visual slapstick comedy. The weak wraparound story involves two potheads attempting to get back at one of the kid's brothers by making up their need to find "Movie 43."Along the internet search way, many, too many, stories fit in literally an hour and 10 minutes that have zero relevance to the overall plot. Many are pre-preteen sight gags sketches, only one (mentioned above – "Super Hero Speed Dating") is worthy of a viewing. In fact, if that can be found on YouTube, you'll give me a $1,000 for saving you a mere hour and five minutes.Mercifully, there aren't 43 shorts, but it sure felt that way. Skip it!Side Note: Currently, the rating on Movie 43 is 4.4 on IMDb. Hopefully, this review will knock it down .1 to finally make sense of the title.

reviews.review_title: UK's version makes more sense, but still terrible
reviews.content: From what I can gather, there are differences between the US and UK versions of the film, with the US version having the sketch sequences as part of a movie pitch. The UK version on the other hand, has two friends playing a prank on a younger sibling, attempting to install viruses on his laptop, this is done by asking the young sibling to find a video that is so awful that it is almost impossible to find, when in actual fact it is a fake they have made up, called "Movie 43", of course. This leads them to view several clips which could be the infamous Movie 43, and these characters act as the go between for each of the sketches, which I won't bother describing since there are many other reviews which do. Aside from the overall linking of sketches being a somewhat better idea than the US version, the film as a whole is still awful, and it's claim to be the most outrageous and offensive comedy proves to be very wrong.What Movie 43 really does is imitate 12 year old children laughing at boobs and poop jokes, with the occasional bit of nudity and swearing to ensure that it doesn't raise the bar too high at any point.I went into this film not expecting much, hoping that I would be proved wrong, but unfortunately it seems my expectations were in fact too high, as I was disappointed on all levels. Movie 43 is barely offensive, and is simply a mean spirited, hastily cobbled mess of a film which provides very few laughs.Avoid it.

It was supposed to be a silly, childish, low brow comedy and it was. Mission accomplished. I giggled and chortled, I even guffawed a couple times.
Sorry it wasn't good enough for all you snobs out there.
I loved it.

I've been curious about this movie for a long time. I finally watched it today after finding it at the Dollar tree maybe a week or so ago.
