Some of the shorts were quite entertaining like the Emma Stone and Liev Schreiber shorts. But there are some that were just uninteresting to me the Hugh Jackman and Chris Pratt Shorts. Not the worst movie watching experience I've had but not the best.

I found most of the short films mildly humorous, about 2 or 3 were very funny, but too drawn out, the one about a girl on her period is really not funny and is just disgusting. The plot that strings the short films together horrible, the end conclusion of the plot is terrible.This is another movie ruined by high expectations and adverts showing the funniest bits.This is overall a bad film, not the worst I've ever seen but not miles off.I strongly advise everybody to only see this if they have nothing at all to do even work.

reviews.review_title: 0.6 out of 10 for the first time
reviews.content: I don't give a f*k this film was beyond awful, it was so bad. Bad,bad,bad. Its a comedy, make me f*king laugh. Why just, why? Talent wasted. Good actors were wasted. Everything is wasted. This film is about nothing. For godsake, if it goes on DVD do not f*king buy it. Godforsaken spend your money on anything else do not give it to these money w*res. This film fails on all levels and should be destroyed. I seriously hated this film. It just makes me so mad. Just writing this review has caused me to get mad. It so bad. Bad, Bad, Bad, it is the sh*t pile of the 10-20 the first horrible movie. So bad that people will be shocked and remember why this shouldn't be made. For f*k sake this film should never be viewed. No matter how bad I say it is don't view it, unless it is for free. Technical 3 Plot 0 Acting 2 Impact 1 Effects 2 Enjoyable 0 Rewatch 0 Visuals 0 Pacing 0 Mood 0 Validity 0 adds up to be 0.6/10 I would have rather, cut my arm off with a tooth brush and eaten a plate of nails then ever watch this unbearable piece of hell fire again.

It's quite hilarious and easy movie. Almost everyone celebrity has a sense of humor in every episode. As for me I love humor like this. However remember one important thing - don't watch this movie with parents!! Never!

reviews.review_title: A depraved spectacle of embarrassing lunacy
reviews.content: Movie 43 is without a doubt one of the most tasteless, repellent, offensive, astonishingly bad comedies ever churned out of the Hollywood machine. But it's one that you just can't help but keep your eyes glued to the entire runtime, like a horrific car crash that's so bad it just demands attention. The laughs don't come organically from the jokes and setups themselves, but from your sheer disbelief and trauma at witnessing this absolute train wreck careen about in your living room, cinema, iPad, or wherever you were fortunate enough to witness this demon. That being said... I ant gonna lie I got a few sick chuckles out of it. Never have I seen such a bedazzled stable of A list talent deliberately demean, degrade and humiliate themselves on camera. It's shocking, gross, nonsensical, and all kinds of stupid. But I can't help recommend it just for shameless shock value, cause admit it, you went to see Jackass and Fubar and every other immature oddity out there. Its made up of a series of short vignettes, pitched by a manic Dennis Quaid sporting skinny jeans and a swooshy Bieber-esque hairdo, to a timid, disbelieving studio head (Greg Kinnear). Quaid's pitches are the most juvenile bunch of bullshit you've ever heard, but he delivers them with sincerity and delusional enthusiasm that makes you want to cry. The first involves a single girl (Kate Winslet) on a date with a handsome, successful socialite playboy (Hugh Jackman, one of the only few who seems to be having actual fun). Only problem... He has an actual scrotum hanging from his neck. I wish I was making this up. It becomes quite the gross out gag at the dinner table, as he is completely oblivious and doesn't even address it. Sean William Scott and Johnny Knoxville show up as buddies dealing with a psychotic leprechaun (a very profane, helium voiced, midget Gerard Butler). Anna Faris plays a sweet fiancé who wants her husband to be (Chris Pratt) to poo on her in the bedroom. Hey, a little fecal play must go a long way, considering Faris and Pratt are married for real now ;). Emma Stone and Kieran Culkin star in the weirdest segment, a bizarre nocturnal supermarket dirty talking session. Richard Gere plays an Apple like CEO dealing with a MP3 sex doll that is maiming young men who stick their penises in the area meant for the ventilation fan. Poor Chloe Grace Moretz plays a girl getting her period for the first time, who's ridiculed by her father and classmates in a shocking sequence. Liev Schreiber and Naomi Watts play demented parents who take homeschooling their son to depraved me lows, in one of the few episodes that elicits actual laughs. In the film's funniest bit, Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant are on a blind date, and take a game of truth or dare (well, just dare, really) so far over the top you get to see Merchent get trans ethnicity surgery and Berry get breast enlargements the size of yoga balls. There's also scattershot appearances from Patrick Warburton, Common, JB Smoove, Kate Bosworth, Seth Macfarlane, Uma Thurman, Justin Long, Jason Sudeikis, Bobby Cannavle, Elizabeth Banks, Josh Duhamel, Kristen Bell and too many others to keep track of. This is co,edgy so far in the gutter it's set up camp, beckoning you into an absolutely deplorable realm of disgusting scenarios. Now, there's two different versions of the movie, one which cuts out Quaid's character out and replaces his pitches with a bunch of kids watching YouTube videos. Don't watch that one, as the Quaid version is the lesser of two evils, and flows better. The writing seems to have leapt right of the crude, perverted doodles in the margins of an eighth grader's textbook, and every actor involved looks like they're either being held at gunpoint, blackmailed into doing this, or got really, really drunk, were handed the script and said "fuck yeah this is awesome". It's definitely one to check out for pure burnout spectacle though. Just don't say I didn't warn you.

reviews.review_title: Wholesome family entertainment. Proof hollywood has its finger on the pulse
reviews.content:
We sat down as a family and watched for Mothers Day with the kids. We love our kids. We want them to have a well developed understanding of hollywood and positive media role models.
Highly recommended. Don't let me 1 rating confuse you- that was just for the poor editing- script and acting top notch
Go hollywood
Just fun. Don't overthink this movie. Really fun movie.

I just finished watching Movie 43. I have never, ever seen anything like that! It is hysterical, but sometimes SO CRAZY and SO PUSHING-ALL-LIMITS, that you're not sure if you are a bad person if you laugh but you will.I read SO MANY terrible reviews about this movie, that I contemplated not going( I didn't want to drag my friends to see something that they would hate) We all LOVED it!!! (Although, my one friend is still kind-of battling his conscience on whether-or-not that's OK.)In order for me to effectively explain what is necessary for one to fully experience this movie, and get the maximum entertainment value, I will make the following analogy: "Kool-Aid Fruit Punch" is advertised as a delicious, fruity and refreshing beverage. To fully experience "Kool-Aid Fruit Punch" as it was intended, you will need "a packet of Kool-Aid powder" and "a pitcher of ice-cold water." If you had ONLY "a pitcher of ice-cold water", you may experience some refreshment, but you are missing out on a whole new level of fruity delicious-ness! However, if you had ONLY "a packet of Kool-Aid powder" you would not have a "refreshing beverage" at all. You would have the exact opposite!! You would be quenching your extreme thirst by pouring some dry, fruity powder down your throat.Analogy Key:"a pitcher of ice-cold water" = Mary Jane;"a packet of Kool-Aid powder"= Movie 43;"refreshing beverage" = Funny, Funny Movie;"Kool-Aid Fruit Punch" = The Intended 'Movie 43' Experience;The Moral of My Story:To enjoy, "Kool-Aid Fruit Punch," JUST ADD WATER!!!

The movie was very good, in my opinion. It was exciting to see all these stars getting together to make us smile and laugh. Every short movie within the movie was not as good as others. Some were too disturbing, some were just nasty, some were funny and enjoyable. I wished something better for ending when it had to be funniest part but it was not apparently. Anyway, I think all the stars in the movie did their best.Homeschooled part was containing some good critics against today's high schools. iBabe was smart and funny, maybe it would be real one day in the future. Veronica part was just too dirty and nothing funny at all. Emma Stone deserves to be in a better scene than that. Same thing goes for Anna Faris.

reviews.review_title: If you enjoyed The Aristocrats, you will love this!
reviews.content: The Aristocrats was a movie I wasted my money on a few years back that involved a herd of stand-up comedians telling the same dirty joke over and over again, each guy or gal trying to make their version even nastier than the one that came before. I nearly walked out. But prices being what they were, I stayed put until this ordeal was blessedly over. Since that agonizing afternoon, I have tried to be a little bit more selective in which movies I spend my money on. When I saw that Hugh Jackman was in MOVIE 43, I thought it was a safe bet to be entertaining. I mean, how can you go wrong with the Wolverine and Jean Valjean? Boy, was I in for a rude awakening. From the time he appears on screen as the TITANIC lady's blind date, every second until he leaves is excruciating. I don't think I'll ever look at a turkey in the same way again. What will I be able to serve to my family next Thanksgiving or Xmas? So in conclusion, I would like to thank Hugh Jackman and MOVIE 43 for spoiling all my Christmas Futures!!

The one thing this movie has, besides the miracle behind it, getting made, is that it has a morbid curiosity about it. Not once did I laugh, except one time, towards the end, in the last skit with Banks, her lover, and her jealous animated cat. The laugh was merely a snicker. Movie 43, is outrageously unfunny, and rightly so, because the stories which are supposed to be pitched ideas, I imagine, are based on gross and offensive gags, if you can call them that, one involving faeces spraying a windshield and street, very much like the one in Dumb and Dumberer, though this is a more graphic sight. From seeing a human pair of balls danging from Jackson's throat, the first star wasted in this (actually, you won't believe how many stars are) to Chloe Moretz, who has a little wet reddy patch on the back of her jeans, surrounded by family and others who overreact, as it's implied she's got her period. There lies the unfunny joke, in the exaggeration, and it's just not funny, for very obvious reasons. It's the unfunniest skit in the movie. I've seen much funnier skits in amateur theatre, that have been frowned upon. But the movie holds a mere fascination is it, in actually how unfunny it is, it acquires a unique style of it's own, but a forgettable one, the movie will linger about, for about couple of days after seeing it. And intervened between the skits, are two teen nerd sorts and a young computer whiz geek, trying to hack into the infamous film, Movie 43, (a compilation of all those funny skits) with some unwelcome hindrances, trying to stop them. My advice to you is, see this film at least once and never again. Erase it from your mind completely. Something the produces should of done before making it, actually thinking this would crack people up.

Complete garbage or a kind of movie that we're not used to?My reviews are usually a long text giving my opinion and what I felt by seeing the movie, but this time I'll try something different because this is no ordinary movie. So I'll start by making some questions:What sort of movie is this? This movie isn't like most, with a story line that we follow while watching. It's a "series of different (completely different!!)events. But does that mean that has no story? No. It has a story. And is it a good one? Well, no, it's sort of something that we've seen and it's a little stupid, yes, because it's the story of 3 teenage boys throwing pranks at each others, so I guess it has to be stupid. What about the quality of the different stories that we see? I guess it doesn't get better. While watching most of them you will keep asking yourself "Is this for real?!" And no. It's not! And this is we're I think the movie has it's biggest problem. It's not believable. Most of the things it shows are 0.0000001% probable to happen. Not impossible, but stil very unlikely. So people watch and think "What the hell?" or "Did I seriously pay for this?". But let's try to keep a bit non skeptical here. I guess the point of the movie it's not to be real, but funny by showing some insane things that like I said, aren't impossible to happen, so it shows how would people could react in a crazy situation and that is always funny. Another thing it does it to simply make fun of not so real things that were already brought to the big screen and people loved. At end the movie it's just that. And there won't be a huge turn out to set an amazing end. It will be just the follow of different crazy events. It can be a bit disappointing, but it can allow you to have some good laughs and if you just want that and to keep it simple it will be a good movie. For me it would work better as a TV show (sort of like Little Britain) than as a movie, but I guess it gave something different for the big screen and I'm all in favor for that.

This movie is edgy. Raw and just down right dirty at times. If you don't enjoy darker humor, you won't enjoy this movie. Pretty much, if Family Guy or South Park don't peek your interest, you won't enjoy this movie.I found it hilarious.Honestly, forget the reviews. Screw what the media has to say about it. Go see it yourself and form your own opinion. Everyone has a different style of humor, a lot of people's don't match this movie. Not sure if this is a spoiler alert or not, but Imma warn you just encase. There is little plot, just shorts of various levels of humor. Smacking all boundaries in the face and then moving on to the next. I loved it and it really brought me to a good mood.

I have absolutely no idea how they assembled a team of such high profile actors for this sharp and unusual movie. It's not art-house, I even cannot describe it clearly, but it's really pushing boundaries, sometimes going even beyond "Onion news". Guys, how you did it, eh? No, this movie is not stupid shocking prank like e.g. "goatse" picture. It definitely has message, even if not for everyone. Girl menstruation episode gently takes fears out of your belly and pushes them in your face. "Home education" episode is nearly brilliant, though uncomfortable to watch at the end, but definitely it was the purpose. I laughed loudly but with attempts not to turn my eyes away from the screen.iBabe... oh Gosh, I love it. Buy mp3 player but don't f.., oh, sorry, "don't steal music". Of course we won't.This movie will never reach popularity of similarly structured "Tales from the Crypt": it deals with too many human prejudices and phobias, but big thanks to all actors and the team for making it, at least once.

I don't write many reviews but I am compelled to do so with this. It is by far the worst thing I have ever watched and I want my time back. Comedy? All I did was cringe. I'm not easily offended but I couldn't see that the film scenes were meant to do anything other than to try and offend, rather than entertain. Fortunately it's only 94 mins long. What the hell were some of these stars thinking when they signed up for this?? I haven't even passed the DVD on to a charity shop, I don't want anyone else to suffer through it.

reviews.review_title: An humor analogy of the control others have over our lives
reviews.content: In domains like security, medicine, media, work and politics, others are constantly in control of what we accept and find acceptable. Our boss, in some ways is actually holding a gun to our head and saying, "You really like this place and your co-workers, don't you?"The premise for this movie is that one who has absolute control can control everything, including our tastes. ﻿The überplot with Dennis Wade explains how this could be possible. This theme of domination and control (the un-funny part) runs through many of the skits presented, though not all of them.If you believe strongly in moral taboos, you might be offended by parts of this movie.

WHAT DO I WANT FROM A MOVIE ? 1.entertainment , of course , maybe from something new. 2.organic nature of development i.e. the movie starts somewhere and grows almost like a living organism and not just a pile of unrelated parts. 3.chemistry between characters , originating maybe from good acting.WHY WAS I ATTRACTED TO THIS MOVIE? 1.the star cast is immense ! 2.i love comedies. I LIKED IT BECAUSE it is hysterical throughoutYOU MAY LIKE IT IF YOU LIKE comedy movies not taking themselves seriously. YOU MAY HATE IT IF YOU HATE gross humour MOVIES LIKE THIS 1.scary movies. 2.ronan the barbaren.
I've watched this many times. It's funny every single time!

Don't. Watch. It.I sat through 12 minutes of this garbage just to find an equivalent to a giant middle finger dipped in horse dung. I... couldn't. If you have the BALLS to view this, it's your funeral. For me, I almost barfed.

My five-star rating means that "Movie 43" is something that you'll love if you tolerate crude humor, and you'll want every copy of it incinerated if you don't tolerate crude humor. Since the Farrelly brothers (of "Dumb and Dumber" and "There's Something About Mary" fame) are involved, you know that there's no shortage of gross-out humor. Basically, it involves a man pitching a movie containing a bunch of very explicit vignettes. The best one is either the one starring Hugh Jackman as a man who apparently doesn't know where his testicles are, or the one where Halle Berry and her beau play truth or dare. No part of this movie even attempts to be serious. It's silly plain and simple. And it's kind of hard not to laugh at the movie.

reviews.review_title: Such a waste of very talented actors...
reviews.content: The main question is pretty clear to me: was there a reason to shoot Movie 43? I've spent the whole run-time trying to understand what the movie was trying to tell me: Is it trying to make me laugh? Is it trying to surprise me? Is it trying to make me think? I went through the whole movie and I didn't get an answer to all those questions. Despite the fact that the main plot about the forbidden Movie 43 was actually pretty original and intriguing, almost all the sub-plots appeared rather dull and unfunny to me. I was like 'ok, there's a man with balls hanging from hit neck. That man is Hugh Jackman. Is that supposed to be funny? Why am I not getting it??'. I was really trying to give the movie a chance, but, really, almost none of the situations presented made me smile. I am not a serious guy, there are comic movies that made me laugh very hard, but I really didn't find any reason to laugh in this one. The actors involved in this project did a very good job, though. It was a shame that their plays were not supported by a good script.

reviews.review_title: Its rally a 6, but all these amateur reviewers can't take a joke
reviews.content: Listen up people, the purpose of a comedy is to be funny, and this movie was funny. Gee isn't that the point? Yes it was in bad taste and dark humor, but the point is to get away and to have a laugh. It was divided into segments and all of it was tied together by a story that Dennis Quaid was pitching these horrible ideas to studio executive, Greg Kineer. Get it, they are supposed to be bad ideas? My favorite was the parents who are home schooling their son and want to give him every benefit of actually going to high school. Complete with hazing and a prom date that his mother fills in since he doesn't actually go to school. It was a great satire on the stupidity of people "home schooling" their children. I also liked the bit where Emma Stone talks dirty kinky to her boyfriend who is the checker in a supermarket and they accidentally broadcast their kinky language to the whole store. If you like dark humor you may find it fun. I don't understand in every review someone thinks that virtually every movie is the worst movie they have ever seen. Please they have never seen Jack and Jill.

94 minutes of pure awesomeness! I laughed my ass of! But the end disappointed me. I've waited for "the clue" ....in vain. Apart from that its a great movie to watch when you're not expecting a "high-class-hollywood movie". Its. just. funny. as. hell. Spend your money and your valuable time to see this movie! And don't forget: "You're black. They're white. This ain't hockey!" .. oh man 10 lines are way to much to describe it..maybe its not that god. Please forget what I wrote. Here are just some more great quotes: "Donald: See the blind kid over there? I dare you to blow out his candles before he gets the chance to." And: "You don't wanna be mister-two-squeeze-thank-you-please, don't you?" abdcefghijklmnopstubwxyz1234567890 Enjoy

reviews.review_title: Tries to revive the "Skit Movie" but it lacks energy or originality enough to make an impact
reviews.content: Movie 43 got me a little perked up because it seemed to be resurrecting a lost art – the "skit movie". These kinds of films have always been popular in my native Italy, but the US also produced some classic examples, notably "Kentucky Fried Movie" and "Amazon Women on the Moon", with big name stars making fools of themselves with relish and glee for their friends. I had also read the scathing reviews, production difficulties and the almost non-existent release this film is getting (We were lucky enough to have it showing at our local mega-multiplex) so I suitably lowered my expectations.The films bridging story (kids trying to find the world's most sick and illegal film online) is apparently different to the original version (Hollywood exec pitches lousy ideas at gunpoint) but the change works for the better. The "skits" are mostly of the gross-out variety, (as were those in "KFM" and "AWOTM") trying to push the envelope as far as it can go. Unfortunately by 2013 the envelope has burst long ago, so this kind of thing no longer shocks, leaving it all looking weak, tired and hopelessly lost. There are some sparks of promise in the stories, like the parents (Schreiber and Watts) who try to give their home schooled kid the soul destroying "High School experience" indoors, or the "Motivational Sports Movie" that cuts through the bull to get to the simple heart of the matter (Blacks will destroy Whites in Basketball anytime!), or the "I-Babe" with an I-Pod designed to look like a naked woman by a boardroom or clueless men (featuring Richard Gere as Steve Jobs, which along with the 2005 style advert suggests this was made a long time ago!) who don't get why boys cripple themselves trying to have sex with it, and even the Blind Date where a game of "Truth or Dare" predictably descends to absurd levels. However the ideas aren't played to their full strength. It's like a home movie where they said "OK! Let's try this", they filmed it, mailed it over and forgot about it. With no central directorial vision, there is no unity of theme or overall guiding hand, no driving energy,something that every other "Skit" movie had and works as a result of.I guess with so many different mini-stories, an audience will (hopefully) find some they find personally funnier than the others, so different parts will appeal to different audiences. Personally my favourite parts were the "Leprechaun Hostage" mini thriller with Johnny Knoxville, Sean William Scott and Gerard Butler as "the Leprechaun", and the bizarre love story featuring Anna Faris (a seasoned veteran of this kind of thing having headlined no less than 4 "Scary Movies") as a girl who wants her prospective husband to defecate over her. It actually translates the real fear of losing one's virginity, of making a good impression on a potential love, and the anxiety of sex into a disgusting yet still very human and recognisable story. It would be fantastic if this rare film could actually kick-start a revival of the "Skit Movie", but sadly the overall quality (or lack of it) here might kill the genre stone dead for another 30 years! Let's hope not

I've watched a lot of movies. This is by far the worst I've ever watched. I only wanted to watch this because of the stellar cast- fantastic actors were cast in this- but wow. Disgusting. Horrible. Terrible. Awful. Words cannot express how terrible this is.

I've put off watching Movie 43 for a very long time, considering all of the dreadful feedback it received when it was initially released in January of last year. The plot of the film vaguely revolves around three teenagers trying to find the "most banned film on the internet", which is appropriately titled Movie 43, although the American version of the film has a completely alternate plot revolving around movie producers pitching this film to a company. Regardless of this, both versions contain this plot solely to string together 12 un-funny, crude, horrific sketch comedies containing an unbelievably star-studded cast of actors. From Hugh Jackman to Stephen Merchant; nobody is left out. I have literally no idea why so many well-known celebrities would agree to be a part of this truly appalling movie. One of the opening sketches features Hugh Jackman and Kate Winslet attending a blind-date, but the 'hilarious' twist is that Hugh Jackman's character has a pair of prosthetic testicles on his neck which only Kate Winslet appears to notice. This successfully sets the tone for the rest of the movie, with scene after scene revolving around a tiresome concept dragged out far beyond being funny. A theory I have heard is that the actors were made to feel guilty after signing their contracts so they became obliged to continue the production, but when you reach a sketch revolving around a woman wanting her fiancée to defecate on her, it becomes very hard to believe any such ideas. Speaking of defecation, Movie 43 really leaves no stone unturned when it comes to the juvenile areas of comedy. Incest, periods & blatant racism all make an appearance, and none are handled in a remotely funny manner. In fact, the only slightly entertaining sequences of the movie such as a scene between Stephen Merchant and Halle Berry didn't rely heavily on these kind of topics at all, and were much better for it. The majority of the film seems as if a young, pre-pubescent boy was behind everything, which isn't ideal when there's such critically acclaimed actors present. Although it may seem like I'm being pretentious about Movie 43, that's only because there is genuinely nothing redeemable about this film. I'm all for 'low-brow' comedy when it's done correctly, and I even enjoy the earlier Scary Movie films which feature huge amounts of this, but Movie 43 simply isn't good. I really wish I could say otherwise, because I'm a fan of many actors featured, but it just is downright awful from start to finish. In case it isn't obvious, I'd highly recommend giving Movie 43 a miss. It only runs for around 90 minutes, but felt as if it dragged on for far, far longer. Unless the American version is drastically different, I have no idea why this film was ever made, and feel bad for everybody involved. Do yourself a favour and watch a comedy such as Airplane which shows just how successful a rapid flurry of jokes can be.
I usually hate all different stories thrown together...but I knew this was supposed to be just a fun movie to watch with great actors. I was not at all disappointed.

Omnibus films featuring big names can work as long as the product works well, but Movie 43 fails as it combines the series of shorts into one narrative. There are two versions of the film: One takes place in a producer's conference and the other takes place at a teenager's home before an apocalypse. Some segments have missing payoffs like the one where a grocery clerk Neil (Kiernan Culkin) falls in love with Veronica (Emma Stone) or Batman (Jason Sedakis) giving dating advice to Robin (Justin Long). Others, like the one where Beth (Kate Winslet) goes on a date with millionaire Davis (Hugh Jackman), the one where Amanda (Chloe Moretz) experiences her first menstrual cycle, and the one where a man (Chris Pratt) takes laxatives to show his love for his fiancée (Anna Faris) are just an excuse to throw out gross-out jokes. Meanwhile, it throws in socio-political commentary in these sketches, like the sexist ad executive (Richard Gere) pitching the product iBabe to his staff or the 1950's coach (Terrence Howard) teaching the first all-black basketball team. However, other segments are okay, like the game of truth of dare between Stephen Merchant and Halle Berry, the one featuring a gay cartoon cat or a birthday present involving a leprechaun (Gerard Butler). You know your project is in trouble when you title it Movie 43 because these rejected CollegeHumor sketches seem like they were filmed before the producers came up with the title. It especially doesn't work when they bookend these vignettes with a lazy and last minute narrative. I do not object to shock and gross-out comedy, in fact, as a teen, I watched a good chunk of lowbrow shows like "Robot Chicken" and "Family Guy." Whereas those were handled with contextual intelligence, Movie 43 is a limp, desperate attempt from over fifteen directors to throw every adult humor on the screen resulting in a giant mess. (1 ½ Balls on Chins out of 5)

I don't believe the majority of the reviews on here. I'm not saying I'm surprised, or offended, or that I can't handle the lack of basic grammar...I mean I literally don't believe most of the reviews to be genuine. I mean, come on. One star out of ten? A movie has to try harder for it to get such a low rating. Same with the ten out of ten reviews. This movie in no way deserves such extreme responses. The spectrum of love and hate for a straight-forward raunchy compilation film is the same as the spectrum that exists for Funny or Die or Collegehumor. You literally don't get to hate (or love) it that much. I'd say the spectrum exists somewhere between 3 and 7. Anything outside of that, and you're just trying to tip the scales (which is why most reviewers gave a one or a ten). I understand your frustration at having someone disagree with your assessment, but don't take it out on the innocent readers of your puffed-up review, take it out on the reviews you disagree with by down voting them as unhelpful. That way we can keep from crowding the edges like a bunch of reactionary sheep.

reviews.review_title: Nowhere near as bad as I was expecting.
reviews.content: MOVIE 43See just to prove that you should never take a reviewers word for anything I heard nothing good about this film nothing at all. It got slated by every reviewer that I read or listened to but I liked it.It is such a stupid film, but it made me laugh.The movie is about 2 guys who upload a stupid video to You Tube when they get a million views in under a minute they think they are web sensations until they realize their younger computer whiz brother just hacked into the system and tricked them. So now revenge is on the cards they decide to kill his laptop by searching porn sites and giving his laptop viruses. So, to get him away from his laptop they ask him for help finding a banned film called Movie 43. Whilst searching for the film they find a lot of other banned movies and we see bits of them all.Yes the movie is completely bizarre, and the stories are completely messed up, but it is still very entertaining. Obviously, when you have a movie full of short stories there are some good ones and some not so good ones. But they are all so weird and not expected that even the not so good ones still keep you glued to the TV because you are trying to understand what the hell just happened. Haha.There are a lot of stars in this film all starring in their own little movie. Some of the stars are Dennis Quaid, Greg Kinnear, Seth MacFarlane, Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, Live Schreiber, Naomi Watts, Anna Faris, Kieran Culkin, Emma Stone, Richard Gere, Kate Bosworth, Uma Thurman, Kristen Bell, Chloe Grace Moretz, Christopher Mintz Plasse, Gerard Butler, Johnny Knoxville, Seann William Scott, Halle Berry & Stephen Merchant.Wow what a line up. But this does prove that no matter how many stars you have in a movie it does not mean it will be an instant success. It is a shame that this was not better received it was not as bad as it was made out to be. If you see this, do not expect to see Oscar winning performances and a classic story line this is not going to be remembered by the industry in about 10 years time. But if you want a bit of fun with some strange stories then this is the film to watch. I suggest getting a group of friends over and just watching it together it is good to watch with other people.It is hard to choose a favourite story from them all. There are some that stick in my mind more than others I think my favourite was The Catch starring Hugh Jackman and Kate Winslett. It was so sick, but really funny.I will give this film 7 out of 10."Remember Machines – They're full of kids"For more reviews, please like my Facebook page:https://www.facebook.com/pages/Ordinary-Person-Movie- Reviews/456572047728204?ref=hl

Movie 43 is unique. You don't see how you were able to remove it for $5 million and with such a cast. How did they agree? As for the plot? In general, Movie 43 is even sometimes a funny absurd comedy, there is a lot of trash here. Perhaps the most unusual experience of the viewer in the last 10 years in the industry. The producers of this supposedly damn genius film.

Movie 43 isn't really a movie. More like a bunch of messed up sketches featuring some very well known actors, and leprechauns. Movie 43 is a story of 3 guys searching online for Movie 43, which was originally thought up by one of these guys as a lie to break his brothers computer. This film is practically a showcase of what they find.In between each clip you see the guys reactions from these clips and then eventually they put together that Movie 43 is actually a movie, and what they have come across is going to change the world forever. Some of these sketches are quite amusing I must say but the whole story line just seems pointless.I would say watch this, but would say it's not worth spending much money on.If you do watch this just be sure you are prepared for some dodgy sketches which do literately make you think WTF.The most messed thing in this, is the final sketch which features a cartoon cat called Beezle. He hates his owners partner and literally ends up killing her. (if you are interested in only this sketch then I'm sure it will be on YouTube)Hope this has helped you to decide whether or not to watch this.(sorry for any spelling or grammar mistakes)

What do you think of when someone mentions sketch comedy films? I automatically think of the masterpiece, and one of the greatest comedies ever, MONTY PYTHON'S MEANING OF LIFE. Unfortunately it seems the Pythons were the only ones to ever make a good feature film made-up of sketches.In recent years different writers and directors have tried teaming up to create feature films made up of shorts. The two most recent films that come to mind are THE TEN, the Paul Rudd hosted comedy made up of shorts inspired by the ten commandments, and V/H/S, one of last year's biggest disappointment in the horror genre.Now we have MOVIE 43, which has some of the funniest and embarrassing moments you'll witness in film today. Yes, with each sketch you get a different director and cast members, which makes for a very mixed bag of nuts! So I'll be reviewing each segment separately. Almost all of the segments are written by Rocky Russo & Jeremy Sosenko and those that are not I will credit accordingly.The main story, The Thread, directed by Steven Brill, focuses on two dim-witted teenagers trying to get even with one of their technically savvy younger brothers on an April fools joke. They've asked him to use his computer skills to find a banned film called Movie 43 on their computer to distract him while they load his laptop full of viruses.Hugh Jackman and Kate Winslet star in The Catch, directed by Peter Farrelly of the Farrelly Brothers. This relies heavily on the gross-out factor rather than the shock value of having a man's genitals exposed during a date. What is funny is that Kate Winslet seems to be the only one who notices the problem. It is in her reaction where the genuine laughs lie, yet Farrelly seems more keen on trying to make us disgusted by the presence of the genitals rather than to work a little harder on getting the laughs out of the performance of this talented actress.Liev Schreiber and Naomi Watts star in Homeschooled, directed by Will Graham (The Onion News Network) and written by Will Graham and Jack Kukoda. This is easily one of the funniest bits in the entire film. Two loving parents explain to their new neighbours how they've worked really hard at giving their son the same experiences he'd receive during high school in their personalized home-school program.Anna Faris and Chris Pratt star in The Proposition, directed by Steve Carr (Paul Blart: Mall Cop). This is the lowest point of the film and worthy of walk-outs in theatres. A couple are excited to take their relationship to the next level. To Pratt's character, this means getting engaged. However, before he pops the big question he lets his girlfriend share her idea for what will take their relationship to the next level. The only funny thing about this segment of the film is how excited Anna Faris is about her idea.Kieran Culkin and Emma Stone star in Veronica, directed by Griffen Dunne and written by Matthew Portenoy. This is written, acted and directed perfectly. An awkwardly funny short segment that is dark, twisted and strangely romantic in that psychotic sort of way.In another failed attempt at what could have been a really funny segment, writer Will Carlough and director James Duffy give us Justin Long as Robin trying out some speed dating only for Jason Sudeikis, as Batman, to make the experience even more uncomfortable than it needs to be. Uma Thurman is Louis Lane, Kristen Bell is Supergirl and Leslie Bibb is Wonder Woman in Super Hero Speed Dating.A quick but clever sketch, Machine Kids, written and directed by Jonathan van Tulleken, provides a good and well-deserved laugh.We hit a peak here with the iBabe, directed by Steven Brill and staring Richard Gere and Kate Bosworth. The title already gives too much away.Chloë Grace Moretz and Christopher Mintz-Plasse star in Middleschool Date, directed by Elizabeth Banks and written by Elizabeth Shapiro. The opening to the segment is the most shocking thing I think I've ever seen done in comedy. It goes from horrific to hilarious very quickly. This short is a major achievement in comedy.Happy Birthday shift us in a new direction with a buddy comedy written by Jacob Fleisher. Johnny Knoxville tries to stop his best friend and roommate, Seann William Scott, from moving out after sleeping with his girlfriend, by getting him the best birthday present ever. I've never liked anything directed by Brett Ratner before this.Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant star in Truth or Dare, where the film looses it's pace with another segment directed by Peter Farrelly, written by Greg Pritikin. You can already guess what happens by the title and Arrested Development used the idea better in a sub-plot that was only ever referred to.At this point The Tread, which should only act as a back-story and a clever way to edit the segments together, takes over and turns into a bad science fiction film. Not funny bad either, just bad. Think Terminator without Terminator.Rusty Cundieff directs Victory's Glory which resurrects Movie 43 just before the credits. Taking us back to 1959, Terrence Howard coaches an all-black basketball team afraid to play the all-white team for the first time.Lastly we have James Gunn's Beezel with Elizabeth Banks and Josh Duhamel. Simply removing this sketch completely would have been a big part of saving this film. This low point is only second to The Proposition segment. We end off on a gross-out joke, leaving a bad taste in your mouth when you finish watching the film.Between some tasteless trash, the gems within the film are lost.

reviews.review_title: Four Hilarious Sketches Make It Worth the Time
reviews.content: The first two sketches are hilarious (The Catch and Homeschooled); as is Truth or Dare and the final sketch, Beezel (which begins after the credits start, so keep watching). The rest of the sketches are mostly throw-aways, though most have their moments. The framework device with Greg Kinnear and Dennis Quaid (The Pitch) is also not bad. Superhero Speed-Dating was also pretty funny, though not perfect (especially the ending). If you want something different and don't mind questionable taste/coarse humour, it is definitely worth a look.Possibly even funnier than the movie are all the terrible reviews. Granted, the movie is in poor taste, but it IS funny. These days, if a 90-minute movie has four sketches in it that are side-splittingly funny, another one or two that are quite funny, with the occasional chuckle randomly scattered among the rest of the debris, that's a pretty good deal, in my book.This movie is NOT ANYWHERE near the worst thing that Hollywood has ever turned out. That might seem like a strange endorsement, but it needs to be said. At least it's not another dreaded and dreadful movie remake of some 60s/70s TV show. As if the world needs more of that.

reviews.review_title: Yes, it's the worst movie I've seen in my life!
reviews.content: I decided to watch "movie 43" despite awful reviews, just because of curiosity.It is absolutely the worst movie I've seen in my life. (I wish I didn't need to add anything else, because really, these is nothing else to be said... but the program on IMDb requests 10 lines for a review. I wish I could add something to make the required 10 lines, but it's so awfully boring, I can't move myself to even attempting discussing any "plot", as it's simply non- existing. Is it 10 lines already?)Watch only if you want to find a new benchmark for "awful".

I really wanted to like this movie, I really did. I mean you're presented with this offbeat yet intriguing idea about movie shorts and a huge cast with a lot of A-list talent. The experience itself was just awful! The star-studded cast shocked me, with content this ridiculous. Why did they agree to be in such a atrocious film? The last short, about the cartoon cat really disturbed me. Imho this is not even dark humor, don't waste your time! I have seen many B-flicks in my lifetime- and this one definitely ranks a slot on that list! I got it for half-off rental at my video store but even that was a joke. Sad, just sad...

reviews.review_title: Quite literally the worst film I've ever seen
reviews.content: This films haunted me for 8 years I think about it more than most and I suppose some would say that makes it impactful and I had a response and that's the point of art I think it's so unbelievably bad and the cast is so exceptionally good that the fact this went from script to all of those high profile actors accepting presumably most having read it themselves and all through production nobody stopped and said hey this is terrible in every single way and should never exist and then they would burn down the studio preventing this film from ever being made. When will this film leave me be.

reviews.review_title: Laziness in producing an actual movie more offensive than actual content
reviews.content: Anyone who caught the trailer (the red-band trailer in particular) before seeing this movie should have understood how offensive this movie would probably be. Personally, I thought the trailer was hilarious, and actually looked forward to its release. Unfortunately, as the movie gets underway, it's pretty apparent that the majority of the good gags were reserved for the trailer, leaving a lot of poorly executed filler. Even though the trailer shows several different story lines, I'd originally assumed that they would somehow be intertwined into a single story or theme; like you might find in an actual movie. Instead what you get is a collection of lame skits on par with a college film project, using a star-studded cast as bait. I don't know if it was the writing, or the editing, but I found the laziness in the production way more offensive than the content. If you're looking for a good laugh, with offensive jokes from big celebrities, catch the red-band trailer; skip the film.

This is one of the weirdest films I've seen in a long time, which is refreshing considering nowadays everything seems very cliché and repetitive. I'm thankful when I see something that surprises me, so that added several points to the score. Also, on the positive side, it made me laugh out loud more than once.On the negative, in other parts it went too far and were simply disgusting. And some of the stories were like SNL skits or YouTube productions. I feel sorry for whoever paid a ticket to watch this at the cinema.I feel this film is the result of someone going "experimental" and taking a big risk. It could have gone right or wrong. It went wrong, but still worth watching for a bit of silly fun with friends.

This movie is a hidden gem. I can understand why this movie is not liked by others. This is a trash comedy and it doesn't need to be taken seriously. It's best that you watch this movie with your friends.

NOT FOR THOSE WHO GOT OFFENDED EASILY.

reviews.review_title: One of the dumbest movies I've ever seen...
reviews.content: One of the dumbest movies I've ever seen... but I could not stop laughing. From start to finish, this was some of the most disrespectful, crass, low-blow humor I've seen in a long time.But I loved it!Terrance Howard delivered a victory speech to his black football team that rivals any coaches speech, but it doesn't stop there. From Hugh Jackman and the scrotum, to Emmma Stone and Kate Winslett. This movie has more a-listers than the grammys. Anna Faris, Halle Berry, Chris Pratt, and they all cross the line with dirty humor and hilarious comedy. Its like SnL but without limits.I read some of the reviews and I guess its not for everyone, but if you want to laugh and don't want to face limits on how you laugh, this movie is awesome.

reviews.review_title: "Gotcha suckers" to everyone they got involved
reviews.content:
To pull that big of a middle off to Hollywood deserves a 10.
And in that bane, I believe it was hilarious

reviews.review_title: Look to say its worst movie ever is a stretch but it def wasn't good
reviews.content: When this movie first came out I wanted to see it originally because I loved the sound of the structure of this movie along with the amazing cast. I was deterred however by horrid reviews. Fast forward to 2020 this movie was on sale for only 1$ at supermarket and thought what the heck lets see what this whole thing is all about.Only great thing I can sadly say is its not a long movie. Clocks in at about 1 hour 15 minutes with small mid credit scene so a combined 1 hour 20 minutes. So it defintely breezes by.Other then that the movie is just overall terrible. First the humor is virtually almost non-existent. Sure there were couple of skits I had few laughs or so. But there were several I watched through with completely straight face. Second I don't mind vulgar things but this movie reached new level of vulgar it was just flat out disgusting. I couldnt believe someone actually thought stuff like this. It was almost like director was enacting weird fetishs and fantasys he had. And lastly I thought the acting even for the material given was piss poor. It was almost like all these A-listers said who cares we're getting paid!Overall I hated this movie, but to call it worst movie ever like most have. Is huge insult to lot of really even worse movies and thats about one only good things I can say here.

reviews.review_title: I wish this was a web series instead
reviews.content: Just a strange watch, don't want to watch again, and can't recommend.This is sort of a parody of parody movies, kind of. More realistically it's a compilation of SNL sketches that can't be done in front of a live audience due to production restrictions.It's almost like a monkey's paw of comedy fantasies. I wished to see a romance scene between Anna Faris and Chris Pratt (they were together at the time), but it involves poop (just not for me). And you could say something similar about all 12 sketches.While I might recommend this if it was a series of internet videos, it's just not a movie. The overall sketch that thinly links all the stories together is the worst one and dropping it allows the others to thrive independently.Honestly don't bother, there are so many other things to watch.

This movie is actually pretty funny. Note that it is low brow cringe type humor. Not everyone likes that, especially movie critics. But if you like that type of humor then you will find this to be really funny. The most cringe, most funny skit has to be the home schooling one.

Movie 43 is supposed to be a comedy. Supposed to be! It's a sketch-Movie consisting of 12 short skits starring Oscar-Winning actors who you could swear were blackmailed to be in this awful piece of film (and actually somewhat were like Richard Gere!). This movie has no plot. There is somewhat of an overarching storyline but it is as nonsensical and anti-climatic as it can get. A director pitches his crazy ideas to some guy. Aside from that the skits have no connection whatsoever and you just jump from one scene to another making the movie an utterly disjointed mess. But who cares about the plot anyway since the main fun of the movie comes from the skits right? .... right? If only you knew. This movie is unfunny, so incredibly unfunny that it is actually painful to watch at times. It tries to be funny without a doubt but just comes over as extremely awkward. Usually it follows this pattern: Skit makes one joke in the beginning of the scene and from then on repeats and drags on for 5 minutes until you get to the next sketch. The jokes are sometimes funny for a second but the skits culminate in nothing, there is no punchline, nor is it getting any better. I literally sat there at one point giving myself continuous facepalms hoping it would erase the memory of what I just witnessed, not because it was disgusting or anything, but simply because I couldn't believe this thing was made. The skits are so unfunny that the movie desperately tries to bring some shock value into them. It is trying so hard in fact , that it is way to obvious their intention for the public was to go "ewww" every now and then, like a studio audience that needs to laugh on demand. But it doesn't shock at all. It just comes off as plain stupid and uncreative. And that is exactly what this movie is. Stupid, uncreative and unfunny. Occasionally there is something funny for just a second but if anything it doesn't result in laughter but in blowing our air out of your nose, and that only because you can't fathom how stupid it is. A lot of people on IMDb give this Movie more than 0-3 stars which in find hard to grasp but many argue that those who dislike the movie possess "no humour" or rate it that way because they are offended or take it to seriously. Let me say this: I wasn't offended a single time during this movie because it is as offensive as an 8 year old who thinks he will shock me if he says "poop". I don't watch every movie completely seriously. I love comedies, especially dark and offensive humour, so I should be the perfect demographic for this movie. But to me it doesn't deliver on any level of cinema in general. Conclusion: To me, Movie 43 is a terribly disjointed, nonsensical, pseudo-offensive, unfunny, badly-written, mediocrely acted, badly directed, cheaply produced, self-important "comedy skit movie" that has no point existing.Feel free to disagree, but don't tell me that that I'm wrong because I "don't get it" or something along the lines. If you like the movie, good for you, I don't judge you, even if I think it's terrible, it is just an opinion and you may like something about it I have not thought of yet.

reviews.review_title: Hollywood how was this okay to release?
reviews.content: Hollywood how was this okay to release? Wow so many famous people. How could this movie be so bad? I wouldn't watch it to find out.

reviews.review_title: One of the funniest movies I've ever seen.
reviews.content: I'm not retarded, at least I don't think I am, however, this movie unlocked a special sort of retardation that has been locked away for too long. I Loved every second of it and it was an absolute breath of fresh air. I would recommend this to anyone who has a good sense of humor. No idea why people hate this movie, please I beg you, don't listen to the bad reviews, this is pure genius.

The portmanteau movie was a fad in the 1960s and early 70s. It never worked - as a whole the narrative discontinuities, the shifts in tone and style left no-one satisfied. If a typical narrative movie takes its viewers on a journey, the portmanteau film took them as far as the airport then left them in the departure lounge until further notice. So, knowing that it has been mercilessly pilloried in its home market, I was expecting little from Movie 43. I was pleasantly surprised.If you go to see this film because you're attracted by the names of top shelf actors such as Kate Winslet, Liev Schreiber, Naomi Watts and Richard Gere you'll be sorely disappointed. Movie 43, whose provenance is in the Peter Farelly school of gross-out comedy is about as far away from cinema as a dramatic art as you're ever likely to get. If, on the other hand, you have a taste for humour that contravenes every shibboleth of polite society, then this is the movie for you - it's politically incorrect, flagrantly ridiculous, and persistently crass. It's also cleverly done. I am not familiar with the work of Seth 'Family Guy" MacFarlane who has a cameo here but from what I've heard of it, this film is in the same spirit.After we get the framing intro with Quaid and Kinnear playing it tongue-in-cheek, the first segment gives us Kate Winslet on a blind date with Hugh Jackman, who is devilishly handsome but has one anomalous feature - a shaven scrotum growing out of his neck like a turkey wattle. This set-up tells you everything you need to know about what awaits you in Movie 43. The scene itself it is funny like Seth's dick-drawing fixation in Superbad but what makes it so much better than just being outlandish is that whilst, of course, the well-bred young woman can't keep her eyes off the misplaced testes, everyone else, including their owner, is oblivious to them. Winslet captures the dilemma of her character perfectly as she grows increasingly desperate for someone to acknowledge her would-beau's neck balls, yet is unable to come straight out and say anything that might be inappropriate.This is followed by a segment in which real-life couple Liev Schreiber and Naomi Watts recount to some new neighbours their regime for home schooling their own teenage son. The loving parents, to make sure that their boy gets a rounded eduction, have carefully reproduced every humiliating, degrading and awkward moment of high school. Comedy is often described as the bringing together of incongruent ideas and this is exactly what makes Movie 43 work. Perhaps the funniest segment, however, is one in which Terrence Howard plays a coach for the first black high school basketball team in US history and tries to explain to his long-segregated players that they are bound to win because they are black.Not all the segments work as well as these and there is a tendency, as is so often for comedies of this frenetic stripe, to run a little ragged at the end. The final segment involving a Garfield-like cartoon cat with sexual designs on its owner was for me the weakest of them and one with a coprophilic fixation I could have done without.If you don't like gross-out comedy definitely give Movie 43 a wide berth but if you do, seeing this sort of thing done by a quality cast is an appealing twist.

reviews.review_title: Shut off your morals & mind and just have fun
reviews.content: Rated R comedies have been making a major surge over the years and really raking it in at the box office. At the same time there have been a lot of films coming out featuring huge A-list casts in every genre, but none more than the latest Movie 43. The trailers were pretty funny, but offered little to what the film was actually about and a bit confusing. Along with the amazing A-list cast it features numerous directors leading the charge including Peter Farrelly, James Gunn, Bob Odenkirk, Brett Ratner, and more. Could this film actually deliver up to the hype or will it be another failed experiment? Movie 43 is an anthology style that follows an overarching segment featuring a crazed screenwriter pitching his insane idea for a movie. Each non-connecting segment delvers a strange array of stories that make little to no sense connected together. Before saying anything about this film you have to understand that this film will only appeal to certain audiences and even then only if they are willing to let it be what it is. The performances aren't always great here, but the overall experiment is really fun. This movie is receiving a lot of negative buzz, but most of that falls more in the fact of too much thought put into it. They step over the line in almost every aspect in this film and it works if you let it. There are tons of uncomfortable laugh out loud moments, but if you try to analyze it or look for smart comedy it just won't work. This is potty humor that will probably only entertain those that look for that sort of thing and enjoy the over the top nature of it all. Most of the moments in this film are unnecessary, but still delivers the raunchy strange comedy that fans of the genre will enjoy.If nothing else all the actors in this film deserve major props as each one put themselves out there. It looked as though they are just having a great time playing in these little worlds and it shows. Seeing some of them step out of their usual types of roles is enough to check this film out and who knows maybe you will enjoy the nasty potty humor that goes along with it along the way. With a cast featuring almost anyone you can think of there has to be someone in there that will appeal to you, so turn off your brain and just have fun.

reviews.review_title: This movie is funny because it isn't all of the other crap we've had to endure
reviews.content: Grown Ups, Jackass, Scary Movie, and all of their sequels. If you are tired of movies like Project X full of no names and nothing of value, try this on for size.Yes, the point of this movie is to offend, raise the level of dirty and do it with huge stars. That is the point, so if that isn't your cup of tea, then I suggest you skip it.If you enjoy random humor that you've been secretly hoping Hollywood would use for years, then try this out. At least it isn't one of the 42 sequels coming out this year (2013).People who say they hate this film were clearly not expecting it or lovers of movies like "A Walk in the Clouds" and "Jackass 3D".
Why so low rating, it's great very originall. Don't believe the bad reviews and go watch if you have humor, you'll love it.

I saw clips on the television, I had no idea of the premise, but it had a good all-star cast, and I wanted to satisfy my curiosity. Basically, Calvin Cutler (Mark L. Young) and his friend J. J. (Adam Cagley) make a video for YouTube, it instantly gains 1,000,00 views. But this is an April's Fools joke by Calvin's little brother Baxter (Devin Eash) who is a wiz at hacking. So, to get their own back, they claim there is a movie they want him to find. They claim it's the most banned movie in the world that could lead to consequences, perhaps for the world, if watched, it's called Movie 43. As they watch various short films, related to the internet search, they realise it's real, and a terrorist threatens them to get it. "The Catch" sees single businesswoman Beth (Kate Winslet) on a blind date with the city's most eligible bachelor Davis (Hugh Jackman), but the meal is overshadowed by her inability to stop staring at his neck, which has a pair of testicles dangling from it, but only she seems to acknowledge it. "Homeschooled" sees Anna (Anna Madigan) and Sean (Alex Cranmer) having coffee with neighbours Robert (Liev Schreiber) and Samantha (Razzie nominated Naomi Watts) who home-school their teenage son Kevin (Jeremy Allen White), but the parents have also replicated the school environment, acting out bullying, detentions, throwing high school parties, and Samantha simulates being a girlfriend, but worse is Kevin using a broom with his mother's face on it like a person. "The Proposition" sees Vanessa (Anna Faris) and Doug (Chris Pratt) together for a year, he wants to propose marriage, but she interrupts and proposes to let him poop on her, urged by his friend Larry (J. B. Smoove), he agrees to this, so he eats a large meal and drinks laxative, but his impatience to crap gets her angry, chasing her he is hit by a car, causing his bowels to explode, she runs to him, and sitting in his excrement he proposes marriage, she accepts. "Veronica" sees Neil (Kieran Culkin) working late in a grocery store, in walks his ex-girlfriend Veronica (Emma Stone), they start arguing and unknowingly it is heard on the intercom by the customers, the discussion turns sexual, and when she walks out the customer urge him to chase after her. "iBabe" sees developers of the iBabe life-size nude woman replica MP3 player discussing the problem of male buyers attempting to have sex with it, but a fan is in the genital region, the boss (Richard Gere) listens to opinions from workers Arlene (Kate Bosworth), Robert (Aasif Mandvi) and Brian (Jack McBrayer) to change the advertising. "Superhero Speed Dating" sees Robin (Justin Long) and Batman (Jason Sudeikis) at a Gotham City speed dating event, Robin tries to get to know women like Lois Lane (Uma Thurman) and Supergirl (Kristen Bell), but Batman reminds him they are looking for a bomber, they encounter Superman (Bobby Cannavale) and Wonder Woman (Leslie Bibb) before the Penguin (John Hodgman) reveals himself, but the bomber turns out to be the Riddler (Will Carlough) disguised as a girl Robin kissed. "Machine Kids" is a short commercial narrated by Phil Crowley showing young men told not to have sex with the iBabe. "Middleschool Date" sees middle school students Nathan (Jimmy Bennett) and Amanda (Chloë Grace Moretz) on their first date, they start kissing and Nathan's older brother Mikey (Christopher Mintz-Plasse) comes in teasing them, then Amanda starts having her period, Nathan panics thinking she is bleeding to death, and Nathan's Dad (Patrick Warburton) and Amanda's Dad (Matt Walsh) get involved too. "Tampax" is a short commercial with two women swimming in the ocean, and one of them suddenly gets savagely eaten by a shark with masses of blood, it's an advertisement for tampons. "Happy Birthday", directed by Brett Ratner (Rush Hour, Tower Heist), sees Brian (Seann William Scott) giving his roommate Pete (Johnny Knoxville) a captured Leprechaun (Gerard Butler) as a birthday present, it's tied up and they want the obscene creature to tell them where his pot of gold is, the Leprechaun's brother (also Butler) comes to rescue him and shoots the humans, but they kill the leprechauns, find the pot of gold, and Brian reveals to Pete he also caught a Fairy (Esti Ginzburg) who gives blowjobs for gold coins. "Truth or Dare" sees Emily (Razzie nominated Halle Berry) and Donald (Stephen Merchant) on a blind date together in a Mexican restaurant, tired with typical dates she suggests a game of Truth or Dare, after some truths he is dared to pinch a man's bottom, and she is dared to blow a blind child's birthday candles, as the game goes on, the dares get crazier, such as dunking breasts in guacamole, tattooing an ejaculating penis to a cheek, getting a face lift, lip surgery and enlarged breasts, and getting surgery to look Asian, until they do go back to an apartment together. "Victory's Glory" sees Coach Jackson (Terrence Howard) lecturing his all black basketball team facing an all white team, saying that they will win because they are black, and they do. Finally, "Beezel" sees Amy (Elizabeth Banks) worrying that animated cat Beezel is coming between her relationship with boyfriend Anson (Josh Duhamel), the cat is secretly evil to her, she hates him but Anson sees him as sweet and innocent, but with her threatening to leave Anson agrees to find the cat a new home, the next day Amy goes in search for him and Beezel tries to kill her, and vice versa, but she looks like the villain and children at a party beat her up, Anson comforts Beezel, and the cat daydreams of kissing him. This may be the most over-the-top, gross-out movie you'll find, full of highly bizarre and in your face daringly offensive moments, the stars do have a sense of humour, but you question their reasons for allowing themselves to feature in such ludicrous material, I admit I tittered at how ridiculous it was and some amusing bits, but it's not a good ensemble comedy anthology film. It won the Razzies for Worst Picture, Worst Director for Elizabeth Banks (Pitch Perfect 2 - "Middleschool Date"), Steven Brill (Little Nicky, Mr. Deeds - "iBabe"), Steve Carr (Daddy Day Care, Paul Blart: Mall Cop - "The Proposition"), Rusty Cundieff, James Duffy, Griffin Dunne (Practical Magic, The Accidental Husband - "Veronica"), Peter Farrelly (Dumb and Dumber, There's Something About Mary - "The Pitch", "The Catch", "Truth or Dare"), Patrik Forsberg, Will Graham, and James Gunn (Slither, Guardians of the Galaxy), and Worst Screenplay, and it was nominated for Worst Screen Combo for the entire cast. Adequate!
Modern movies trying to adopt the comedy genre never could incite the feeling that comedies from the 90s and early 2000s gave. This is the first time in a decade that a movie achieved that.

reviews.review_title: A comedy gem! Movie 43 is amazing
reviews.content:
Movie 43 is like a more demented version of Saturday Night Live with hilarious results.
The film revolves around a wannabe filmmaker who pitches a outrageous script in a Hollywood studio.
We see his ideas through several sketches that involve very very strange things including 2 blind dates that involve a twist.
A woman who wants her boyfriend to perform a rather wierd fetish.
A cat who loves his owner more than just an owner.
A typical middle school date that goes horribly wrong.
The DC universe being satirized
A company known as ibabe that is dealing with a problem revolving around the model10/10 Movie 43 is a underrated laugh fest

I just finished watching it in 3 different languages (Rus,Eng,Ger) and I laughed all the times.This movie gives a new perspective about humor. It's experimenting and it's not developed for everyone, for masses or some kind of audience. You must prepare for horrible, dirty, idiotic, retarded, fantastic, over board sarcasm about everything.I hate long reviews, so this is how it goes: if you have strong beliefs, values, principles or you think you have strong taste in movies, especially in comedy - this movie isn't for you. The perspective is just different: not bad, not good, just different. If you catch up with it - you'll have a laugh of a life time. If you don't - you can come back and leave a mean comment or whatever...I hate long reviews, so this is how it goes: if you have strong beliefs, values, principles or you think you have strong taste in movies, especially in comedy - this movie isn't for you. The perspective is just different: not bad, not good, just different. If you catch up with it - you'll have a laugh of a life time. If you don't - you can come back and leave a mean comment or whatever...

reviews.review_title: "Catching that leprechaun must have been hard work"
reviews.content: I'm a cranky 48-year-old who doesn't dig most recent attempts at absurd comedy. {For the record, I absolutely love "Monty Python," SNL, and "South Park," especially the early seasons.} I was in a particularly crabby mood when I started watching MOVIE 43 and almost stopped it after the early "ballsy blind date" skit, but something bade me to stay with it, and even though I wasn't all that satisfied, it cheered me up and even made me lol, something I don't do often, in a couple of spots.There is some nice satire and parody here on a bunch of miscellaneous subjects: home schooling, computer dating sites, breast enlargement surgery, superheroes, after-school specials, you name it. The fact that there are so many Hollywood big-shots in parodies of their typical roles adds a great deal to this little batch of spoofs. There's a lot of gross humor, of course: Scat, mutilation, body parts, etc, but MOVIE 43 doesn't feel the need to just rub its audience's face in these elements, making its point without showing TOO much nauseating stuff. {Fans of nauseating stuff will definitely find some here, but they may be disappointed that it doesn't go farther.} The biggest problem with this film is that it's nowhere near as developed and focused as it could be, and virtually all the scenes, many of which would be worth entire films unto themselves, end just as they start to get interesting. But maybe that's the point because, as the young aspiring filmmakers in the central story attest, the biggest thing this film seems to be parodying is today's lazily produced low budget films(premature credits rolling at 76 minutes, etc).Though it's far from great, there are definitely some things to appreciate here. MOVIE 43 is disorganized and underdone, but even in those respects, it still works (kind of). I think that 25 or so years ago, when I was more into humor for its own sake and less inclined to analyze everything to death, my verdict would have been about the same.

It's like marmite but hugh jackman neck scar was so funy. Its main story is as bad as hottub time machine but some of the sketches were so far out there and for that alone it's good. I was like how did they get that group of actors to do that.

reviews.review_title: This movie is met to be wrong (8.4/10)
reviews.content: Is it really that bad, nope, I find it to be kind of funny, this movie is not bad as critics think it is, because I've seen worse, believe me. all of the skits made me a laugh, I've notice all of the skits are filled with stuff that are just so wrong, and I think it's met to be that way. Yeah this comedy is wrong, because I realize all skits they do in this movie are so wrong, and that's what this film is, wrong. Overall this film is met to be offensive, gross, and so wrong, so yeah this film is kind of funny to watch, it's kind of like a live-action Family Guy, so yeah I can understand what this film is trying to be, so give it a watch, and see what you think, the only problem I have with the movie is the guy in the Pitch skit, the one that's refusing to buy the loser guy's film, because it's way to offensive, gross, and crude? Um... that's the point of his project, so that's my only problem with the film.

reviews.review_title: One of the worst, if not the worst film of 2013
reviews.content: This turkey was piecemealed together over 4 years while producer Charlie Wessler guilted or blackmailed A- listers into appearing in this anti-funny comedy. Not a single sketch works, not a single joke works and the whole thing is a depressing failure. Watching A-listers make fools out of themselves and drown in bad material is way less fun than it sounds here. At least they all had the sense to skip the premiere and refuse to promote this train wreck. Trey Parker, Matt Stone and the Zuckers were originally set up to film all the segments and wisely had the foresight to jump ship. 13 directors and none can transcend this crap.

reviews.review_title: Should've been called " Robot Chicken:Live Action"
reviews.content: This movie was dumb. It wasn't even really funny, but rather, something trying to be funny for no other reason than being raunchy. It didn't have any plot, but that wasn't the worst part, because I knew what I was going in. The problem was that it was random without any payoff. The jokes were stale and clichéd. In my opinion, the only "funny" parts were the ones with Knoxville and the Halle Berry date scene -- the last skit was OK, but not much to talk about. Overall, it isn't worth paying for (I didn't, I just watched it online). It consisted of a bunch of Robot Chickenesque vignettes, but this was garbage compared to that -- which amazes me because Robot Chicken is ONLY FIFTEEN FREAKING MINUTES!!!. Even though I didn't pay a cent for it, I STILL feel ripped off. Really, the only goo thing I can say about this was that it was, only an hour long. I clearly wouldn't recommend paying 10 bucks to see this in theater, but truthfully, I wouldn't even recommend wasting the two minutes it takes to Google and stream this film. Hugh Jackman and Halle Berry must have just had a spare weekend and wanted to go shopping, so they signed on to do this project and get a quick 10 thou.DON'T WASTE YOUR TIME!!!!

reviews.review_title: A compilation of short vignettes, mostly of the earthy humour type.
reviews.content: Charlie Wessler pitches Griffin Schraeder a more than screwed up movie idea.That's the conceit of the film. Griffin objects, but Charlie pulls a gun on him. Via some misadventures, Griffin's boss insists that Griffin go ahead with the project.The segments are many and short.Most of the segments are rude, crude, and barbaric.Luckily most of the shorts are laugh out loud funny.However, don't pursue if you do not like earthy humor.-----Scores-------Cinematography: 10/10 Sharp.Sound: 10/10 No problems.Acting: 7/10 Mixed. Some hilarious; some incredibly irritating.Screenplay: 5/10 A better name for this film would be 'Miscellaneous crap from the Cutting Room Floor.'

reviews.review_title: I dunno really what to say..?
reviews.content: Movie 43 is..Movie 43 is..the film is an anthology comedy film with about 10 shorts all with really famous actors like Halle Berry,Uma Thurman,Kate Winslet and Seann William Scott. Each short is very weird and some times disturbing. I don't have much to say but it's very unusual. The film has good shorts like iBabe which i did find funny,the Truth Or Dare one and I kind off liked the period one but apart from that,this..this film is weird and kind off bad. The film is very in some shorts not funny like the leprechaun one,now that was not funny at all probably because Johnny Stupid Knoxville was in it who I hate more then words cause of that dumb f****** show Jackass(although,I did like Bad Grandpa). Movie 43 is a slow,not too funny film that I could not even rate..

This movie is an absurd comedy. If you do not like or do not know what absurd comedy is then you should not watch it. Absurd comedies are generally tells a deeper messages sometimes or events in the movie could be related something in real life. You might not understand the movie but this does not make it bad movie. There are subliminal messages in absurd movies you should see it and understand it. Or an absurd movie does not have to tell you anything at all. Since it is absurd, you should not expect something realistic. There are worst absurd comedy examples but believe me this one is a successful one. Please do not rate or write a review if you do not know or like absurd comedies. Stay away from absurd art.

reviews.review_title: Well, it was a good try!
reviews.content: This movie is a pure example of stupid humour, i'm 15 and since I assume it was aimed at my age range I don't mind saying that i found a lot of it hilarious but some of it plainly unfunny. I will review each short individually.The Over-Story - Essentially an excuse for showing all the shorts there are certain moments that are funny but overall it is a fairly weak part of the film.The Catch - I found this one hilarious, starring Kate Winslet as a girl set up on a blind date with Hugh Jackman, a billionaire who for some reason has a pair of testicles growing out of his neck, this stupid humour had me rolling in my seat purely because it was so stupid and cringe worthy.Homeschooled - This slightly disturbing sketch about a home-schooled student who is given the high school experience by his dad (Liev Schreiber) picking on him and his mum (Naomi Watts) providing him with an unnerving first kiss. There were moments in this that were purely horrible like the first kiss, and funny moments like Liev Schreiber describing his actions to horrified neighbours.The Proposition - Essentially about Anna Faris wanting Chris Pratt to defecate on her, this was the second funniest segment to me, watching Chris Pratt stuff himself with Mexican food and laxatives on the advice of his mate before having to attempt to hold it in and then basically exploding was one of the funniest and most childish things I have ever seen.Veronica - I am not even sure as to the plot of this one, although very well and seductively acted by Emma Stone and Kieran Culkin the only moment that even made me smirk was Keiran Culkin fingering Emma Stones mouth in front of a queue of shoppers, this was one of the worst segments and the actors deserve much better, especially Emma Stone.IBabe - This segment featuring Richard Gere, Kate Bosworth and Jack McBrayer was fairly amusing about the naked woman shaped future ipod that teenagers had been having sex with and ending up with mangled penis' due to a badly placed cooling fan, Richard Gere raised enough laughs trying to comprehend why teenagers had been having sex with it and Kate Bosworth was good as the level headed ignored employee.Super Hero Speed Dating - This segment was very weak as well with only Jason Sudeikis as rude, cock-blocking Batman making me laugh. The rest of the actors including Uma Thurman, Justin Long, Kristen Bell and Leslie Bibb barely raising a smile.Machine Kids - Completely unamusing with no famous cast or comedy in sight, basically about kids who inhabit ATM's and photocopiers not getting any love was just depressing and bad.Middleschool Date - This was easily the funniest short with the insanely talented Chloe Grace Moretz as a high schooler getting her first period had me falling out of my chair laughing as Christopher Mintz Plasse and other guys tried to find a cure bringing sponges, mops, frozen peas, even calling 911 to try and cure her. This was just brilliantly acted, written and directed.
