Just excellently, brilliantly funny.Tampax - A small short about a leaking tampon causing a girl to be eaten by a shark was very funny.Happy Birthday - Seann William Scott and Johnny Knoxville kidnapping a leprechaun Gerard Butler was very stupid and not great, but had a few good laughs in it.Truth Or Dare - This segment starring Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant was very funny and Halle Berry doing unspeakable things with Turkey Blasters, Dips and blind kids was a high point of the movie, Stephen Merchant was solid and quite funny doing ridiculous dares as well.Victory's Glory - Terrence Howard explaining that a team of coloured basketball players could win because of their 'foot and a half dicks' and their race was amusing and stupid.Beezel - For God's sake leave the cinema before this awful, awful post credits sequence, Elizabeth Banks and Josh Duhamel having a cartoon cat disrupt their relationship is so unspeakably bad that it should go down as one of the worst scenes ever.Overall this movie has some extremely funny moments and some awful moments, it is not for the squeamish or easily offended. It is worth watching, purely for Chloe Grace Moretz's brilliant scene. A good attempt at an interesting idea.

reviews.review_title: If you really like good humor then you like this movie!
reviews.content: OK, I maybe understand why people give a bad rating because this movie is not the regular comedy which only make you laugh two or three times. This is maybe more like Little Britain kind of humor.... Thinking back about what I said that I maybe understand, well.... I don't. The more I think about this movie the better it gets! I gave it a higher rating to crank the rating a bit up, because the very low rating most people gave is just not true. Compared to other good comedies, like Superbad for example, this movie should be at least a 7. But just find out for yourself! Its not that bad as most write here, or they just don't understand good humor!

reviews.review_title: tasteless, crude, offensive fun... but not the worst film i've seen
reviews.content: I watched this expecting something that is in the category of "worst movies ever made" basing from reviews and ratings I have read, and even though it has a current rating of 4% (critics) & 30% (audience) in Rotten Tomatoes, I'm a bit ashamed that I don't think it's that bad. Yes the humor in this film ranges from offensive to downright nasty, but once you let go of your righteous indignation, I think it's quite enjoyable. Now, before you brand me as a mindless dumb ass with no taste in movies for saying I've enjoyed this one, stop right there and let me explain :)I'm not saying this is a masterpiece. It has no plot, only themed skits. The story lines are ludicrous, the jokes are offensive & tasteless, but what made this actually funny is that IT'S MEANT TO BE LUDICROUS AND OFFENSIVE. The big names obviously didn't do this for the money or prestige, so the fact that they're there means they're just having fun (either that or they're really good friends with the producers/directors) & makes me wanna have fun as well. The fact that the people behind this movie included scat/toilet humor, incestuous jokes, nudity/sexual content, graphic violence, racial slurs and other derogatory terms etc. etc. reinforces the idea that this film doesn't take itself seriously and they probably just made that movie to test the limits of the audience's ability to take offense. Like a nuisance candidate in a typical Filipino presidential elections/campaign, you know they're up to no good, but it sure is damn entertaining to watch them on national TV. Stupid and shameless yes, but a big props to them for having balls.The Verdict: Consider yourself warned. Leave your brains in the freezer or under the couch before watching this film because you don't need to do any form of thinking. Seeing Gerald Butler as a foul-mouthed, 2 1/2 feet tall leprechaun, or Hugh Jackman with balls hanging in his neck are signs that this movie doesn't aspire to be anything other than of shock humor value. Obviously it didn't work with most people, but I suggest you try it, who knows, maybe you can enjoy some tasteless comedy once in a while.My Rating: 2.5/5 - I can't guarantee that this movie will make you laugh (i think you have to be in the right mood to be as lenient as I was), if you're easily offended or disgusted, then skip this one.
When I watched this film at the cinema the loudest reaction from the audience was a muted cough halfway through.

This isn't the worst thing I have ever seen but it's certainly no work of a genius. There were a couple of funny moments but after a while the shock value wore off and turned to boredom. I think they were just trying too hard to do something outrageous but a movie doesn't work if it is just outrageous. It needs some sort of story behind it not just a bunch of short stories.This movie did pull an impressive cast though. I did enjoy the Halle Berry story as it was so ridiculous that it was comical and it was such a far cry from her normal roles. I'm glad I watched it as it gave me a couple of laughs and now I know that I never have to watch it ever again.

If you enjoy shows like Tim and Eric and Human Giant and other ridiculous sketch comedies chances are you'll like this. Leave your brain at the door cause this is stupid as hell and honestly has some serious WTF moments. It's the celebrities that carry this movies. If this had no names it would have been absolutely terrible. Critics will hate this no doubt but if your looking for an hour and half of laughs then this may be for you. It is disgusting in the best ways making you think did they really just get away that! The plot in this movie is not what they advertised it as being a few kids looking for a band video. I wont spoil it but the story around the shorts is ridiculous in it's own way to. Every short has it's moments and it will be fun to talk about who liked which best with your friends after. Honestly this movie is best viewed after a night at the bar but if your expecting any sort of depth, plot or structure look elsewhere. This is vile, insane and a good time if your immature and still find bathroom humor funny.

reviews.review_title: "43" is the number of letdowns and missed opportunities, but still funny.
reviews.content: What is "Movie 43″? It's a mostly weak excuse to gather together a massive mega-star cast to generate massive box office revenue as a film about massively disgusting things. Okay, so I've actually seen worse. But "Movie 43″ certainly doesn't pull any punches, and in striving to push the comedic envelope it misses more often than it hits. The novelty of watching very respectable actors do and say unmentionable things wears off eventually, but on perhaps three or four occasions the laughs simply can't be denied. "Movie 43″ is a collection of shorts with the singular goal of entertaining those that appreciate sick humor. But even those people will likely find 43 reasons to be underwhelmed with this movie.-Thomas Bond

I went to the theater with my girlfriend to see Movie 43 because from the trailer it seemed like there would be gross, offensive humor in it with a big star cast. Well, for those reviews who say they were "let down" or "fooled" by the trailer, I ask why?I've seen people shocked and outraged that what they saw in the trailer didn't translate into the movie. Well, yeah it did. And, it should have made it abundantly clear what kind of film you were getting into. A preview which features Anna Farris asking her real-life husband to poop on her, A basketball coach telling his players that they are black and the other team is white, 3 freaked out teenagers at home when one's period starts, and a tied up leprechaun.All of those things were in the preview, and people still say that they were mislead. I can only infer that from those things, this is going to be a very offensive, shock-humor type movie, and I was not disappointed. If you want to gross out your friends or have a really fun movie night, this is one to go see.

reviews.review_title: Funny how not Funny this movie is
reviews.content: Balls for a neck? A Mother teaching her son to kiss? Oscar Winning Actors were paid to do this? Seriously? I don't know, I must have a low tolerance for the many silly elements introduced simply for Shock Value. This movie just puts the brilliance of comedy to shame, in my opinion. Such amazing comedies out there that did not have to resort to such desparate standards to make the audience laugh.Any one looking for a real comedy, should watch : Mrs Doubtfire, Popstar, Groundhog Day, Pineapple Express... and the list goes on and on.A 4-star rating is perfectly fitting for such a movie.I'm glad the general public agrees.
Masterpiece, don't hesitate to watch it with kids and fam on a sunday afternoon

When you're watching a comedy, you're not supposed to take it seriously. If you can't even do that, you shouldn't be watching any kind of comedy at all. Haters in here are truely old and dry. Because this movie has it all!

This movie was bad, horrible even. It was stupid, barely had a plot, and is basically a series of little skits that do not link to each other in any way.That being said, it was freaking HILARIOUS! Not all of it, and sometimes not immediately, but I watched it on Saturday and still giggle to myself on Monday.Do *NOT* take this movie seriously. You would be hard pressed not to be offended, grossed out, or whatever. But, it was still funny, very funny. I actually had to pause the movie a couple of times because I was laughing so hard.I know this is a love or hate movie. Many folks just say HORRIBLE, 1 star. But many others really love it. I have nothing to compare this to, but *I* enjoyed it.Just FYI, I'm an educated director of technology and pretty darned smart, and don't drink or do any drugs, and I found this entertaining.I also loved Deadpool, thought Team America was stupid with a couple of giggles, love Monty Python, and loved the Chapelle Show. Maybe that'll help you out.Oh, and when watching, if a particular skit is too stupid, feel free to continue to the next one. This isn't 1 movie, its half a dozen scenes.

Movie 43 bonded my husband and 21 year old son like football and beer. They have laughed out loud throughout the movie. This movie seems to have every bizarre, grotesque scenario complete with the Who's Who of Hollywood fulfilling the roles. I don't remember a movie that both my emotionally stunted men have enjoyed so much together.It's a twisted tale of several short movies that I'm sure my men would pay to go see individually. It's a ballicous good time--pun intended. Personally, not my taste but I had fun laughing at my hubby and son. So, if you love your fun down and dirty, this one is for you. Well, maybe your husband and adult son.

While some movies can get away with being vulgar, this film is an absolutely scatterbrained collection of stupidity and coarse ideas like cold leftovers from all the major holidays mashed into a soup pot and served with a side of LSD.

Bold and funny, able to hold the audience, spoofing modern day technology and lots of silly and shameful cameo. This film is different and funny, entertaining and holds the audience. It works and do not be fooled, its worth checking out. I approached it with an open mind and knew nothing about it. DO NOT BE Conned, its pure brilliance, well crafted, well acted and totally left of field. I do not understand why it did not win more awards, and for the cast of millions it shows a great deal of boldness, the casting was brilliant and the sketches very original. If you do not see intense humor and fun here then your in the wrong world. I am sure that everyone will enjoy, (that is adults only of course)

reviews.review_title: They honestly tried to make an allstar cast comedy. And they failed miserably.
reviews.content: The bad: NOT funny. Whatsoever. NOT even a single joke was a success. It did look weird and I know I when I was suppose to laugh because the jokes were so obvious planted right before my face (NOW laugh, THIS is a joke) but I still couldnt care less.Not any good? Well the thing is that this movie has got an all star cast with tremendously good actors who have all earned their praise and some of them even won an Oscar. So the actors starring in this "comedy" are definitely top of the line, king of the hill, a number 1, but the jokes still are NOT funny.I would recommend it to not pay for it. See it for free if you can and experience firsthand what a completely FAILED comedy with an allstar cast looks like...

reviews.review_title: Not for people who LIMIT their sense of humor
reviews.content: If you're a prude then this movie is not for you. But if you can laugh at seemingly tasteless and offensive stuff then this movie is a good watch.It seems like a bunch of people saw a lot of big names and thought they were going to see a masterpiece or something...No this movie is just a bunch of short stories with off the wall humorThis movie is for people who think Family guy and South Park are funny.This is a good movie if you enjoy laughingI liked the movieI need to type some more lines

reviews.review_title: Funny movie- How does it have such a bad rating?
reviews.content: I think having all the celebrities in this movie was good, because people already liked these stars so it attracted more people. The movie is a bunch of skits put together. And they are pretty inappropriate. The first skit, with Kate Winslet and Hugh Jackman, deals with a date. And Hugh Jackman has man parts on his neck. And it is nasty. In another skit, there is an iBabe. It is a very realistic nude girl. Yes, you see graphic nudity. It is later said that boys were doing stuff to the iBabes and got there parts mangled by a fan in the iBabe. In other skits, Chloe Grace Moretz gets her period, a leprechaun wants his gold, Anna Faris wants her boyfriend to go number 2 on her, Halle Berry plays truth or dare on a date, Justin Long goes speed dating, Terrance Howard thinks race will help his basketball team win, and Naomi Watts and Liev Schreiber describe how it is they home school their son. The d word is said a lot, so is the f word. Lots of sexual content, and laughs.

reviews.review_title: "We're gonna make your movie this century's Howard The Duck"
reviews.content: That last quote is from Movie 43, and as the title implies, this movie is in fact this century's "Howard The Duck", so I guess they intentionally made it bad... right?They managed to gather an incredible ensemble cast, but not even the amazing powerhouse of all these actors could make this horrible script any good.Well, I'm gonna briefly go over every sketch in order:1) The Catch: Or as I like to call it "neckballs". We start out really bad with a segment in which Kate Winslet has a date with a Hugh Jackman that has testicles in his neck. It's very "Adam Sandler" type of comedy. It's as if Sandler wrote this idea for Grown-Ups 2 but was later dropped because it sounded so stupid.2) Homeschooled: Next up, we have Liev Schreiber and Naomi Watts have a teenage son, whom they have home-schooled. It's not hard to imagine they got both these actors in the movie since they are married in real life, so the chemistry is real between them. The awkwardness in this sketch was mildly funny, it would've have been OK in an SNL episode.3) The Proposition: This is where it gets really ugly. Chris Pratt and Anna Faris play a couple, and surprise surprise! They are also married in real life as well. This whole segment is all about poop jokes. Really, this is the epitome of stupid. I'm not even gonna go into detail because it's sick.4) Veronica: Kieran Culkin is working a night shift at a local grocery store and bumps into his ex-girlfriend, Veronica played by Emma Stone. Stone's performance was amazing even for a crappy film like this, but the comedy was just too dull and unoriginal.5) iBabe: This is one of the stupidest segments in the movie, and is what perfectly represents this movie in one scene.6) Superhero Speed Dating: This one stars Jason Sudeikis as Batman and Justin Long as Robin, with Uma Thurmanm as Lois Lane and Kristen Bella as Supergirl. This is my favorite one out of all the crappy skits that are on this movie. The reason? Jason Sudeikis. His comedic chops are great as always. Victory's Glory was pretty funny too but we'll get to that later7) Middleschool Date: Chloe Grace Moretz and Christopher Mintz- Plasse are brothers in this sketch, which is nice because we have half of the Kick-Ass cast reunited. I'm actually impressed Nicholas Cage didn't appear in this, he's in everything! Patrick Warburton is always awesome to have around in minor roles. But this sketch was just too boring and badly-written.8) Tampax: Was this intended to be funny?9) Happy Birthday: Johnny Knoxville captures a leprechaun for Seann William Scott. Pretty sweet to have the cast of The Dukes of Hazzard reunited, by the story so freaking stupid.9) Truth or Dare: This whole segment with Stephen Merchant and Halle Berry was just downward offensive and stupid. Halle Berry hasn't done anything good ever since her Oscar win, its actually pretty sad.10) Victory's Glory: Terrence Howard plays a basketball coach in 1959. They should have ended with this sketch because Howard's performance was just as funny as Jason Sudeikis' in Superhero Speed Dating. It wasn't as funny because the joke wasn't elaborated at all, he just kept repeating the same thing over again.11) Beezel: This is the one that really p*ssed me off. It actually amazed me by how stupid it is. Beezel is an animated cat who is jealous of his owner's new girlfriend, Elizabeth Banks. Every single aspect of this segment is infinitely hate-able, especially that f**king cat. Later out, I find out this was directed by James Gunn, the same director of Guardians of the Galaxy, which made even more p*ssed to know that this incredible director was involved in this piece of crap.12: Find Our Daughter: I later found out that there was a last skit in this movie, but I was so frustrated with that last entry that I had to stop the movie and light a cigarette. Apparently Bob Odenkirk stars and directs this, but I couldn't give a f**k about this anymore.It's pretty amazing that this excuse of a film took more than 4 years to be made. It seems this whole movie was written by 12 year-old kids. I'm so glad I didn't pay money to go watch it... on the other hand, I just wasted 90 minutes of my life that I will never get back. There is only one question to this whole movie: WHY?

This is one of the worst movies I have ever seen. Lowbrow humor with really offensive material aimed at shocking some humor out of the viewer. I can't believe they got so many quality actors to be a part of this disaster. As we say in Minnesota and Wisconsin - Uffda!
Now, seven years after its release, this movie still stands as the worst movie I have ever seen. Period!

I find this movie very entertaining,very funny ( i was in tears laughing especially the part with Kate Winslet and Hugh Jackman. Also the part with Elizabeth Banks and Josh Duhamel. Some people will find this movie offensive but they need to lighten up.Its original and the cast looks like they had a lot of fun doing the movie.I find this movie very entertaining,( i was in tears laughing especially the part with Kate Winslet and Hugh Jackman. Also the part with Elizabeth Banks and Josh Duhamel. Some people will find this movie offensive but they need to lighten up.Its original and the cast looks like they had a lot of fun doing the movie.

reviews.review_title: Laughed and jostled things up in my chest from years ago
reviews.content: Third time watching this movie, and I'm still laughing incredibly hard. Some of the skits had me laughing until my face hurt.

reviews.review_title: Maybe Funny if You're a Teenager...
reviews.content: I don't really know how best to illustrate my thoughts on this film. I never found myself really laughing along with any of the jokes in Movie 43. The two times I did laugh was not because I actually thought the film was funny but because of how ridiculous it was that someone thought it was a good idea to include the things they did.The main issue I had with the film is that everything is overplayed. None of the jokes have the kind of staying power that this film seems to think they have and as a result, every joke is dragged out for way too long. Almost the entirety of the film seems to feature the kind of humor that your stereotypical dude-bro frat boy might find funny. Almost every short sketch in this film contains one singular joke and for nearly every one of these jokes they are almost exclusively toilet humor or are of an explicit sexual nature. Every joke is spelled out as if the audience didn't catch the poop joke the last 5 times it was made. At some point any chance every sketch has of being funny becomes drawn out and annoying as a result.Going into this film I thought that it couldn't be so bad considering the relatively short run time, but while watching it, I found myself constantly wondering where the end was, only to find out that I was a quarter of the way through, half way through etc. This film, like its sketches, overstay their welcome by a lot and I can't say that I can recommend this to anyone unless you like to watch bad movies or, if for some reason, your sense of humor hasn't left high school.

reviews.review_title: The Worst Movie Hugh Jackman Has Appeared In
reviews.content: Continuing my plan to watch every Hugh Jackman movie in order, I come to Movie 43.Plot In A Paragraph: Featuring some of the biggest stars in Hollywood, a series of interconnected short films follows a teenager challenged by his brother and his friend, to find movie 43, the most secretive movie in the world.What on Earth is this movie?? Easily the worst movie in Jackman's filmography!! It is an embarrassment to all concerned. Jackman has once scene (as do all the celebs in the cast) and it's cringeworthy,How this attracted the cast it did, is beyond me!! I'll admit, I did laugh twice, but the best thing I can say about this movie, is it's run time is short.

reviews.review_title: Absolutely No Redeeming Value As a Film
reviews.content: A star studded comedy with not a single laugh to be had. Some of the skits have potential as concepts but none of them are executed well.The negative correlation of funny people to unfunny scenes is frankly astounding, in that this movie might be unique, but that doesn't make it worth a watch. Skip it and count yourself lucky to have an extra hour and a half of life that those that sat through this no longer have.

I'm kinda curious as to how the makers of this film got a lot of very well-known actors and actresses to star in this film... like seriously what did they do? Do they bave some sort of blackmail against them or something? Most of the skits/shorts freaked me out and I only enjoyed like 3 of them.

reviews.review_title: Strives for Kentucky Fried Movie, ends up more around Loose Shoes or If You Don't Stop You'll Go Blind
reviews.content: Low level movie executive Griffin Schraeder (Greg Kinner) listens to a pitch by unhinged screenwriter Charlie Wessler (Dennis Quaid) containing a series of vulgar, tasteless outrageous vignettes featuring an assortment A-List actors.A longtime passion project for Farrelly Brothers frequent producing partner Charles B. Wessler, who desired to make a modern day version of Funny or Die "except you can go crazy". The film had trouble getting financial backing due to studios disliking the scripts. Eventually Wessler managed to secure both Hugh Jackman and Kate Winslet for one short and used their presence in the film as a way to sell other A-list actors on the viability of the project in a way not too dissimilar from how international co-productions do presales based on the presence of big name stars. When the film was released it was savaged by critics, many of whom gave hyperbolic statements calling the film one of the worst ever made and in Richard Roeper's case "The Citizen Kane of awful". The movie isn't one of the worst ever made, but it's not all that good either.The central linking plot thread (in the version I saw, there is an alternate version I haven't seen) is basically a Swimming with Sharks type scenario by way of The Player where a fictionalized version of Charles B. Wessler played by Dennis Quaid is an insane homeless man who snuck into the production office by way of sexual favors and out of desperation holds Greg Kinnear's studio executive character Griffin hostage while reading his outlines. It's a reasonably amusing bit as we see the scenario get more deranged, but it's ultimate payoff is a rather lame 4th wall break that sacrifices much of the build up that promised an explosion and ended with a mild balloon pop.The vignettes the movie builds itself upon are mainly one joke affairs that such as Hugh Jackman playing a character with testicles on his chin and no one notices (except his blind date played by Kate Winslet) and a homeschooling situation that works a little "too hard" at the authentic high school experience, while others go for more bizarre gags involving leprechauns, superheroes, or strange animated pet cats. Many of these shorts maybe got on average .75 laughs, and given the average length of these shorts was around 4-6 minutes (rough estimate) it's not the best return but it's not the worst either.Movie 43 is kind of reminiscent of not so much the movie's producer Wessler was striving for like Everything You Ever Wanted to Know About Sex (But Were Afraid to Ask) or Kentucky Fried Movie, but more in line with stuff like Loose Shoes or If You Don't Stop You'll Go Blind. The only difference between those movies and this one is Loose Shoes or If You Don't Stop You'll Go Blind were made before Bill Murray and Robin Williams got famous and Movie 43 was made because these people were famous. While it certainly is a disappointing output from proven comic actors and directors, it's hardly the worst comedy film or "The Citizen Kane of Awful" especially when we consider the fact that Craig Moss and Seltzerberg exist.

I'm not sure why people are so hard on this movie...I guess it could be considered low-brow humor, but I found it funny. It is similar to the 1977 John Landis film, Kentucky Fried Movie, with a bunch of short skits. What I really like is the fact that they do have big name actors in it, and I can only imagine they had a blast making it ! Perhaps the people who aren't finding the humor in it are more accustomed to the three rib-tickling Shakespeare comedies...now THOSE are bombs !!

reviews.review_title: I have watched 12 times this movie!
reviews.content: In my opinion this is the funniest and most controversial movie with dark humor. I watched this movie 12 times in last 8 years and everytiime when i watch it with someone i still have my pants wet. It is really hard to explain what this movie really is about, a compilation of few small movies, and they dont have any connection but movie after movie it just gets darker and darker and i love it. And the craziest thing is that i will watch it in next years too. I have recommended this movie to most people around me who have same kind of humor like me, and they liked it. If you like dark humor on edge give it a try, you will not regret it.

The movie starts with a crazy idea of a famous dude's strange face. I gotta say I liked Hugh Jackman a lot before, but after this movie, I am a huge fan. Jokes are too deep to understand too soon. The movie is mainly about 2 kids trying to infect their friend's laptop with a virus. During their search they stumble upon clips from different websites. So watch the movie, take your time and then watch again. The irony of subtle but inevitable truth might hit you slowly but when it does, you'll go deep at laugh and the fact that the thing is a phenomena.So in my opinion, one must watch it at least once!

My attention was first drawn to this film while browsing Netflix. The reviews weren't fantastic but with the cast alone it was worth a watch.First off - to all the haters of the film, you just plainly don't get it. It's not a film to be taken seriously, it's just a silly, well played film with actors who normally should take serious parts hamming it up, and my god, they do it well.Take "The Catch". Hugh Jackman with a set of nuts on his neck, playing it totally straight. "Happy Birthday" - a kidnapped leprechaun threatening Johnny Knoxville with setting a camp fire in his mother's nether regions. "Middleschool Date" - Chloe Grace Moretz and Christopher Mintz-Plasse playing an absolute stunner.As I said, if you like comedies such as Scary Movie, Naked Gun, etc - watch Movie 43. It dragged more deep-down belly laughs out of my wife and I than are probably healthy.

Now this is a movie which splits opinions, mostly towards the worse end of the scale. But hey, there aren't many films out there which 10% of people rate as 10 and 21,9% rate as 1, so this might be worth to watch - and so did I, LMAO.It also seems that half of the ratings are given for the "misleading trailer", which I find very odd, since trailers are just ads, and ads are always misleading.But what about the movie?Well, the main storyline is pretty much nonexistent, and therefore there's not much actual movie here. The whole thing is just a collection of really vulgar sketches, and if you're against vulgar sketches, you won't like this.I don't have that filter on, and therefore I laughed like a mad man and enjoyed the craziness of this film a lot. I like surreality, surprises and that kind of stuff, regardless of if it happens on a David Lynch thriller, Monty Python, some very clever sci-fi movie, or this kind of stupid "teen comedy". And I like potty humor too - there's nothing you can't laugh about natural human functions.So, not a movie for those who only do it in a missionary position (nothing against it). For really open minded crazy folk, perhaps after a couple of beers, this can be awesome.

One of the worst movies I have ever seen. It suffers from mediocre acting, a horrible plot, and unoriginal jokes. At almost every turn they will use vulgarity instead of wit. It was really difficult for me to actually sit through the whole movie. I was very surprised that so many famous actors and actresses were in this movie that I tried to find out why this is. Apparently, most of them were tricked into being in this movie and then when they asked to leave they were bound by their contracts and director Peter Farrelly refused to let them leave. Most of the actors and actresses won't even comment on Movie 43. I definitely do not recommend this movie.

I think the problem about this movie is that it goes to far. It has some funny moments but all of the scenes end in such a disgusting or crazy way it leaves you with this kind of "what the hell was that about?" feeling. When I go to the movies I want to feel good about it instead of asking myself "what am I doing here?". They should have stopped every scene one minute earlier that would have saved some comic aspects. If you still want to watch the movie, I recommend watching only some of the scenes. Christopher Mintz-Plasse getting crazy about a girl having her period for the first time really is entertaining as well as Gerard Butler as Leprachaun. Still - I don't get why all of these actors were willing to participate in that movie. To them - this might have been fun. For the audience it's flat, disgusting and it really makes no sense. A kid could have written this script. Sometimes kids are funny so the movie sometimes is too, but most of the time it's not - at least not for me.
From the start it's totally off the chart with it's weird sense of humour. Quirky, silly & down right wrong in places but it makes you laugh loads if you're into this type of comedy.Give it a chance

reviews.review_title: Great comedy if you have an open mind!!
reviews.content: Okay... My wife and I delayed watching this for a longest, based solely on the super negative reviews on IMDb. What a mistake this was!! We just watched this and wow... Yeah there is some whacked out stuff here. But it's all familiar to me and anyone who's seen movies like Kentucky Fried Movie or any similar title. I mean you can't take it seriously... at all! We found all the skits pretty laughable, in a good way, sans maybe the last one that went during the credits. Kinda odd that one, but still had a few laughs. I mean no self respecting critic (nor movie hipster wannabes) are going to like this. It's not for them. It's for the non-PC crowd that don't think every movie produced needs to be Oscar caliber. Sometimes ya just want to have fun and enjoy laughing at inappropriate jokes.It's obvious that all the actors really liked letting loose and having some fun. I really hope we see similar projects from these actors where they can just let loose and have fun with their celebrity. Samuel Jackson is a great example (though no in this title) of a guy that acts just to act... for no other reason than to work and have fun. I'm pretty sure no one would think some of his lessor works were taken because he thought he'd get an award for it. Some times it's just for the fun of it... so ease up and relax. Not everything has to be uptight Academy award worthy material to be good.

reviews.review_title: Creative and funny, totally worth it
reviews.content: I don't understand how people can rate this movie 1. Some of the humor may be offensive to some people but let them deal with it.It's Family Guy sort of humor and if you don't like family guy then you'll hate this movie.Over all it's worth the time and i recommend it to people that aren't so pc and can see an awkward moment without making it their own personal tragedy.I heard there are 2 versions of the movie, i didn't see the one with Dennis Quade and Greg Keneir but with 3 teenagers passing the plot between crazy scenes. I can't believe such famous actors like Richard Gere played here but that just shows he can loosen up and do crazy stuff.

reviews.review_title: MOVIE 43 is an Experiment in Bad Taste
reviews.content: I know I am in the minority with this belief but: MOVIE 43 is not the worst movie of 2013. It's not even the worst movie I've ever seen. Honestly, it's not that bad. It's obscene and it's stupid, and it's definitely going to send a lot of people running in the opposite direction. But, and this might just be an indication that something is wrong with me, I actually found it amusing. It's not laugh-out-loud funny. I don't think I actually laughed once throughout the entire movie. Normally, for a comedy, this should be an official sign that it's an absolute failure. MOVIE 43 is different. Part of me wants to believe there's something more behind this anthology of some the most tasteless sketches you'll ever see. The easily explanation is that all twelve directors (not including Bob Odenkick because his segment was cut) suffered some immense form of communal brain damage and kidnapped some of modern film's most popular stars, forcing them to do this movie in exchange for their freedom. How else could you explain people such as Kate Winslet, Naomi Watts, or Richard Gere starring in a collection of absurd stories including: a blind date with a man featuring an unfortunate scrotal deformity, a romantic evening in which a woman wants her man engage in herumfecal fetish, Robin (as in the Boy Wonder) tries his hand at speed-dating when Batman stops in to ruin it with his raunchy behavior, a game of Truth or Dare getting progressively more offensive on a dinner date, and more.Part of me wants to believe that MOVIE 43 is someone's weird idea of a social experiment. The movie is populated with an impressive list of actors and actresses that, under normal circumstances, would never consider coming anywhere near a movie of this nature. Halle Berry, Greg Kinnear, Hugh Jackman, Liev Schreiber, Anna Fariswell, all right, this is par for the course with Faris. Maybe not this extreme though. I believe the goal of the filmmakers was to see just how disgusting or disturbing a movie they could create and release nationwide with a cast of all-stars to see just how many people would pay to watch it. They had to know how this movie would be received by critics and audiences, and they did it anyway. How did they convince all of these actors that it wouldn't ruin their careers? I think the only reason it didn't was because no one really saw this during its short run in theaters. Or maybe they knew the movie's nature would be the exact reason it would succeed? It's advertised as the raunchiest movie ever and critics are universally panning it with an epic score on Rotten Tomatoes of 4%. I'll be honest: that alone was enough to get me to watch it. I couldn't resist finding out what the directors put these actors through and how bad it could possibly be and, the odd part is that I didn't think it was all that bad. A lot of this movie falls flat. You expect it to. In that sense, it does not disappoint. But there were a few laughs to be found mixed in with all the insanity. You have to be willing to except the lowest of low-brow humor for it, but it's there. There were a couple of segments I actually enjoyed. Yes, I laughed at the "Superhero Speed Dating" with Jason Sudeikis and Justin Long as a warped version of Batman and Robin at a speed dating service. The "Truth or Dare" segment with Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant was pretty funny, and I actually loved James Gunn's "Beezel". There was so much wrong in "Beezel" and I couldn't believe what I was seeing at times. All I'm going to say is: Josh Duhamel (of the TRANSFORMERS movies) and Elizabeth Banks are real troopers to put up with everything they're put through. And then there's the best segment of the bunch from, and this is one of the few times you'll hear me praise his work, Brett Ratner. The bit with Johnny Knoxville and Sean William Scott as a couple of buddies battling a couple of leprechauns was awesome. Pure awesome.On the opposite end of the spectrum, "The Proposition" was a waste of time. Its jokes are telegraphed and you can see where the jokes are coming from a mile away, and "Victory's Glory" is a one-note joke stretched to its breaking point. The rest of the segments run the gamut from lame to mediocre. There's plenty of what you'd expect from a movie like MOVIE 43nudity, obscene language, loads of bodily functions, and slapstick. MOVIE 43 is no masterpiece, but I don't think it's anywhere near as bad as 99% of critics and viewers appear to believe. And to anyone declaring it the worst movie of 2013: go watch A GOOD DAY TO DIE HARD and see if you still feel that way afterwards.
My wife and I loved this movie....kind of raunchy but tickled our funny bones and movie had so much STAR power! Glad we watched!
Crude, coarse, and dreadful. Only explanation is this was made by Hollywood for Hollywood, in on their own inside jokes ?! But, does demonstrate their fascination with depravity.

This is one of the worst movies I have seen in awhile. Though a couple of the shorts were funny, the rest seemed like they were written by 12 to 15 year-old kids. The main humor in all of the shorts was grossly childish.It makes me ashamed to live in an age when such an awful movie grosses 4.8 million dollars opening weekend. It's no wonder why the rest of the world looks at Americans like they are ignorant.My rating is sh@t, as in if your soon to be fiancé asks you to poop on her then she is a whore, and deserves nothing more than for you to sh@t on her.

reviews.review_title: Why is this movie getting bad reviews?
reviews.content: I have seen plenty of comedies that try to be funny and are total flops, Movie 43 is definitely not one of them. If you are expecting a deep and intelligent even dark sense of humor then this isn't for you. What Movie 43 does best is take that old Saturday Night Live skit humor and the randomness of something like Family Guy and combine it together. This movie is nothing but completely over-the-top skits that are combined into one movie that has a really small(if you even consider it one) plot. But that's OK because that is what makes it great. I love comedy and don't get me wrong sometimes I need real "intelligent" humor... but sometimes I just want to laugh my a** off over dumb randomness and Movie 43 did it. One thing to note is all of the joke are complete hits, no misses here. Every line and moment was funny. This movie isn't some slapped together garbage like the recent Scary Movie films, these skits were thought out and spot on. Watch it before you judge it. The first 15 mins will have you saying WTF? And then 30 mins in you will be saying HAHAHA I get it, even though there is nothing to get. Watch it.

reviews.review_title: This movie sucks because the material is bad, not because it's raunchy!
reviews.content: This movie almost has the perfect combination. It's gross, it's offensive, good actors, but it fails in the most important area...the material. And I really want a movie like this to succeed, so it's unfortunate. It's definitely not the worst movie ever made, which is what attracted me to this movie. It's one of the worst when you take into account the dozens of A list actors in this film. Since this movie probably has the most A list actors out of any movie ever, one wonders if perhaps the jokes were funny on paper, yet failed in execution? The answer is simply no. The jokes seem like they were written by people who aren't/or have never been involved with comedy in their life. Some of the segments play out like they're bits from a stand up comedy routine transitioned into film, although the material seems like something someone would have written for their first ever stand up act at an open mic. Most of the bits play out like they were taken from a 3 men go into a bar style joke, which I'm pretty sure they were. Most of the material is very unoriginal, but worst of all, originally they weren't even funny jokes. One of many unoriginal/unfunny examples; the segment which they (the writers/directors, who knows?) must of thought was absolutely hilarious, since it was the segway in the movie trailer 1 version (although it's not like they had much funny material to choose from). An all black basketball team is getting ready to play an all white team and the coaches game plan is you're black, they're white, it's that simple. Seriously? Who the hell thought revamping that joke for the umpteenth time would be funny? Why would you tell a 5 second slapstick joke for a 5-10 minute segment? Why would that be the bait to get everyone to go see this movie? The answer again is simple, this movie must have been put together or organized by people who are not known for their comedic sense. One bit that probably played out well (especially in first person) in a stand up act was the home school kid being taught by his parents about the social dynamics of a public school. This doesn't work on film, but is a great stand up bit if delivered well. The Leprechaun segment is a total fail and plays out like one of those painful long 3 guys go into a bar type of joke that unfunny people tell, which takes several minutes and you wait for the punchline so you can laugh to humor them, but at a couple moments throughout the joke something silly is said which you mistake for the punchline and the pain continues. Anyways, you catch a Leprechaun to get it's gold, then you catch a fairy. Well, whats the fairy for you ask? The fairy gives blow jobs for gold coins. Really, really stupid!Pooping on girlfriend segment = really lame, plays out like a 1 dimensional joke (will you poop on me, errr), but in hindsight it's about the build up at which point the dude gets hit by a car and essentially becomes a crap piñata (that one part made me chuckle but lame segment). Period segment - so painfully lame. This is the dumbest as in worst segment among the many.Supermarket segment - this has been done soooo many times. In fact, the whole, you go after and get that girl, while a crowd of people applause has now been performed more in spoof fashion then it ever had in the dramatic corny sense. The ibabe segment didn't entirely fail on video, but another stand-up bit. I did like a couple of the commercials in between segments. The tampon commercial with the shark and the kids in the machines made me chuckle. From what I read apparently the segment where Hugh Jackman is on a blind date with Kate Winslet and what appears to be the perfect date until Jackman takes of his scarf and has a pair of balls hanging from his chin and no one seems to notice but Winslet, was the first segment shot in the movie (it's the best segment), which loured other big name actors. Also this movie probably became attractive because it took almost a decade to get a studio to back it and it was probably seen as too offensive to be approved type of thing. I theorize that actors get really tired of these studios dictating these cliché' unoriginal, cookie cutter style films and thought that a movie like this challenged those perimeters. That's why it's extremely unfortunate when a movie like this fails because it's a further detractor for studio's to pick up any movie that steps out of the tight Hollywood box, while encouraging the same lame/unoriginal crap.

I don't understand why so many people didn't like this movie. I know it's trashy but think about it, is Borat really all that great? Sure it's funny but it's also trashy. Borat offended people so much more than Movie 43. When did people start caring about what is considered offensive in moves? I was never offended or disgusted once while watching this movie. I was too busy laughing because this is great. There were so many great skits. You could get a laugh from all of them, even if they weren't that funny. The only downside to this movie is the story that revolves around each of the skits: Two boys searching for Movie 43 while another one is putting viruses on the younger boy's computer. Maybe if the boys had had more experience in movies I would've found it more entertaining. I found it hard to find this as funny as the skits. Luckily it was not in there too much. The other downside for me was the ending with the three boys. I don't want to spoil it for anybody but it was very unrealistic, even for a comedy.

This is a much better attempt at gross porn than the classic, Pink Flamingos (1972), mostly because of the excellent cast and the fact that they juxtapose the comedy by doing the exact opposite of what you expect by using bodily functions and sex as the main theme.7.3 (C+ MyGrade) = 7 IMDB

reviews.review_title: So Low-Brow That Its Social Commentary Goes Over Heads
reviews.content: The smartest dumb movie I've ever seen. It actually has a lot to say about what we choose to make important within our culture. Marriage, parenthood, romance, dating... all get doused in subtly intelligent scat and semen. Hating it says something about how preciously you cling to the games we play as a species.

reviews.review_title: Come on Folks, This is Funny
reviews.content: Okay this humor may offend a large portion of the population, but that is precisely what makes it funny. This is not a pointless, incredibly dumb movie like "The Stupids" that had one 2 minute piece of brilliance in the entire movie. There are some hilariously brilliant lines, some uproarious moments of completely sick humor and a ton of laughs. If you or others consider you to be sober, prudish folk by all means do not waste your time on this movie - you will hate it. If you enjoy Saturday Night Live, SCTV, 30 Rock and similar comedy, you will find this to be one of the most well produced and acted examples of this hilarious genre of comedy. Also, this is not the understated genre of absurdist comedy that Bill Murray and the Wilson boys routinely appear in. This is ridiculous, crude, over the top, uncomfortable, bathroom, I can't believe he said or did that type of comedy. However, the comedic acting is superb, and the film is directed and produced at a high level of competence. There is no message here, just humor.

Make no mistake this's an awful movie. Most of the skits don't get any laughs. The ideas behind them are interesting but how they're done is pretty bad. The only one I found enjoyable is the leprechaun skit with Seann William Scott. The fairy at the end is one of the few saving graces. That and the other skit where Liev Schrieber and Naomi Watts torment their son as part of home schooling him.Even so this's a terrible movie that will leaving you hurting and disgusted. With that being said most definitely skip this and watch an Adam Sandler movie instead.

reviews.review_title: Not for everyone. But definitely for me.
reviews.content: After reading so many negative reviews, I almost didn't watch this movie. But I am glad I did.It takes a particular sense of humour to enjoy it. It is random. Bizarre. Unique. Wacky. Offbeat. Maybe a little self-indulgent.I can understand why it's not everyone's cup of tea. There is no real plot as such, apart from a deliberately B-Grade side story. But that is the setting for multiple unrelated short stories, each one equally random and hilariously ridiculous.It is like someone with really good connections took acid, pulled an all-nighter, vomited up a bunch of weird vignettes, then the next morning phoned around a heap of high-profile actors and called in a favour.In a nutshell, if you find humour in randomness, this one is for you.

reviews.review_title: The fact that this exists saddens me
reviews.content: This is legitimately the worst film I have ever watched. It is painfully unfunny to the point where I'd rather watch stand up by Amy Schumer. The movie thinks that its funny to put something vile on the screen and then drag it out to a 5-10 minute long short. I stopped watching half way through and frankly should have stoped at zero minutes in.

reviews.review_title: Return Of The Kentucky Fried Movie
reviews.content: My wife and I finally got a chance to watch this film... I must admit, due to the scathing reviews, I would find this film incomprehensibly stupid. In some ways it was, in other ways it was down right hilarious! Much like the Kentucky Fried Movie (Or The Groove Tube), this film is nothing more than a bunch of skits. Though this time held together by a inane sub-plot that should have not been there.Much like The Kentucky Fried Movie the skits are hit and miss affair. Though for us there was more hit than miss with some truly hilarious and gross out laughs on offer by a literal bevy of A-Class actors.If you loved the Kentucky Fried Movie back in the 70's or early 80's on VHS, then you will probably enjoy this old style gross out humour. Though it seems it is lost on most everyone else nowadays... Which is a shame!

I laughed, not only at the movie but also at some of the reviewers here. As one reviewer wrote: "How funny is it when Jackman accidentally gets pubic hair in his soup, and puts his neck-scrotum on a baby's forehead?" If you don't get it, this movie is not for you. Obviously, because the rating is only 4.4, a lot of people don't appreciate tasteless humor. But don't be fooled, this is a really good tasteless movie. It reminds of a celebrity roast, where they dare to push the limits of decency for a laugh. Considering the amount of big names in this movie, compared to the limited budget, they did it more for fun than for the money. Thanks!

reviews.review_title: There is no film worse than this!
reviews.content: I found this so unfunny and such a waste of brilliant talent that it sticks in my head after years of trying to watch till the end!!

reviews.review_title: Is this low rating a conspiracy?
reviews.content: This movie was awesome. I do not understand why it's rated so poorly. I watched it thinking it was going to be one of those films that it's so bad it's good sort of thing (it was rated one of the worst movies of all time, seriously?), but there's nothing bad about it. It was legit laugh out loud funny. Perhaps there were some bits that were a tad epically crude, but all I kept thinking was - dang somebody actually sat down and thought this out and turned it in to a screenplay. The level of messed up-ness was almost impressive. The version I watched was with the three young boys scouring the internet for movie 43. I've just realised there are alternate versions. I will definitely check them out. You got to watch this movie!

reviews.review_title: So inappropriate, so crude, so hilarious.
reviews.content: This movie is so damn silly and trashy and I loved almost every minute of it. Irreverent and on the brink of brilliant actually. If you take yourself too seriously, this won't appeal to you. As for me and my crew, we were howling.This movie is just so juvenile and vulgar and so damn silly and trashy and I loved almost every minute of it. Irreverent and on the brink of brilliant actually. If you take yourself too seriously, this won't appeal to you. As for me and my crew, we were howling with laughter.This movie is so damn silly and trashy and I loved almost every minute of it. Irreverent and on the brink of brilliant actually. If you take yourself too seriously, this won't appeal to you. As for me and my crew, we were howling.

I was first attracted to this movie with the amount of well known actors attached to the film. I have to say and everyone will have a field day, this movie was HILARIOUS. The way it was perceived is perfect to what the movie is about, it served its purpose, which is dark humour and comedy, and would make you laugh. I think everyone was wanting it to amount to what is deemed comedy on a broader overall social standard and what films conform to of the same genre. I was laughing at each mini clip with all the different scenarios, You need to find the fun and lightness in it, not think about it to much, and just laugh. There is no need for this to be so serious, there are many others films that can do that. I can almost bet at least everyone that had watched this laughed at one of the mini clips at some time or another. Whether you laughed cause you liked it, hated it, admired it, it really did serve its purpose. This movie just reminded me of all the other comedies like scary movie, the sitter, juno, superbad, pineapple express etc
The low reviews must be from people who don't grasp irony..... Sad.People should give this a chance - it's a wonderful collection of well crafted stories.The only miss is the intro.
I hope the only reason all these celebrities are gathered in this lousy excuse of a movie is to raise money for a charity!!!? Other than that it's a waste of time and talent of big names

reviews.review_title: If I could give 0 stars, I would.
reviews.content: This is the worst movie I have ever had the misfortune of having seen. This is the bottom of the barrel to which I compare any other "bad" movie. Nothing is as bad.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious movie, ignore the trash that talk trash.
reviews.content: This movie is funny to those with an open mind and a sense of humor. If you're uptight or consider good movies to involve classy rich folks sipping tea, then you probably don't enjoy watching anything but Sophie's Choice. The actors/actresses in this movie should be applauded for their wild antics and said open-mindedness. Trust me, I love original Star Wars, Indiana Jones, Beverly Hills Cop, and I love stand up like George Carlin. This movie is funny, even if it has no point and is 'gross' to some. That's what makes it funny. If you want to down-talk the movie, go ahead, that's your right; but if you want to down-talk the people who like it, then you're a judgmental *$#@ that should concentrate on judging your own screwed up lives. That's not an opinion, that's fact.In short, it's a funny movie to me, your average movie-loving Joe. I rate it up there with Grandma's Boy.

This movie is bad because it's supposed to be bad. It's from the mind of desperate screenwriter trying to sell an awful screenplay and in his mind these big stars would star in it. I've watched it several times and there are some unfunny moments but I enjoy watching it. If you see the movie for what it's supposed to be and not what you expect from a great comedy, you'll enjoy a little more than you'd think.

reviews.review_title: Yes it's raunchy, but that's not why it's funny
reviews.content: The first sketch is great because of the restrained and polite reaction of Kate Winslet to Hugh Jackman's, uh... , deformity. Her facial expressions are wonderful, especially in contrast to the lack of reaction by anyone around Jackman's character.The second sketch is great because of the boy's dejected reaction to his weird parents, and the neighbor's face that constantly says, "You people are crazy."In the next sketch Chris Pratt's character is similarly dumbfounded at his girlfriend's gross request, and his attempts to please her are hilarious, because his expressions show both that he loves her and thinks her desire is crazy. The the third guy at the barbecue is similarly funny in his sardonic reaction to hearing the enthusiastic defense of the girlfriend's request.In the sketch "Middleschool Date" the panic and naivete of the boy at his girlfriend's predicament are poignantly funny, while his brother's attempts to find solutions to her predicament are just absurdly funny.If you are are a 15 year old boy then you will appreciate the raunchiness. If you are more mature then you will appreciate the reactions of the characters to the raunchiness, and might appreciate the vulgarity if you have been a hermit, or just haven't seen anything like Airplane or Blazing Saddles.

reviews.review_title: Brilliant movie with a tonn of great actors
reviews.content: The cast of this movie is quite outstanding by itself. Although all of those great actors appear for only a few minutes because of the format of the movie, every one of them is quite hilarious - the character and the play, I mean. Movie 47 is made of several short episodes, connected with a general story of some teenagers viewing short scenes on the internet. This format gave freedom to the script writers and made the humour flow freely (like the Family Guy) without the obligation of having-to-stick-to-the-story (like the South Park). Both of the shows I compared to are by all means great, and so is the Movie 43. Racism, sexism, course language, all kinds of humour (they even made fun of the coprofiles) - all of that and much more in here. My favourite part was the one with the domestic education (mostly because of Naomi Watts <3), but they are all great. Great script, great play, an hour and a half of pure laughter. I personally don't like comedies much, because they mostly tend to exploit one character in a strange situation (like the ones with rob Schneider, pardon my language) or just repeat some fart jokes, or be made for black audiences mostly, but this one is very different. I mean, check out the cast. Those number of celebritites just cant gather up in something bad. Movie 43 is a must see. Worth every cent you pay for the ticket. If they say you live longer for every minute your laugh, this movie is gonna widen your life quite a lot.

The other day, I went to Best Buy and bought this. Why? Because I wanted to see it. Going into this movie, I had some expectations. Everyone I know told me it was bad, and it was not worth watching. Me, personally, I thought this film was hilarious. I mean it did have silly stupid parts, but if you want a good comedy with laughs, this is a great movie to watch. I think this film was very underrated. With the score it got (4.4/10) I don't think it deserved that low. People just need to give a movie a chance, not just crush every movie. I recommend this to people who like comedies. Great cast, great stories, and a lot of laughs. So there you have it, that's my review for the film Movie 43. 7.5/10

reviews.review_title: Not a masterpiece, not so bad...
reviews.content: This is my very first review and English is not my first language, so forgive me for my limited vocabulary and for my mistakes. I knew nothing about this movie before yesterday, somebody just told me it was stupid but funny and so I gave it a try. I was pleased to see two of my favorite actors (Dennis Quaid and Greg Kinnear) and I thought to myself: "well, this is a good start". And when Hugh Jackman and Kate Winslet appeared I said "wow, this is some great cast they got!". Then, unexpected, the shock. And then I started laughing, and I kept laughing until the end of the first segment. Of course the rest of the movie could not shock me anymore but I did some more good laughing, which was something I just needed.This movie is not a masterpiece. It was obviously made intentionally to cross the line of decency and good taste, so I understand all the 1/10 of all those people who do not tolerate sick humor, obscenities, nudity, racist jokes and much more than this. Personally, I enjoyed it. Sometimes I just want to laugh and think of nothing. OK, do not show this to your children. If you have a bigot friend, don't call him to watch this movie with you. Do not expect a complex plot. If you enjoy only psychological or intellectual movies then don't waste your time. Just think of this movie as the result of a bet of a group of directors about who'd make the most absurd and obscene short movie. I give Movie 43 a 7/10 because it made me laugh and also because I will never see Hugh Jackman the same again!

reviews.review_title: I actually enjoyed it, much better than that crappy Scary Movie 5..
reviews.content: I wasn't sure in the beginning: to watch it or not to watch it? After the extremely negative reviews I almost deleted it from my computer, but then a sad and boring Sunday afternoon came and I had to see it, just to try it. Boy, was it a big surprise. I loved almost every story they tell, especially the one with Naomi Watts and the brother of Wolverine, where they were representing the.. let's say "parents no one would ever want". That segment was simply disgusting, hilarious, smart, stupid.. all in one. And the weird thing with the cartoon cat in the end, it just killed me, I swear! What I'm trying to say it's that this movie isn't like crappy Scary Movie 5, Epic Movie, Disaster Movie.. No, it's more like Scary Movie 2, or 3, when the saga was ACTUALLY funny. It may be hard to watch sometimes, due to some pretty disgusting content, but it's more a win than a fail. People, don't even mind about the negative reviews and give it a try! It's not a masterpiece but one thing it does it perfectly: it helps you disconnect from the world and actually laugh for 90 minutes!6.5\7

reviews.review_title: I don't know what people are complaining about....
reviews.content: I realize that, for the most part, people don't like to post anything positive on the internet. It's mostly just a bitch fest. I've heard nothing but negative comments about this movie but, I gotta say, I thought it was hilarious. My wife and I had a great time at this movie. The Naomi Watts skit was uncomfortably terrific. Hugh Jackman's skit was funny as hell. Actually, Kate Winslet playing her role so well really sold this skit. It was odd and a little strange. But as far as being funny, which was the whole point of the movie, it was. The I-Babe commercials were a cute interjection. Although I do have to say I think I've seen the shark eating the woman on her period gag before. Is the movie genius by any means? No. But it's fun, light hearted and good for a laugh.

reviews.review_title: Often Rude, Crude, and Horrific, and Sometimes Funny
reviews.content: I have to admit I enjoyed some of the skits in this collection of comedic shorts. There are literally dozens of recognizable faces here, and one wonders why some would have signed up for it. The film is filled with scatological humor, vile and profane language, some graphic nudity, and politically incorrect subject matter. That being said, some of the skits are quite humorous and some don't come close to hitting their mark.Do not go near this movie if you are prudish to any extent, but if off the wall comedy, no matter how tasteless, is your cup of tea, you should enjoy it. 9 stars for the good parts, 2 stars for the bad, so I give it a 5.

reviews.review_title: I can actually tolerate "Movie 43", I just choose not to
reviews.content: (**) out of (****)- ROTTEN"It's the Citizen Kane of awful!" "It's been shelved for over three years!" "No actors are promoting it" "It has a zero on Rotten Tomatoes!" Who on EARTH would pay to see such a thing? Me of course! Call me sophomoric, but whenever I want to see a film, whether good/bad consensus, I see it anyway out of my own curiosity. To my surprise, maybe I just had too much of an open mind or I had some LSD, but this movie is not the earth-shatteringly, god-awful atrocity probably 95% of the Internet is leading you to believe.What they're not telling you is how entertainingly awful these skits are, but the sour feeling you get after you watch it does not leave you. See with Movie 43: It's pretty damn amusing to see actors such as Naomi Watts and Kate Winslet to be engaged in some pretty degrading roles, and see them just take a big sh-t on their career. The problem? This is where the fun ends.For one, I hate the rating of this film. It's a solid R (tons of breasts, vaginas, etc.), lots of foul language, and I wouldn't even feel comfortable having my 15 year old cousin watching this, but the humor is so childish, without all its adulterated gigs, it would be a G rating. It's almost like the directors are left with this weird, unclear demographic. What's also pretty lazy about this film is how cheap the entire thing looks. You can definitely see all the money went to these actors and not much else. There's not much to be said about Movie 43, than what I already have said. The skits, while entertaining to see your favorite stars engage in some whimsical gags, just leave you with a bitter feeling afterwards, like you just gave a homeless guy on the street money for crack. And the entire thing feels cheap and nothing more than a cash grab. Nonetheless, it induced a few laughs out of me here and there and while it's a train wreck, it's one I couldn't stop looking at. So Movie 43 is tolerable, however, there's no way in hell I'd see it again.

The story line was awful but I think that it was least important in this movie. I saw the other reviews and I can't understand their hatred. The actors did their parts pretty well and the humor was disguising and hilarious. I rarely enjoy a comedy nowadays but I did enjoy this one. Of course, many people might not tolerate this type of humor, but I don't consider it dumb(not that I'd mind laughing at dumb jokes). I liked the screenplay. I least liked the leading characters. Their purpose, I think was to play the actually funny things. These kinds of films's purpose is certainly not to win an Oscar, but I like the daringness when making movies. The jokes are bold and often disguising, but I enjoyed them.

Honestly? I've seen worse. It is what it is - a bunch of wonderfully talented actors doing what they do best...worst. I admit to laughing out loud quite a few times, but rolling my eyes a few times more.I don't really know what else to say here. I'm sure your expectations couldn't be any lower, so having me slag off the film doesn't do much either way. Put it this way - if you do watch it, you may get a couple of good laughs out of it. But only a couple.

reviews.review_title: It's just a slapstick pointless movie...
reviews.content:
Why would you take a pointless slapstick style movie serious???? It is what it is... pointless string of short stories that are pretty dumb but funny as can be.
I liked this movie and I'm disappointed in myself because I did not watch it earlier. Netflix is running it now (04/2019) and I just watched it.
If you want to not think, kill time & laugh a bit.... please give it a try. I really think you'll enjoy the silliness.
People who takes offense to this type of comedy are SJWs. This is balls funny. I haven't laugh this hard since dumb and dumber.

reviews.review_title: Funniest I have seen in a long time
reviews.content: And i did not even know it was supposed to be bad. Completely underrated movie and the a-listers should be proud. Laughed my but off most of the movie.

I think the reason for so many bad reviews it's because people got attracted to it by the many popular actors involved. The movie has a very direct, absurd and almost "teen" kind of humor, but it also goes much further, you get to be always wondering what else will it mess with. Every short is better than the previous and I enjoyed it so much that I saw it twice the same week (second time with friends). For me is an icon in its gender, it has everything: hilarious humor, great actors and amazing performances. I never saw before so many good actors doing this kind of humor (only at some chapters of Saturday Night Live). If you like straight absurd humor like South park, Baron Koen, TED even the old Benny Hill, this is for you and YOU WILL LOVE IT!

Considered by some people to be one of the worst films ever made, though I don't think so. It's a sketch comedy flick with plenty of jokes that range from disgusting to just plain weird, and while I can't say I found a lot of it amusing, it certainly held my attention as each bizarre scenario unfolded before my very eyes and proceeded to unravel in a variety of unpredictably gross ways. Generally involving sex, pee or poo... usually, all of the above.It's not going to win any awards for comedy (aside from a Razzie for 'Worst Picture') but I can say it got a few chuckles out of me... which is more than plenty of other bad comedies have managed......Although this is not Movie 43 is worth watching, far from it. If you find yourself cringing a lot more in a comedy instead of laughing, it's never a good sign.I'm just of the opinion that this is nowhere near 'The Worst Of The Worst'. Don't give it the notoriety such a tepid flick doesn't deserve. 4/10

Movie 43 is horrible. Other then the few giggles I let out because what I was looking at was so stupid the movie was a complete waste. There was no taste involved. It felt like they made this movie for the people in the movie Idiocracy. Are we(the public) really getting that stupid that movie's like this can even enter the mines of some of the best Actors, directors, etc. Come on we are a long way from that. And how they got so many big names in this movie says a lot about the kinds of people these so called big names really are. It is a movie made for young people. OK.. Not to young. There are some things in the movie that no one should ever see. Let alone but it on the big screen.

reviews.review_title: Bizar. Sometimes really funny sometimes not at all
reviews.content: It's a bunch of bizar sketches somehow whereas the general script is just a way to weirdly connect them. With an very good and famous crew. Some of the sketches are funny. The Halle Berry blind date sketch made my laugh out loud. Others are really stupid. If you looking for just a collection of famous actors doing weird sketches then this movie is good, if you looking for good script and intelligent humor then you better skip this.

reviews.review_title: Maybe I have the humor of a teenager.
reviews.content: I've been disappointed in comedies the last decade. With the exception of 'long shot', i can't really think of the last funny movie I saw. 'Crazy rich Asians' definitely wasn't funny. I'm disappointed the actors of this film didn't like it because it's hilarious! I agree with a lot of people saying it's like watching an SNL episode but back when SNL was funny. Although I'm not sure what people Are talking about a movie exec pitching. The version I watched was a kid trying to get back at his sibling. Either way, recommended if you want a real laugh.

Despite the numerous negative comments, it deserves a much higher rating than most people seem to have given it. I found this movie is unique, and has twists and turns that are unexpected and unpredictable, and it was very enjoyable. There were many famous, recognizable faces in the film. An oddball mind would be required to think up the scenarios for this film. I had a great time watching it. Highly recommended.

This movie is not meant to watch it sober, as it's tasteless funny. You would get only a few laughs here and there.Get a bunch of friends, get intoxicated or even better, get stoned and this movie is like freight train passing over you. You will laugh, you will get confused, you will have so many "wtf" moments.What you have is 12 different short movies, which use the same basic approach, start easy, you don't know what to expect and then baam,some shocking humor(and it's shocking), that wouldn't make you laugh in any day, but will obliterate you if you follow my advice above.Kudos for who ever made this movie, made my day a lot better.

It was on TV and the description said "short films" which I like so I recorded it for later. Thank God for that because I was able to skip through it trying to give it a chance and find a nugget.The only part I laughed at was Stephen Merchant in the segment "Truth or Dare" when he's trying to act like a stripper. For the rest of it I caught myself with a constant pained expression on my face, thinking "WTF??" The topics were awful and the reviewers that were positive...
well it takes all kinds to make this world.
How this film managed to get so many big names to work on it I'll never know.

reviews.review_title: Makes me think there was a campaign against this film.
reviews.content: I didn't bother to watch this film when it was released because it was universally panned by all and sundry. However, I saw it on Netflix today and decided to actually watch it for myself and see if it really was that bad.IT ISN'T!Of course it isn't a cinematic masterpiece, but if you don't go into it expecting the greatest comedy on Earth, then you won't be disappointed. But if you have an open mind, you should enjoy yourself, as I did.In fact, when you take the film in context (which I won't give away), it actually makes sense, and is funnier for it. Especially when you consider that you have 'Boomer' actors mixing it with modern issues, concepts and ideas.Most of the actors in this film have kids, and it shows. In fact, I imagine they were all thinking of their kids when they were acting our their scenes. And it makes for a very entertaining film.This film is solid, but it won't appeal to some people because it IS 'gutter humour', but delivered in a different way; and dare I say, in a more 21st century way, and dealing with 21st century issues and ideas that younger people can relate to. And when I say "younger", I mean anyone who isn't a 'Boomer'.This is also an incredibly socially conscious film when you consider the material it deals with, and how it is dealt with.It's a controversial film, for good reason, but it has also definitely opened the doors to usher in a new generation of socio-political humour for the younger generations....and like I said, when I say "younger", I mean anyone who isn't' a Boomer.

*Review contains one minor spoiler (it's essentially part of a punchline in one line of one scene)*Maybe it's because I went into it expecting the worst but hoping for the best, but I liked this movie a lot. I knew that here on IMDb it was panned. Critically it was panned. Everywhere it was panned. I wanted to like it anyway. I like liking things. People complained that the film was disjointed. I thought there was a large-scale cohesiveness to it - every different short film was a parody, for one, it took something simple and made it outrageous. Of course, that's the nature of jokes and it's hardly groundbreaking to say that this comedy film was brought together by the fact that all of it had jokes.But the thing that brought this film together was the satirical element. It wasn't on the surface. If you watched this movie expecting a nice story you were always going to be disappointed. But the satire is heart-wrenchingly funny. The scene where Kieran Culkin compares Emma Stone to the "slutty one from the Golden Girls" was beautiful. I had to pause the film to laugh.I feel like if you read into this film you'll enjoy it on all levels. If you see it as an interplay of themes and ideas and concepts, you'll really like it. Conversely, if you have the sense of humour of an eighth grader, you'll also enjoy it. However, if you're just the average movie go-er, and you don't watch movies to be critiqued but rather as a form of casual entertainment, this movie probably isn't for you.Above all though, this movie was funny because I wanted it to be funny. I went into it with the mindset "people say this movie is bad, it will probably be bad in terms of story and character development and all the traditional things that movies are judged by, but I'm willing to be impressed" and on that front, movie 43 did not fail.

I really can't understand the negative reviews of this movie. I watched a different version of the synopsis that was written. But basically it's the same movie.Yes it's a bit sick and shocking and at times I couldn't believe what I was seeing. But man was it funny. I was laughing out loud through most of the movie. I was also saying no, OMG no, this can't be happening. It was hilarious. A damn sight funnier than Jackass that's for sure.Jam packed with stars, original and extremely funny. What more do you want from a comedy?Give it a try. It's a movie, what have you got to lose?

Before Watching I didn't have a good feeling about it , since all the reviews and ratings ruined it....
More like a TV show rather than a movie
But therefore not as bad as I considered...although some segments were just stupid boring comedy but some had a epic hilarious shot...
Your gonna amaze by some of the Stars featuring within the movie... try not to check the movie cast before watching;)

reviews.review_title: PG 99 - No one should see this
reviews.content: This is a vile movie appealing to the sensibilities of puerile adolescents, or failed to launch adults. It isn't funny, it's a continuous filthy, not dirty, but filthy joke on the audience. I can't believe this stellar cast of serious actors consented to participate in this piece of junk. I rented it from Netflix because of the cast, and once I ran it I fast forwarded a little to get past the neck balls, thinking maybe it was a joke to be appreciated later on. No way. It was relentlessly and unconscionably obscene from beginning to end, though I didn't watch until the end. I wouldn't let my dog watch this filth. I didn't even wait for Sean Hayes's appearance (shame on him) - what sort of excrement would the writers have him wallow in? This is no "Airplane", or other very funny spoof. It goes way too far, and that's why I never heard of it. It is the worst movie I've ever half seen.

reviews.review_title: Easy to hate, but has it's moments. Like two, maybe.
reviews.content: I'm going to admit that today is a lazy day and after watching the film up for discussion I have decided to make this one short and sweet. O.K.? O.K. Fine.For a while now, I have been hearing about this Razzie Bait of a film called Movie 43 (2013) and finally felt it my duty to see why people hated it so much.
