With a cast of international A through D listers, who have been known to churn out both Oscar winning performances as well as garbage (I'm looking at you Halle Berry), to big name directors such as Peter Farrelly, James Gunn, and Brett Ratner, what's not to love. Quite a bit it seems. It tries to play like Kentucky Fried Movie, Amazon Women on the Moon or in today's parlance, an hour and thirty-four minutes of surfing Funny Or Die minus the comedic timing. Although, I'm not completely against this film. The ideas are there and funny moments eek out from time to time. I guess the real question is would you want to watch this if they took away the star power? Eh. Maybe.

reviews.review_title: Vulgar comedy with a mega cast.
reviews.content: Extremely vulgar comedy with a mega cast of all the stars. Watch if you're prepared and looking for some raunchy comedy that pushes the boundaries... It has a few funny elements but overall falls way short with its weak presentation. Can't imagine recommending this to anyone.
We need movies like this , is different , is funny !

Let's put this into perspective: if you're expecting intellectual comedy, you're watching the wrong movie. But... if you grew up watching Kentucky Fried Movie in the 1970s, followed by Amazon Women on the Moon in the late 1980s, you'll appreciate this. Movie 43 is uncensored, uncut, sketch comedy. This is Saturday Night Live without the editing. Movie 43 contains an all-start cast, ranging from Richard Gere and Halle Berry to Johnny Knoxville and Sean William Scott. Once again, if you're expecting tame, watered down comedy, avoid this movie. But, if you're looking to push the envelope and enjoy some adult humor, give this and the other titles a go. You might be offended, but some comedy should.
Hilarious nonsense played by A-listers.Bad reviews miss the point of this absurdist collection of stoned-story boards.

reviews.review_title: Odd mongrel that's hard to pin down
reviews.content: I think the 1 star out of 10 reviews of this are too harsh and probably reflect people taking offense than an actual critique of the movie. I can understand people getting offended by some of the humour - lots of taboos breached, bad language, gratuitous violence, crudity. But that alone a bad movie does not make and could be equally applied to lots of other highly rated movies. These are not public service announcements - do your homework before you watch and try and remember to SWITCH OFF if you find yourself being offended! The whole thing was pretty nicely polished *except* the premise tying the sketches together. They would seriously have been better off just making a film of back-to-back sketches without that nonsense. Oh and by the way - the description in IMDb is way off - there's nothing at all about a producer pitching stories. Instead we have a couple of teenagers trying to make a wacky video and get loads of hits on the internet. A younger brother tricks them into thinking they have a hit. As revenge, they convince him there is this awesome Movie 43 they need his help locating, and in the meantime one of them gets busy filling his laptop with porn/viruses. The sketches appear to be what they stumble across while surfing the web trying to locate the fabled movie 43. A more terrible set up for a collection of comedy sketches I cannot imagine, and this really let the movie down more than anything else. Some of the sketches are pretty decent/funny and certainly worthy of more than 5 stars, let alone 1. Alas, some were a little off and unwitty. But like I say it's all really well polished and you'll be amazed by some of the cameos here - check the credits after you watch it. You'll laugh when you work out who Gerard Butler played. I suspect the makers of this film were gunning for "Amazon Women on the Moon" or "The Onion Movie" but I'm afraid this falls short because of the godawful premise, and the low quality of a couple of the sketches. The array of stars they assembled deserved better writing than this. Also, IMDb - thanks for misleading me with your bizarrely erroneous description - sort it out please!Update: after a bit of googling, I *think* the US version may match the description on IMDb. For some reason the version I saw has the thread running through it I desecribed above instead. That's a guess though - it wasn't 100% clear.

reviews.review_title: Dark, dark scatological and sex humor, not for everyone
reviews.content: I heard this movie was terrible. I love bad movies so I was willing to give it a shot.It's not for everyone. The humor is extremely dark and the movie revels in scatological and sex humor.Let's see:There is the sketch where a woman is on a blind date with a guy who was testicles hanging from his chin. There is a sketch where 2 parents discuss how they have home schooled their son. They are so dedicated to him having an authentic high school experience, they bully him and seduce him so he can understand what high school is really like. There is a sketch where a wife asks her husband to "poop" on her. Yeah, it plays out exactly as you might imagine in your sickest moment.I laughed though. Often. Sometimes it was awkward laughter, sometimes it was laughing in disbelief and yeah, sometimes it was very funny and I could not help it.Lord help me, I laughed hysterically when Hugh Jackman's chin testicles dropped a pubic hair in his soup. Kate Winslet's reaction was priceless.It's funny if you are OK with this type of humor. If not, yeah stay away. It's 90 minutes of this type of humor.

reviews.review_title: This movie shows just how corrupt and sickening Hollywood truly is.
reviews.content: Completely disgusting. That anyone could think this is funny is sad. It is nothing but sexual deviancy, violence and gore. The only people who could like this have day-glow hair color, nose piercings, and go skreeee.If it was made today, half the characters would be black and/or part of the gay alphabet mafia.It's very telling what big name actors, directors, and others were a part of this movie.

This movie is not that bad, as everyone seems to believe. It is actually quite funny and I did have a good laugh throughout most of it. Yes, I agree that it is partly just ridiculous and you are sitting there wondering and trying to grasp the stupidity of it all. But you do this with a laugh and that's the point! The acting of all of the "stars" is very good (like you would expect them to be) and they carry the movie along and it definitely does not get boring. You constantly wonder what might come next.Tastes differ, and so does humor. This is certainly a humor more of the black kind. It is very over the top (or under the belt) and reminded me partly of Monty Python or The Naked Gun. Its raw and sometimes shocking jokes are provocative and original at the same time. I watched this movie together with my girlfriend, and her review of this would be: "This is so stupid!" She did not laugh as much as I did. Again, tastes differ! If you can't laugh about farts, poop or chin-balls...don't watch it. Otherwise, take a look and don't take it serious. Just watch and laugh!

There is no movie here. This is just a thrown together collection of skits that are slightly funny at their absolute best (we're being generous here) and legitimately offensive at their worst. The cobbled together overarching story is clearly only there so they could actually call this a movie and adds absolutely no value whatsoever to any of the other parts of this movie. If you are looking for an excuse to shut your brain off completely and watch celebrities embarrass themselves to make a quick buck, then this is the "movie" for you.

reviews.review_title: this movie is one of the best
reviews.content: but like seriously guys.. why would someone condemn a movie like this.. this movie is perfect..i haven't laughed as hard as i did since i watched this movie.. a real master piece.. one of the funniest movie I've watched in a while. my favorite part is the one where the guy with a ball on his throat, goes on a blind late. lol i watched that part over and over and then again the part where harry berry plays this truth and dare game with one geeky looking guy.. OK im shocked.. did harley berry actually exposed her breast or was it a graphic thingy.if you're a movie fan who loves comedy and romance..this movie has it all. i felt like i watched like 10 movies in a short time which was ultimately entertaining..

reviews.review_title: Great film full of weird humour
reviews.content: I never watched the trailer, i never checked out the ratings before viewing, I had no pre conceptions, I happened upon the film and gave it a go. I loved it, silly weird funny, I guess a lot of negative review are possibly down to the fact that people where expecting the usual film story plot and what they got wasn't that. Oh and they are humourless boring fools, this movie is great.
A movie that dares to go above and beyond, further than any movie has ever dared to go before. Comedy and satire, humour of the absurde. Surreal and fantastic. Loved every moment.
Just Hilarious 😂 Why the Hate?? This is over the top spoof on everything and everyone

reviews.review_title: Funny! Hollywood Heavyweights being funny! Sketch improv at its best!
reviews.content: Critics again wrong. Like SNL when it used to be funny! Much like MAD TV & In Loving Color. Even when it doesn't work it's funny !! Just knew in mind it's the Farrelly Brothers and a HUGE cast

this movie reminds me of a 1977 movie The Kentucky Fried Movie all most a like The Kentucky Fried Movie plot A series of loosely connected skits that spoof news programs, commercials, porno films, Kong fur films, disaster films, blaxploitation films, spy films, mafia films, and the fear that somebody is watching you on the other side of the TV movie 43 plot A series of interconnected short films follows three kids as they search the depths of the Internet to find the most banned movie in the world funny some times dark hummer yes actors were good story was funny in parts it didn't seam very long no ups and downs watch the end credits for a last short story

reviews.review_title: A good movie for family viewing
reviews.content: I first heard about this movie around the time it was made or released, but then forgot about it. It's been six years, and I'm adding to my list of "favorites" ONCE with movies I've never seen or haven't seen in a long time. After a year or two of waiting to see it, it finally showed up, which means I didn't have to make a decision to see it. So, I finally saw "Movie 43" and wrote a review of it... A freewheeling satire of Internet porn sites, it's a series of unrelated short clips covering everything from testicular displacement, vivid child abuse, incest, defecation fetish, dirty talk fetish, sex dolls, cosplay, child labor, genital mutilation, torture, menstruation, blood, leprechauns, sex fairy, truth or desire, bbc, cartoonish bestiality, to Internet porn. I've never had a headache or felt as physically ill when watching a movie as I did while watching this one. It's actually pretty competent and consistent satire, but I felt physically sick, wanted to turn it off after 15 minutes, was relieved when it was over, and don't plan on watching it again.

reviews.review_title: Not for people who find bodily fluids and genitalia disgusting
reviews.content: I'm giving this film five stars as an average of two types of films....general comedies (I'd give it a 1) and raunchy comedies loaded with adolescent male humor (it rates a 10 in by that category). There are several very funny bits that make this worth watching, even if you don't particularly like scatological, off-color humor. I imagine Kentucky Fried Movie irritated and "offended" about as many people when it came out, seeing as how human nature doesn't change much in 35 years. There will always be a majority of people who get their undies in a bundle over bodily secretions, sex and silly taboo parodies. If there is any valid criticism of this film as a raunch-fest, it's that it's a little predicable in the bodily fluid department. But like I said, there are some moments of original humor in this lambasted little film.And Halle Berry is always great on the eyes!

Honestly it shocks me how many people hate this film. I understand that the trailer and advertisement of this film were misleading, I was also mislead by the trailers. I saw it and thought it was not the film for me, it was probably going to be a comedy for mature, boring and old people because let's be honest Halle berry cant be funny. Oh how I was wrong, I was in tears laughing for almost the entire film, the fact that the A- list cast are making short sketches that are more likely to come from me and my friends is insanely brilliant.The style of comedy is not for everyone, it's offensive, crude and gross but that is what makes it brilliant. The reviews this film receives are unfair and make me sound crazy when I say it is good, but it is one of my favourites and makes me cry even after multiple views.Truly one of the most under rated films along with "Freddie got fingered"

reviews.review_title: If someone wrote a movie in a matter of hours
reviews.content: May contain spoilers Okay, first of all let me tell you that I came into the theater really expecting a lot! Which is something that I RARELY do. Now, I left the theater more saddened disappointed than the last time a girl broke my heart. The film played out as if somebody got high one night and took ten or so sketches that had been written just for fun and put them into a 90 minute movie. The sketches were not movie, and worst of all, half of them were not nearly as offensive as the trailer said they'd be! The first sketch started out fairly promising and lived up to it's potential of offensiveness. But from then on, it was just bad. The only other sketches I could get into was the one with Noami Watts and the one with Christopher Mintz-Plasse. The rest were just short five minute sketches that were either boring or just plain stupid! Anyways, I suggest seeing something else. Try Mama.

reviews.review_title: An awful movie that doesn't need to be seen
reviews.content: There is a lot wrong with this movie. this movie wastes so much talent and isn't even that funny. you would have to be high or drunk to find this movie funny. I mean there are SOME funny moments in this movie, but not enough to buy it or even rent it. the trailer to this movie made it seem funny, but it isn't. You have Kate Winslet who goes on a blind date with a man you have balls hanging from his chin,a 14 year old girls on her period, and a man that gets hit by a car and crap flies everywhere.I don't know that even seems funny. If you are looking for a movie to pass the time or just want to see a bad move, this one is for you.

I'd never heard of this movie. My sister and her husband love it and own the DVD - and they convinced the rest of the family to come and watch this with them. We were a group of 11 people, male and female, ranging in age from 18 to 73. We HOWLED. Did we love each and every skit? No, but I'd say 85% of the content was laugh- worthy. I found myself roaring with laughter at subject matter that I would normally not find amusing. I am a 49-year-old female who has very fond memories of seeing "Airplane" as a young teenager. "Borat" had me gasping for breath, I laughed so hard. If you can't appreciate that level of humor, skip this one. Movie 43 is often more scatological in its humor, which may or may not work - but in this movie it worked for me, or at least 85% of the time it worked. Not a 10 really, but I'm pushing back against all the 1-star ratings. The cast alone raises it to a 5, even if you hated everything else about it.

When I rate a movie less than 6 out of 10, it's usually because there's bad filmmaking involved. I'm not so sure bad filmmaking was the issue here, but I was so turned off that 5 out of 10 was as generous as I could be. And maybe this movie doesn't deserve my generosity. What were the filmmakers involved trying to accomplish with this dumb experiment? I don't remember the last time I disliked a movie so much that I felt angry. I'm not a fan at all of potty mouth humor, and I was worried that this movie was going to be rated something like 8.1 by the viewers who appreciate stuff like this. Bravo to the reviewers on imdb for giving this piece of garbage an accumulated rating of 4.3 of 10.

I mean honestly, I normally go by reviews but still challenge myself to watch movies with bad reviews and is always a 50/50 deal that it might be either good or just complete utter crap.BUT I have to admit this movie had no aim what so ever, stupidity is the only type of common sense the main characters have but if you've watched Scary movie before and found it funny then this movie is basically by the same style.Personally I found it really funny and enjoyed the movie all the way through, I mean after finishing it and reviewing all the stupid scenes it really made me laugh. I would have to say to those that don't find this movie funny in the least, you have no sense of humour or you're the type of person that laughs at unfunny quotes and jokes, liven up people, this movie was funny, Hilarious you could even say, I haven't laughed while watching comedy since the big names, Old school, most of the Scary movies etc... but those who know will get my point.My advice, forget reviews and watch a movie if it sounds interesting to you, reviews are misleading and we all have different tastes, peace fellows.
I don't care what a bunch of sissies are complaining about, this movie is HILARIOUS!!!!!! 🙌🙌🙌🙌

If the 'producers' and 'director' wanted to make the worst movie ever, they pretty much succeeded. The problem is NOT that there is a lot of offensive stuff in the scenes. The problem is that very little of it is FUNNY. The best segment was near the end where Terrence Howard as coach keeps telling his team (playing against a White team) that his team is going to win because they're Black. That's playing on the trope that Black basketball players are better because they are physically built better. That's supposedly (or is it proven) not true. All I can think of is the list of World Marathon point winners. Since 2006, all the top points are male African runners (and all those Kenya except for one for Ethiopia). And since 2010, all female African runners (and all those Kenya except one for Ethiopia). So the trope may not be true but it sure feels true!

reviews.review_title: Do not judge without checking it!
reviews.content: IT'S PURE FUNIf you're into comedies you might have noticed that is getting harder for the writers, most of the epic jokes are already wasted. Being a comedy fan myself i can tell you Movie 43 is a really nice try to do something different. The actors do a great job, you don't get to see all these actors doing something that sucks, they wouldn't do it. Ever. You don't need to worry about the actual plot, 'cause it doesn't really matter. Think of this movie as your time on 9gag or Youtube, it'll be worth it. But mainly, if you like stoner movies, this one is already a classic. Nothing to do with the herb itself, but definitely one to watch on the session.

this is a movie for the open-minded.i was watching it with my wife, and we were sitting with open mouths, staring at the screen in absolute disbelief, unable to grasp the insanity that was going on in front of us. "did this really just happen ??!" we were asking ourselves constantly.it was absolutely amazing, and probably the most fun comedy movie we have seen in a long time. compared to all those half-assed idiotic flicks that we've seen in the last years, this one really delivered. highly recommended.but then again, if you can't stand this kind of humour (see the other reviews), avoid this at all costs.

reviews.review_title: People are way too critical of this movie.
reviews.content: I really don't understand why people are bashing this movie so much since I literally cracked up throughout most of it, and I feel like I'm a very picky person when it comes to movies. Maybe it wouldn't have been as funny if they didnt get so many big name starts but I think thats one of the big reasons it cracked me up. Like seeing Hugh Jackman with balls on his neck is priceless but if it was some unknown actor it probably wouldn't have been as funny. Regardless I guess its just not for everyone but if you are reading this before watching it I would recommend getting high and also don't expect anything but a goofy comedy, similar to a lot of Will Ferrell movies.
I can't use those evil curse words that start with f or s or m but yeah, it's a pile of sh- but mildly entertaining for what it is

reviews.review_title: If you liked Team America, American Carol and Django, then..yay!
reviews.content: Come on now.This movie is in the same genius as Mars Attacks, Zombieland, The Lost skeleton of Cadavra, American Carol and Tropic Thunder. It is fun, well scripted and has amazing stars in it. Those who panned the movie, would pan the above I mentioned. Haven't laughed so hard or scratched my head wondering how much more crazy it could get. Nothing is taboo. Bravo to all the great KNOWN stars who took a role in it. Not all movies are about huge paychecks for the stars or huge percentages of gross.These stars understand that movies are to entertain. You do not need green screens and a billion of dollars of CGA to be worth watching. What bothers me are people who watch every movie as if it is supposed to be an academy award winner. The Evil Dead trilogy (Army of Darkness) wins hands down in creativity over the boring and endless Lord of the Rings...I mean throw the darn ring into the lava already. It is great to watch a film that says what we think and brings out our lost child. I hope there is a sequel.

reviews.review_title: If you DON'T have a sense of humor, DONT watch this
reviews.content: This movie has such a bad reputation. It isn't meant to provoke insight or deep emotions. It's just funny. If oscar winning actors can take time to prove not everything should be taken so seriously, why cant we as a society?

Here we have a comedy that features 12 shorts. Now before I write this review, I'll admit it, I laughed more than 10 times. However, it was a pointless movie. Today, Comedy movies are just goofy, and don't have a solid plot. You don't see many movies anymore like Ferris Bueller. However, this film doesn't even have a plot. Some of the segments didn't even make sense. For example, "Veronica", which featured Emma Stone and Kieran Culkin, did not make sense at all. I didn't laugh once, not even a smile. There were a lot of other segments in which I didn't laugh at all, except for the occasional chuckles. Out of all the 12 segments, I only laughed at 3. And the only one that actually made sense was the home schooling segment with Liev Schreiber. I guess iBabe almost made sense, but it was a stupid pointless 5 minutes. Overall, you'll get some laughs, but it's not the kind of movie you'd watch 3 times in a week. One segment you'll find yourself laughing your ass off, and the next you're on your phone bored out of your mind.

reviews.review_title: My wife and I couldn't stop laughing
reviews.content: Happened to see the trailer on Netflix and decided to watch it. Was in tears after the first two sketches. Restarted watching it with my wife and we couldn't stop laughing. The home schooled kid sketch was one of our favorites.

Hmm, the IMDb synopsis of this movie doesn't seem right. It claims this:"Ineffectual, 'has-been' film-maker (Dennis Quaid) swindles his way into an interview with a film executive (Greg Kinnear) in order to pitch an outrageous and controversial comedy manuscript. After pitching the first of his thirteen offbeat fables, the dejected artist forces the rest of his disjointed allegory on the executive at gunpoint."I just watched the movie and that's not at all what it is. It's two stoner teenagers trying to pull a prank on one of the guys little brother by making him search for a movie called movie 43 on the internet, and while he is looking it up for them, they see all these sketches with various famous actors in it.So where's the part about Dennis Quaid trying to pitch these movie ideas to Greg Kinnear? that was not a part of this movie, at all.Anyway, it's a great movie. Has some laugh out loud moments.

I am watching almost every day a movie and this one deserves a 9 in the the category comedy! Actually I know only a few movies which can top this one and there was in fact one single scene being a little boring and tasteless but the rest made you laugh like hell; seriously I am not a fan of Scary Movie & Co but this movie goes beyond all what you've seen before, promised! Its creative, fresh and fast. Finally, if you need a great flick for hanging out with friends, this one doesn't let you down. there is just enough time to re-fill the drinks!For all the haters here : if you're in a bad mood, or you're lacking sense of humor, please watch something else and not to mention: to write reviews on IMDb.written by an enjoying person

reviews.review_title: I Would Rather Run a Marathon on a Treadmill of Glass
reviews.content: I do not hate very many things. This movie is one of those things that I do hate. I think that this is an unfunny disgrace that never should have been made. It is an unfunny "comedy" that only uses poorly done shock value humor in order to attempt to get the viewer to laugh. This is the biggest viewing regret of my entire life and I have watched a lot of movies that I have not liked. I was willing to give this movie a chance. I sat down to watch it and thought to myself, this can't be as bad as everyone says it is. IT WAS SO SO SO much worse. I never felt even the slightest bit amused by this monstrosity. It spits in the face of young filmmakers that are struggling to try to break into the film industry with its "story." This movie should have never been made and the actors should be ashamed to have been apart of something so greedy and repulsive. I am not someone who is easily offended, but this movie offended me with how how absolutely horrendous it is. You could not pay me to watch this movie again. I find this movie disgusting. Watch anything else instead of this. This movie represents everything bad about Hollywood like greed and elitism. Please please seek out a small indie film instead of this and support a smaller filmmaker who is making movies because they love film not because of a greedy studio contractually forcing them to make a project!

I do not know why there are so many bad reviews for this movie. I found it funny and hilarious at times. I have heard about the bad reviews and so had my husband but we gave it a try and we loved it. The small movies in the film were great and it was great to see so many cameos. I have given it 8/10 as maybe 2 of the shorts were not as funny as the others but even so seeing the cameos made it special. Please do not listen to the other reviews and give it a try. Also watch beyond the first bit of credits as there is an extra small hidden. A gem of a movie and will watch again. Well worth a watch.

reviews.review_title: Funny As Hell If You Like Zucker & Farrely Bros. Films
reviews.content: In the vain of Kentucky Fried Movie and Amazon Women On The Moon, this film is a hilarious, raunchy series of unconnected shorts designed to both make you uncomfortable AND laugh your butt off. Obviously not for all tastes. But if you can appreciate this style of film making it is damn funny. The big ticket stars who appear all do fantastic job. And I especially appreciate Dennis Quaid for being willing to poke fun at himself. My recommendation is to watch this with a few other people in the room. It gets funnier the more people you have laughing with you. So if you like the Zucker and Farrely Bros films, you will enjoy this Big stupid, offensive, non-PC comedy. A breath of fresh air.

This movie is so different than any comedy Ive seen. It definitely had a few laughable moments, but almost seems like it tried too hard the entire time. This is probably best watched slightly bored and drunk haha. One part that made it worth the watch was the whole highschool teen part with Liev Schriber. The writing on the refridgerator was funny and unexpected along with the parents giving the kid a "real" highschool experience.So, in the end, watch at your own risk, but prepare for ridiculousness.

reviews.review_title: if you dont like it. you must be stupid
reviews.content: People are stupid for the majority. this is a genius movie.

This movie was very funny. The actors they had were very good like Wolverine and the other people I recognized from other movies. The only problem was that some of the stories within this movie were not that great. However the other stories that were funny in this movie were hilarious. For instance, in some of these parts of the funny stories I was forced to pause the movie because I was laughing so hard that I had to gasp for air. My favorite story was the story with wolverine's brother. My second favorite scene was with Wolverine when he had balls on his chin. They also got a bunch of super funny actors/ actresses that I recognized from other movies. So all in all I would highly recommend the watching of this intense movie. Some other reviews said that this movie sucked but do not read those because those people probably liked inception a lot, but if you read my other review on inception, you find out that inception is not good and overrated and it is super boring.

reviews.review_title: funny,but vulgar, The best part, Hugh jackmann end kate Winslet
reviews.content: Funny,some vulgarity (Moretz ) .The best ridiculouus part Samantha(Watts) and his son, Kevin, and obviously,jackman"s testicles!!
Pathetic movie such big cast wasted no story no line im shocked why these actors even agreed to do this movie

reviews.review_title: Clearly not for everyone, but DAMNED funny to us...
reviews.content: My wife and I laughed our a**es off through this movie. Childish? Yes. Cheap jokes? By the score. Crude? Very. Subtle? As a fart in church. We loved watching some favorite (and some unfamiliar) stars not afraid to go after the cheap joke. Maybe it helps that we're old enough to have seen the original "Kentucky Fried Movie", but it was definitely an homage to the genre. Is it a genre worth "homaging"? .... Depends on your taste. After watching a string of pretentious, stupid, contemporary "comedies" this was refreshingly, shamelessly (or shamefully) funny. The home-schooling skit and Halle Berry making guacamole with her breast were worth it by themselves. If you don't like the first 10 minutes..... Turn it off. It won't get any better for you. Otherwise keep watching. Tomorrow you can rent Citizen Kane and restore your dignity.

Was the movie perfect? No.Was the movie poignant? No.Was the movie funny? Hell yes!I think the political correctness police attacked this movie so people turned away. The point of this movie was to be pointless and to push the envelope. This movie was an escape from reality, it wasn't meant to be Gone with the Wind; it was meant to create laughter.The movie broke a lot of taboos which I think was the point. It wasn't going to rant and point down on you, it's going to submit to one's guilty pleasure. This movie tried to offend everyone and it did, so criticism of what it was meant to do?Look at what 2013 offered....Hangover 3, which rehashed everything from the previous two. So it didn't add anything.Internship, which wasn't funny and couldn't rekindle the magic of Vaughn and Wilson.Scary Movie 5, which wasn't funny and why was it made?This is the End, which was just as offensive but without the humor? Why is the devil raping a guy funny again?The Heat, which pushed Melissa McCarthy down our throats and didn't offer a comic release?We are the Millers, which tried to be a movie with morals but didn't offer any growth in character or story.So why is Movie 43 so despised? It was raunchy? So were the previous mentioned movies. It was political incorrect, that was part of the appeal to push the envelope.Maybe that is what's wrong with Hollywood. When creativity comes around, the public hates the unknown. Again, this movie wasn't going to get an Oscar but it did entertain. Wasn't that the purpose?I think it needs another watch. The movie gets attacked by everyone but I don't see why? This movie will never be confused for comedies like Animal House or Caddy shack, but it did provide the audience an escape.So everyone hates this movie, everyone is entitled to their opinions; I just don't see why the mass hate. It was offensive but that was the point. It was an equal opportunity insult to the senses. Has everyone become so prudish that once offended, they neglect the humor aspects?Movie 43 wasn't as bad as the critics propose it to be. The movie does it's job by giving an abstract view of different areas of comedy. If you are easily offended, then movies like Girl's Trip, Sausage Party and Sex and the City would get the same criticism.So give it another watch, it's not as bad as everyone wants you to believe it is. It has the direction of James Gunn, it has the talent of Richard Gere, Elizabeth Banks, Halley Berry, and Hugh Jackman; so that should peak the interest. Again, this isn't an Oscar movie and it wasn't presented as one. It's a comedy that went 'there' and it got chastitized doing so.

Really ppl?! I honestly laughed my entire ass off at this movie! Idk what's wrong you Debbie Downers. This movie was supposed to be everything you thought it was: gross, disgusting, childish, ignorant, great, entertaining, awesome, you name it. But it works for this movie. You don't have to be immature to like this movie. Get off your pedestal and laugh a little. Sheesh ppl. I started writing reviews bc y'all be throwing me way left field sometimes. :/ But really, the balls on the neck, funniest sh*t ever. Lmao! And Terrance Howard really gave me the laugh I needed at the end. This movie gets a 10 from me any day.

Hy! Im just a hungaryan boy and i think this movie was a great film about the american teenager culture. I was bemarni with my homies and i think this movie was a great film! I love this movie. I was in a laughing fless.

First off I should say I just saw the non-US version which has a different linking story - three kids trying to find the mysterious Movie 43 on the internet rather than a pitch. This actually seems to make more sense than the pitch scenario and does provide a reasonable framework.I think this movie is not what most reviewers have taken it to be. I take each short as translating common social situations, attitudes and prejudices, and distorting them into parodies of themselves. Imagine Derek and Clive collaborating with Michel Foucault on the scripts for a series of sketches and you'd end up with something like Movie 43.

I can see why a lot of people would dislike this movie, its a kind of f..d up movie, after watching i thought my mind got fc..d up, but interestingly enough i wish there were more of the sketch in this movie, i'm craving more.... then it made sense, the whole purpose of this movie was to arouse the side of our grotesque thought process. and it was really successful doing it, Its so stupid that makes the movie hilarious. I would watch if there's a sequel to it. I liked it at the end. My favourite has to be the "truth or dare" sketch, specially after everything how Halle Berry says, sorry im not really interested in Asian man. 2nd favourite is the Batman & Robin sketch. Overall, if you are really bored and kind of feeling really down, this movie would help.

The only bad thing about this movie is that I Waited to long to watch it. On IMDb it has a low rating so that kept me away for a while. And that was a mistake, because it gave tears in my Eyes from laughter. Now humor is a personal thing and this apparently fits mine. Since I do not want to put in a spoiler it is best to describe it as humor in The family Guy category. It is really out there with an impressive cast of famous and wonderful actors. Humor is funny when it scratches the taboos in a society and this one hits a nerve when it comes to sex, parenting, social customs, jealousy, relations, racism and more. The only thing I missed was a full blown crack at religion. Maybe movie 44 can fill that gap. Finally I think this is a must-see movie for any movie lover. That does mean you have to like it, but from a pure cinematographic point of view this icon of a film is worth your while. I mentioned family Guy before, but I salute The filmmakers in The USA who had The courage to make movie like this with real actors and managed to give me movie that scratches The edges of society in a manor that deserves a sequel.

reviews.review_title: Terrible if you want to watch it, don't watch it with anyone else you will embarrass yourself
reviews.content: I decided to watch this movie because I saw it online and it looked pretty cool! It had a bunch of great actors, sounded like a good plot, and it genuinely sounded like a good movie. When I watched the movie all my hopes went right down the drain and into the sewers. It was cringe, and the acting wasn't what I expected. It didn't feel like the comedy movie it was suppose to be, it felt like the opposite of that. The movie is weird and I guess that ls the whole point of the movie but this was just dumb and not funny unless you're stoned. I do not suggest this movie, and if you watch it I think you will agree!!
Can't believe I missed this movie. Just brilliant.
It's really not bad people really trying to find the seriousness of this movie nothing serious At all and that's why it's hilarious. Hugh Jackman skit was hilarious

reviews.review_title: The Dennis Quaid version is best
reviews.content: It's an off the wall comedy with toilet humor. It's a funny movie. Didn't like the version where Movie 43 was a hidden internet movie. Dennis Quaid pitching short stories is the better version by a long shot. The stupid ideas (and I mean that in a good funny way) that Dennis Quaids character pitches are friggin hilarious. Terrance Howard as a basketball coach, that pitch was priceless.

This is the type of movie that shows the blatant divide in the US. Religious malcontents and conservatives vs progressive, free, and open-minded. This movie is absolutely ridiculous and that's exactly what it's supposed to be - offensive and ludicrous. That's the entire point. If you can't have any fun watching this movie I feel bad for you. You can clearly see that the actors were having a blast in every skit. If you don't get it or don't want to get it or claim oh I got it but still don't like it, then go back to reading the Bible or Vonnegut; you are clearly not the target audience, thus making yours and all other negative reviews here completely invalid.To anyone rating this less than a 5, seriously, lighten up and get a life.

A refreshing and unpredictable ironic black comedy. Most movies coming out of Hollywood are tepid, formulaic and forgettable. This is a sordid, crazy short story series with under the belt humour. It's not every one's cup of tea for sure, but it definitely has a a lot of rare and welcome twists.

I am not really sure why so many people found this movie so bad.. I loved the film and I know many many people who also enjoyed it.This is by far the funniest movie I have ever seen, I laughed so hard in this film I was coughing through out the day.I literally loved the film and I brought the DVD it was so good.The main plot of the movie is stupid yes, but you do not need to look at that. That is more or less thrown in to make the film with the funny clips together.I love this film I really do, and I enjoy everything about this film and it is REALLY REALLY funny.Probably the funniest movie ever made and I loved the lineup, I loved the cast, I loved the clips and I know many many people who feel the same way towards it :)

reviews.review_title: If you like random humor, you're going to like it
reviews.content: I was surprise about the score that this movie has since it has so many great actors, so I decide to check it out and i laugh almost the entire movie, to explain it better is random humor, kinda like Family.Probably people expected a better humor, but I really like it, it's a great movie to watch with your friends, it's easy, stupid, funny and sometimes we need that. So don't expect a great story line or great acting, it's stupid humor at it's best. I never thought some of the actors like Kate Winslet, Naomi Watts or Hugh Jackman (speacially winning the Oscar the same year) could act in this type of comedy, so that was even better, great actors playing the most stupid role of their careers but let me tell you it works perfectly. I never thought that I movie like was going to be made with this type or actors but I'm glad it did, don't miss it.

reviews.review_title: Can't believe the rubbish reviews & low ratings.
reviews.content: Some parts of this film are hilarious, especially Stephen Merchant and Halle Berry's part, I couldn't stop laughing and Hugh Jackman & Kate Winslets scene, worth a watch just for thier comedy sketches.

I am a big fan of this very stupid movie! It plays like a good, uncensored and vulgar episode of SNL or something. You do HAVE to be a fan of sketch comedy to appreciate the episodic nature of this movie. It barely holds together a frame of a movie, which is a something like a found footage type of spoof. There was another movie that I watched that was not as funny as this, but similar, called InAPPropriate Comedy, and that is much more deserving of the hate it receives than this. That movie, while somewhat funny, falls flat FAR more frequently than Movie 43. This is a star packed sketch comedy that employs toilet humor galore, and enough variety to keep you interested. If it doesn't grab your attention from the first sketch with Hugh Jackman, then this movie will NOT be for you I think. This movie is very divisive among it's crowd, and I think that many people who voted this 1 star didn't actually watch the whole thing. Like many positive reviewers of this Hollywood fun project, I am a fan of a huge amount of other movies, reaching from pretty much every genre. I watched this movie like other reviewers and laughed the whole way through... Does this make me a moron another reviewer asked? No, it's just we felt in the mood for a good dumb laugh at that time. I have seen this movie three times since it came out and I do not regret it, because I laughed every time. It is funny each time, and though the segments with the teens (the frame of the movie) occasionally fall flat, even they provided a good laugh at the end too. I rate movies based on what it was trying to accomplish it it's genre, and for this one, it did lewd and crude very well. I will say it's not for everyone though, it is quite in your face with the vulgarity of its humor, but if you can stand it, it's hilarious! 8/10

reviews.review_title: I don't even know how to describe this...
reviews.content: Take Epic Movie, Superhero Movie, Scary Movie and any other spoof film you've ever seen in your life, mix it with an explosive amount of drugs, times that by 10000 and you might have something that slightly resembles Movie 43.In a sentence, this film is an absolute diabolical catastrophe that could end the world as we know it (which the film's somewhat 'story' follows) consisting of a cacophony of well respected actors and humour that made me want to seriously kill myself.That being said, I (regrettably) found myself enjoying the film. The film is shown in the form of a number of short films, all focusing on awful protagonists and scenarios that will make your toes curl. Luckily I have an awful sense of humour and will laugh at almost anything but I found the controversial humour hilarious and I was just amazed at how extreme the directors went into this monstrosity of a media piece.But as much as I enjoyed it, this film is complete and utter cods wallop. A lot of the humour is just distasteful and cheap, the 'story' lacks anything that resembles a real film.If you pay to watch this film, you're in for a huge waste of money. Luckily this film doesn't even attempt to aim for anything realistic or serious which makes it a fun watch as you're waiting to see what the insane directors can conjure up next. I did like seeing the well respected actors show their humorous side though, even if it was in a distasteful manner.I'll be generous and give this film a 5/10, but that's being extremely nice and I have a soft spot for terrible films.

What, or, how could I possibly explain Movie 43. Some will hate it and some will love it. This is certainly not a comedy for the whole family, nor is it one for a husband and wife. Which means this is generally geared towards goofy teenagers looking for nudity, trashy language, and the wolverine with balls on his chin. For that, I identify this film as a masterpiece.Most of the critics have said this is without a doubt the worst film ever made, but I will not say that, because that is undoubtedly what this film wants. It is a simple f**ck you to the mainstream, because, well they have the mainstream. They have accomplished finding some of the most critically acclaimed actors in today's pulp culture and put them into an overwhelmingly filthy movie. I applaud them.So threw all the scenes in the film, it wasn't so much the jokes that made me laugh, it was more so the people playing them. Where else will you find Hugh Jackman with balls on his chin, or Chloe Grace Moretz on her period. You will see Jason Sudeikis in a Batman costume, Halle Berry in crazy truth or dare contest, and watch as Dennis Quaid turns to violence after being driven insane from being shunned out of Hollywood. Yes this film is pointless, yes its stupid and dirty, but this is Movie 43, and it is truly, one of a kind.

After seeing a lot of negative reviews about this film i thought id add a more positive one.first of all the comedy is very crude and you have to have a more dark sense of humour in order to find this film funny. even so despite the plot being minimal (which doesn't really matter) i found the sketches/scenes in the film to be rather funny, sometimes yes inappropriate but funny it's the kind of film that fits a smaller audience bracket which to be fair is around 13/19 year olds.i think if you take this film for what it is its quite enjoyable, it's various sketches are each individual to the film and add different kinds of comedy ending with a rather twisted finale.the fact that this film doesn't really follow Aristotelian form doesn't change the way the film should be viewed and take the film for lots of small mini films with a dark taste.i did really enjoy it, but then again this is my kind of comedy

reviews.review_title: Yes I'm 40 and I thought it was funny
reviews.content: There were only a few segments that I could've lived without but more than 80% of the movie was funny to me. Speed-dating, Home schooled, both blind-date segments, and the cartoon cat during the credits, just to name a few. Even the basketball short had it's moments. I don't know why it has such a poor review? I didn't watch it at the movies nor did I see a trailer for it, I merely saw it on DVD and thought it was entertaining. I could see where a trailer could be misleading or this movie could've been marketed to the wrong crowd and they paid to see it at the theater and that's why they're upset but other than that, I found it rather amusing.
Am i the only one here who likes this movie? I think this movie is absurdly hillarious. They did a good job.

reviews.review_title: Get a sense of humor people!!
reviews.content: I thought this movie was really funny. Every skit had me, my fiancé and his mom laughing or covering our faces because we were shocked by what we saw and I liked that. This is not your everyday type of movie or anything like any movie you have seen before which was really refreshing to me. If you want to get a headache or pee your pants I suggest watching it. I will NEVER forget this movie and to me that is awesome! So tired of watching movies that are just like the movie that came out before it..yawwwwn. No one can ever say they saw a movie like this one i can promise you that. Take a chance and watch this movie..what do you have to lose? Just make sure you watch it with someone who also has a weird sense of humor. P.S Gerard Butler is awesome!!!

When i first saw this movie, i was laughing from the beginning to the end unstoppable. It was hilarious! The fact that the entire Movie 43 is constructed from a dozen of other mini clips and the way they appear is very interesting. Also, i don't know why all these brilliant actors agreed to play in it, but that is what makes it more hilarious that already is. I don't know what is wrong with these people who put low vote on this movie, they don't have sense of humor or something... i don't know. Maybe the fact the it has no deeper meaning and the "critics" didn't like it. If you like Scary Movie, Monty Python and other similar humor then you will love it. I absolutely recommend this movie,trust me, you wont be disappointed. If this ain't funny, then i don't know what is.

reviews.review_title: Funny, off the wall, twisted irreverent humour
reviews.content: This is my first review on IMDb but felt I had to write something because the previous reviewers seem to have had a complete humour lobotomy Distasteful? Offensive? Un PC? Purlease! This movie was just fun all the way through, especially because of the huge stars in it who were happy to send themselves up and show that not every actor is honing his 'craft' and that some are able to make fun of themselves at their own expense. Thats a pretty special and admirable display of character to me.I absolutely loved the spoof adverts such as i Babe, Tampax etc. These prove so popular on face book and you tube, so why not in a Hollywood movie too? Tarantino showed that it worked well in his grind house flicks, so I think its just as good here as it is there.The humour throughout this was just bizarre, surreal and absolutely fantastic. Loved it loved it loved it.The pace is fast, the energy is frenetic, the jokes are piled so high that even if you don't find one funny, another good one will be coming by any second now.Please don't take the above reviews too seriously. Critics often just like to whine for the sake of whining. They are just annoyed that they didn't come up with the idea themselves.Irrelevant laid back humour, just as funny as any Wayans brothers movie, but with extra star appeal and base humour.Watch it. Don't take it seriously. Don't dissect it. Just enjoy it for what it is.
I'm sorry, but you have to find the humor....this is a lot like SNL with a no-holds-barred sense of humor. I laughed so hard that I cried (and got an amazing ab workout at the same time!!)

Idk why ppl hate this movie so much i thot it was highlarious. I mean Stephen Merchant w a penia tattooed on is cheek and Chris Pratt getting hit by a car and $#!tting all over the windshield almost made me $#!t myself laughing. 10/10 to off set comedy snobs.

reviews.review_title: A 90 Minute Excuse for Staring at Nothing
reviews.content: Oh Movie 43. There is only one reason for anyone to ponder giving this movie one more ticket sale, one DVD pickup in the Walmart 5 dollar bin, or even one single view, and that reason is a question. "WHAT IS MOVIE 43?". Well, one could stay up all night trying to answer this question maybe after looking at the trailer, or just hearing about it online.In most of the reviews I put out, I like to give a brief synopsis, or summary of what the movie is about. With Movie 43, all I can say is that it is a big pile of TERRIBLE sketch-comedy, with little to almost no laughs at all.Most of the jokes that are put into your brain for you to decide whether they are funny or not are mostly things said about defecation, adolescence, or just plain stupidity. It is embarrassing to say that one of these sketches got a laugh out of me and it was maybe just a chuckle, and it was the LAST one. There isn't a reason to sit through this movie just to see that sketch.I can proudly say with all of my heart and belief that there is extremely funnier sketch-comedy on YouTube!The only reason this movie doesn't get a rating of 1 is because I miraculously sat through all of this movie.This movie can't even answer the question it's market advertisements ask, "What is Movie 43?". The real answer is that no one knows what Movie 43 is, not even the filmmakers themselves.

The movie is simply just funny. It's not something that I would take my mother or a little cousin to go see. However, it is a movie that I would kick back and watch with friends. Some of you have your panties on too tight and don't know how to loosen up some times! If you enjoy all types of humor, even the immature ones, then I advise you to go see this movie now! On the other hand, if you are more of a serious person who would prefer to watch gone with the wind, then don't waste your time watching it... let alone writing negative comments about a movie that was meant to be humorous. I enjoyed it and I'm pretty sure that I am not the only one in this world that will!
Garbage movie made by garbage people with money to pay for the big names.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious, if you're in the right frame of mind
reviews.content: Movie 43 is the result of actors and actresses getting together to have fun without caring what the critics think. This movie has no redeeming value other than just being fun! Crass, rude,raunchy, vulgar, indecent, gross... I don't know how many other synonyms I can use to describe the humor. Everything hinges on shock value and randomness. This movie is ridiculous. Don't get caught up in the wrapper that surrounds the shorts... just enjoy each skit on its own. Some jokes fall flat, but I continued smiling throughout most of the movie. I only didn't like the main story-line, but the rest of the movie was really good. Just watch in the right frame of mind and you will laugh...

Reviews can't do this justice, words fall short. This is an anthology. The first segment was bad and each one kept getting worse. How they convinced A-List actors to contribute is beyond me.But as bad as they were, I died laughing each time. I'm ashamed to admit it but I laughed each time. Gross, crude and hilarious.

You can relate to the fact that in our time the comedy genre is almost impossible to imagine without all sorts of, and often unnecessary, vulgarities that so tempt the teenage audience, who had no idea what humor is and what it is eaten with. So it's not hard to guess that the more nasty the modern mainstream becomes, the more likely it is for the studio to get another hit.

I just laughed for about 90 minutes. Movie 43 has some really bad press. And it is vulgar, puerile, offensive, inappropriate, Porky's-like...but I laughed almost all the way through it. It helped to have Class A stars in it, doing/saying the most bizarre things...In the style of Modern Family, with Mel Brooks in the background, snickering.And a really good "punch" at the Hollywood industry. For just a mere $6 million! In Australia, one could make 3 really funny movies for that, and you might even get the big "blockbuster" stars to support them.Movie 43 certainly beats many of the stupid box-office "hits"

reviews.review_title: Child in Movie do not mean Children watch it
reviews.content:
I do not take a serious fun.
I serious enjoy serious act in a funny way !!!

reviews.review_title: Not for the wannabe people who are too Politically Correct. (Not that being PC is bad just it's okay to let it go sometimes.) :)
reviews.content: CONTAIN'S PLOTS TO THE SKITS, BUT NOT SPOILERS. :)Me (19) and my Dad (49) Went to see Movie 43. The night before I looked up the reviews on this sight and I'm glad I didn't listen to the uptight idiots on this sight. Yes this movie has a lot of border line Jokes that cross the line, and yes this isn't the greatest film of all times. But if you don't have a stick up your rump and you have an open mind like me and my father and this couple behind us (who were probably in their late 30's to mid 40's) and you Enjoy Raunchy Comedy that sometimes go a bit too far but you don't care because your enjoying your self then I would go see this movie. If your someone who doesn't like obscene things then no. Now to make it really clear this movie has skits that follow this one guys goal to make a movie. So here are the plots with out spoiling it for you.I'll try to get them in order to the best of my recollection and sorry if I miss one or two.1. Girl goes on date with guy that has balls on his neck. (Was Pretty Funny) 2. Parents talk about how they home school his son and how they focus on making him feel alienated to give him the real exp which is that high school is the worst time in a young boys life. (moderately funny) 3. Girl wants her Boyfriend to Poop on her because she thinks that it shows that she trust him (Funny) 4. Ex Boyfriend and Ex Girlfriend have an obscene convo about their relationship at his work accidentally leaves mic on the whole store hears the convo. (Didn't find this one that funny.) 5. Company Tries to sell an IBabe that looks like a real naked girl kids get hurt trying to have sex with it (Funny) 6. Guy & Girl on Blind date they play a game of Truth or Dare (Pretty Funny) 8.Guy gives his friend a leprecon for his Bday Present and they try to get it to tell em' where the gold is (Funny) 9. 2 "Tweens" on a date at the boys house she has her first period everyone including the father freaks out.(Moderately Funny) 10. 1959 or 69 basketball team Black's vs Whites coach emphasizes they will win because "There white and were black" (little funny but not the best) 11. After the first set of credits there is a short between a animated cat(who's Sexually attracted to his male owner) and the Owner's girlfriend and the cat gets jealous and tries to get rid of her. (Me and my Dad's fav scene.)So if stuff like this sounds funny then go see if not try to pull that stick out of your butt because its funny don't be such a buzz kill because you want to be politically correct. I give this 7/10

This film is basically an extended "The Aristocrats" joke, And let's face it, that's pretty awesome. Of course if you don't like the idea of incest jokes, testicles on Hugh Jackmans' neck, coprophiliac newly weds, Batman describing super girls' vagina and a whole host of uncomfortable and essentially anti social gags, it's probably best avoided. I'm unsure why the UK version was altered to include the sub plot, it hardly seemed worth it. There's nothing that holds this film together, but that's okay because just when you think it can't get any worse it's on the next sketch, The sketches themselves do vary in quality but the acting is generally very good and the surreal scripts leave you in fear of what is coming next. The critics panned it, which is unfair. The spirit of The Aristocrats is embedded so deeply in this, it could just about be seen by batman,,,... Have I got an act for you!

reviews.review_title: Ingenious writing, sick and demented as it is, hits it out of the park!
reviews.content: I have to say this right off the bat, this film is perverted, demented, risqué, politically incorrect, really sick ........ and that's what really makes this such a great picture! All you need to do is look at all the A list stars that wanted to get aboard this Farrelly Brothers project! I understand there were many more actors that had their agents scour the Brothers for a part in this film, but were turned away. If you liked Blazing Saddles, Airplane and Police Squad, you'll love this!

reviews.review_title: Super weird...but not without its moments
reviews.content: I noticed all the 1 votes and most occurred when the film was released. I really can't blame them but if you watch this with a bit of forewarning you may get through it and walk away not too scathed. It is bizarre on more than a few levels though.The film is designed to shock and appall. It's probably aimed at 15-21 y/o's with pretty gross out humour. It's full of concepts usually never spoken about or if they're ever voiced it's probably at the end of a party where everyone's in the kitchen, has had way too much to drink and is just trying to outdo each other by taking a concept too far. Part of me thinks that's probably how the film was born. Some kudos has to go to the stars in it for...well just being in it. How they got them to sign on is amazing and how they got through the scenes with a straight face is a testament to their acting ability. In a nutshell it's an eclectic bunch of short stories that admittedly are a bit hard to watch at the time but do make you chuckle momentarily afterwards when you think back to certain moments. It is a film that's funnier when you look back on it after a decent amount of time from when you watched it.If you are a person whose somewhat easily offended then give it a miss. If on the other hand you're not shocked by gross humour then strap yourself in, you're in for a ride you won't forget too quickly.Will I toss the DVD out? No. Will I watch it again anytime soon. I haven't seen it in 18 months and I'm in no hurry to give it another spin but one day I'll revisit it. If only to be amazed at how so many stars came together in such a bizarre film. The memory of Kate Winslet's face at the dinner table just makes me laugh. As for the other scenes, I just don't think about them. Although some are pretty hard to forget.

I can see why many people would find it objectionable. It's pretty hit and miss, but for all intents and purposes this the principle of Robot Chicken transferred to live action. Consequently, what would normally be hilarious here often is only moderately funny, because it takes away one layer of absurdity. A movie for the faint of heart or those who like their humor famly-friendly, this is not. Personally I found it just absurd enough to be entertaining, even though it dipped below the threshold quite a few times..

First of all lemme tell u that this is movie is v funny and clever as it has the most loud humor presented in a subtle way....let it be the Anna Farris story which is brilliantly directed or the basketball match encouragement scene and by the way which i found the funniest as it had some great L-O-L moments....I know it has less ratings by this one surprised me completely....Starts off with a brilliant performance by Kate Winslet and ends in a great way by the sexy Elizabeth Banks.. Dnt expect to be a smart movie as it very much implies from the start that the characters are completely dumb which is shown in the smartest ways possible You may have heard bad things about the story but i do not regret watching it all...do watch it as u won't be disappointed

I can't wrap my head around the fact that so many famous actors got involved with this film. So the producer in this story was not wrong at all, these were absolutely hideous ideas for short films. You'd have to have a gun pointed to your head for even thinking of producing this, just like depicted in the film itself. I guess the actors were blackmailed which got them being casted I guess?

I've never written a review before, but after seeing this movie (because I was simply bored), I just had to!The trailer was weird, rating was/is low (4.4), but the cast list drew me in. I thought to myself - hey, why not. It starts off with 3 kids and some really bad acting. It's when the "shorts" begin, you realize that this is no ordinary movie. Literally. I don't know how they managed to get big stars doing what they did, but it was like no other movie I have ever seen. I laughed and I cringed, not believing what I was seeing! It has a sexual reference to pretty much anything disgusting, yet funny (keeping an open mind is key). If you are the kind of person that gets offended easily, don't waste your time on this. If you like slapstick humor and love a good laugh - try it out! I'm not going to spoil anything, but based on what I have seen and what I have read from other reviews - you are either going to love this film or totally hate it (and not seeing the point with it).Other reviews varies from either 1/10 OR 8/10. I give it a 8, just because I did NOT expect anything from this movie, but was left with a total mindf***!Kudos for using a Norwegian singer's song in the "end credit" :)

reviews.review_title: one of the best laughs in a century
reviews.content: Whats wrong with all critics. this one is fantastic! i havent seen it for so long because of the bad critics. it is a must watch movie. i was laughing the whole time. its a 10/10

reviews.review_title: movie 43 makers, what the hell were you thinking!!?
reviews.content: this movie is really really confusing!! i keep wondering how they manged to get such cast to feature in this movie 43 thing!! but then again you look at the $8 million budget of the movie, and it's got to tell you something. it frequently tries to bull a smile from you but in my case it wasn't working at all. a punch of short imaginary sequences that is mostly more disgusting than funny. i mean for crying out lowed what's so funny about a guy who wants to defecate on his girlfriend as an act of love and then get hit by a car!!!? for me i would rate it 3/10 just for the cast this movie got but 1/10 for everything else. steer clear away from it!!

This movie is in a similar vein to the american pie movies. More with ackward moments and cheap laughs. I found some scenes funnier then others. Different actors every 5 or 10 minutes. A little over the top but it was very entertaining.Some great talent doing some aweful things 😆😆😆

Why 43 in the title? After witnessing this total train wreck, it's the rating the production company have expected to get on IMDb, seems now soo obvious...Sudeikis made it look like a SNL spin-off that was so bad it didn't make the cut just before going on the air, which means here 'crappier than crap'. God, pls explain here - how Halle Berry could think of taking part in this lemon of a film by completely degrading herself this way? When making fun of a traumatising situation like a teen getting her first period, you need to make sure that their is a minimum of satire in it, which is totally evacuated by the - hum - script here. Once this segment is over, all we are left with is incomfort for the teenage girl and resentment toward the scriptors.Overall, this film leaves you with the feeling that this actually could have worked if, 1st, we were still in 1982 when Kentucky Fried Movie & Amazon Women on the Moon were all over the place, and, 2nd, the too many flawed stories were supported, here and there, with some magic moments that sometimes awkwardly elevates the degree of humor - like, on Amazon Women, the st segment with Arsenio Hall was sooo powerfully hilarious that it made for a couple of boring moments to come later in the film.A movie more boring than anything else, what a shame.

reviews.review_title: This movie is stupid, but it is funny.
reviews.content: Not all the sketches land, and even the ones that do, aren't for everyone. But most of the humor hit for me personally. So be warned, you may hate the movie. But if you have a really broad sense of humor, then I think you'll have a good time.

I am not usually a fan of gross-out comedy and I usually avoid it like the plague. I still to this day have never seen any one of the American Pie movies. In fact, I make it a point to not watch any movie where the film poster font is: thick red Arial Black. I also don't watch movie trailers because they give everything away and I never read reviews until after I've seen a film. I go based on the Film Poster, Tag Line, Genre or Actor/s. Luckily, this film did not have thick red Arial font because I would have missed a fun night out.In my country we had the teenager thread storyline instead of The Pitch. The reason for the title being "Movie 43" is explained in this storyline. While this version sounds more entertaining than what I had read of the alternate one, it does make the film a little random. I believe this a strength in some ways and a weakness in others. The social commentary on Hollywood movies is lost in the teenagers version and it interferes with the original message of the film. However, the randomness of the teenagers storyline makes you feel like you're spending a night at home surfing the net watching videos like "2 girls one cup" or "epic fails of the week" or "college humor" and this I found to be a strength of this teenager storyline.Had this film been made with unknowns or actors typical in this genre it would not have been as enjoyable. There were some of these stock actors: Anna Farris, Sean W. Scott and Johnny Knoxville. I did cringe when I saw these stock actors because I was thinking "Oh Lord, what OTT BS is gonna happen now?" and I was right. But the thing that saved these sketches and made them funny was the inclusion of likable actors like J.B. Smoove and Gerard Butler. Other than that the rest of the stories were hilarious. Yes, the things were despicable but they could only work with these A-listers. Only Hugh Jackman could make me laugh with balls hanging from his neck, only he could do it. Only Halle Berry could make me laugh by mixing guac with her right boob. Only Richard Gere could stick his fingers in a black girl's vagina and elicit laughter. The humor doesn't necessarily come from the storyline, but from the fact that these particular actors are in the storyline. Seriously, all they needed was "Ann Hathaway with an E" doing a self-deprecating storyline and this would've been perfect. I would have preferred that to the Batman story.This film reminds me of the films "Paris, Je'taime" and "The Ten". A bunch of different stories directed by different directors put together. You should see this movie not for the great writing or cinematography, but for the chance to see A-listers being silly. It is thoroughly entertaining and I predict this film will become a cult classic and will make Top Ten Best lists in the years to come.

reviews.review_title: Possitively fond of the actresses and actors
reviews.content: The only reason whay I rate 6 for this movie is that it contains a great deal of actors and actresses which are of my favorites. As for the contents - It's just for fun without any meaningful story.

This is incredibly well done. Simple sketch premises that are well-funded with amazing talent. People who do not like this either do not understand sketch comedy, seek out opportunities to be offended, or a combination of the two. We may never see another sketch movie like this ever again.

I really don't understand the negativity on this movieIt is not going to win any Oscars but people need to approach it for what it is.It is a series of short sketches, comedy. There is no real linking of the sketches despite trying to link them in with a movie theme.. You need to appreciate the individual sketches.I'll admit not all of the sketches work but at least 70% do. I found the movie , overall hilarious and well worth watching. Yes the sketches are crude and gross humor but if you know this how can you then be offended. I can not understand half the reviews when if you know what the movie is why would you watch it if this sort of thing doesn't appeal?Well worth it and 7.5/10

I'd seen the trailer for this and thought it looked very good as it had many amazing actors and actresses. It was not what I expected, it was a little weird and random, but I didn't hate it. Although all the little movies within were random, they were funny. I didn't understand the very last video though.. I didn't understand why they had made this movie as it was very strange, but it was funny and I enjoyed it. Some videos were a little strange, like the one including Gerard Butler, but I did find the one about the home-schooled boy very funny. I think overall it is like marmite, you either like it or hate it. Me? I think I am in the like it category as it was amusing but weird. I don't think I will be watching it again, but I would recommend anyone else to.

OK first this movie is Bad.. It was always bad... but the casting proved too much.. I had to look ahead actually what the A lister might do.. And the result was :funny. I laughed most of the times looking at the awkward crass jokes.. Its one of those movies where every attempt has been made to use all kinds of innuendos and direct actions to implicate below the belt humor.. some sketches were really funny. the others with the cat.. absolutely not... This is one hell of a laugh riot if u know that its only made for that.. Around 16 sketches have been directed to form one movie called movie 43 where in the small kid is shown to possess the real genius of solving all the computer hacking skills.. In the end it achieves what the movie was tending to gloat all about.. The bottomline. U cannot see this movie with ur parents.. But with some of your buddies its another hilarious stuff...

Ok, ok, I get it... most people won't understand this film. Simply for the reason that (as far as I can see) most of the reviewers of this film seem to be from the United States of America. So any puerile humour that takes them out of there comfort zone will be lost on them. This is an absolute tour de force by Stephen Merchant, and I loved every minute of its macabre, weird, disgusting plot. This is a natural progression of Monty Python via Goonies. Couldn't recommend it highly enough!

The only sad thing about this movie is that it points out how closed minded and politically correct our society has become. I am in my mid 40's who appreciates movies on all different levels and I found this movie to be enjoyable as well as very funny. Anyone who is into the Farrelly brothers or Seth MacFarlane should like this movie. If you are easily offended then you really had no business seeing this movie to begin with. I really don't think it is fair to give a movie one star because you found some of the material to be offensive. While some shorts were funnier then others I really did enjoy them all. The movie is well acted with good production values as well which surprised me considering all the negative reviews. The humor is no holds barred anything goes and most likely will offend some people. Bottom line, if you have an open mind and sense of humor then I think you would appreciate this movie. I look forward to seeing it again.

I truly thought with such an awesome cast that this would be better. Not horrible but I don't think I laughed at all. A crude movie. I think I said Ewww more than 5 times. Do not watch with kids. This is a movie you won't mind not seeing.After the opening scene I thought maybe it would get a little better. The homeschool scene was a little funny but ended weird. There were some other not so funny scenes.I give props to the directors. So many awesome actors. The movie definitely jumps around and is about nothing inparticular. I could see young adult boys getting a laugh from this movie but as a 31 year old professional business woman it was not my cup of tea. I wonder if redbox has a bad movie refund policy?

reviews.review_title: This movie lives up to the hype... of being bad!
reviews.content: I went into this movie thinking that no movie could be as bad as they say this movie is. Well I was completely utterly incorrect. This movie turned out to be even worse than I thought. It's horrible I read somewhere that they even forced some of the stars to take part in this film. How this film ever got made I don't know. From the opening bit of the movie I could tell that I was in for a long horrible ride. By the end of the first sketch I wondered why in God's name am I watching this? The acting even coming from such A-listers like Hugh Jackman & Kate Winslet was bad (I guess they just wanted to get their scenes over with). I do NOT recommend this movie to anyone, my curiosity got the best of me & yes it is as bad as they say. The only reason I'm giving it two stars is because there was ONE part where I laughed a bit not even much just a little snicker. I repeat STAY AWAY from this film!

This movie was good and bad at the same time for me. Yes agreed some of it wasn't that good but the fact that some other stuff made me shite myself laughing makes up for all of that. I won't tell you which scene cracked me up the most but if you like funky movies you might as well watch it. I dare you to watch it! It is not right to give it a bad review when it made me laugh more than I have in a very long time. I was literally gasping for air at some point. So I want to thank the movie makers for that because that in itself is worth a 6 out of 10. And for all those people that didn't like it... Hey it just wasn't for you. Be thankful that we are not all the same kind of people because the world would be a very boring place if that were the case.

This is a great multi- short story parody that was surprisingly awesome!!!
I really can't believe how anyone could not find this entertaining.

reviews.review_title: This is a great film, expand your minds.
reviews.content: The whole idea with this film, is to push the boundaries of what we think is acceptable. That in itself, is a great goal to have as a film. It not only does so by showing some pretty obscene and ridiculous short clips, but also by its commentary on society in each of its stories. It isn't just a joke. It's not made to only be funny if you have Petter Griffin's humor. This film is supposed to be funny because it's showing us how ridiculous some aspects of life are: the school system, sexism, appearances, habits etc. If you can't see the humor in that, then you probably haven't thought about much in your lifetime, and should just go back to watching something that doesn't require thought. I hope that in time, more people appreciate this film for what it is. And I admire all the actors that took part in this film, for understanding why it's important not to take ourselves so seriously. Lighten up everyone, this film is hilarious and smart.

Its a spoof comedy. And that is all it is. I think all of it was very funny. The one about the black basketball team. The one with the 'dares', and one with Hugh Jackman.All credit goes to the actors - all of them super A listers taking time to do this roller-coaster of a movie. It has all the elements of a spoof comedy. If you like comedy, and if you are not a grouch and you are liberated enough to laugh without any prejudice - then you are going to love the movie. I am sure this is one of the movies I'll watch a second time - next time when I have company to appreciate the full effect of it. iBabe!!

I don't mind crude humor sometimes, tbh I wish I hadn't started it. The only reason I gave this movie a shot was because of the well known actors in it.... I ended up skipping more than half the movie and finding out that some of my favorite actor have starred in the most disgusting, stupid, and horrific movie that I have by far ever encountered. Those actor have not only lost so much respect from me but now every movie I have ever loved them in has been completely wrecked. I don't ever write reviews but I had to make an exception after that heart wrenching experience. There are many things that I regret having ever allowed myself to watch and this just about tops them all.
