reviews.review_title: Do not watch this movie, Only trailor is interesting.
reviews.content: Watched movie coz trailor was interesting, but dropped watching in the middle coz my mind had ride like rolar coaster. Im regretting about this, why did I watch? It's insane.

reviews.review_title: 4.4. Rating made me feel like I couldn't trust IMDb Anymore....
reviews.content: This movie was HILARIOUS,and smart and it run on too long (American Pie?) or yell out really stupid stuff the entire time (Tropic Thunder);then you're like Whatever! You know?.I'm very critical and pessimistic and I watched it twice in a row;THAT's how funny it was....I think low raters were just looking for something different at the time...or haven't watched enough movies.Dennis Quaid being all filthy and weird,the Leprechaun,The Balls joke..If you didn't like how snazzy it was in a way it's likely because you think that your are a rich celeb in your own right or that rich celebs are more responsible for what you know about them than they really are.That's all I have to say about that.

Pathetic, stupid, funny, pointless. So many great moments in this film while also being a complete waste of time. I am confused why so many have said this is the worst film ever because it just isn't. I would also point out it is no way near a 10 either. Listen, this has some cracking jokes which are a bit rude, so what? That is some people want to see. I don't get why there are so many haters reviewing things nowadays. It makes me think social media has gone to everybody's head when actually it is a channel for most people's lack of sociability. I do agree H Berry was embarrassingly miscast in this though, could of picked someone funnier alongside Merchant.

Are you even kidding me with this? This is the most awful movie I have ever seen (if you could even call it a movie)! I can't imagine all those people who worked on this "movie" and all those talented actors who are either a joke or wasted. This "movie" is a shame.

reviews.review_title: Please, someone erase this movie from my brain
reviews.content: This movie truly lacks every item a movie needs to be funny, apparently producers thought that just because something is extremely awkward, st*pid, twisted or weird it's funny. The truth is there are many things or situations under those qualifications that are funny, but this movie didn't include one single bit of that. I regret watching every minute of it. It truly deserves the lowest rating among movies, so I felt complied to contribute.

reviews.review_title: Why is this so hated? I loved this movie
reviews.content: I really did enjoy this movie, so much in fact that i have decided to leave my 1st ever review :) Don't know what there is not to like here, some great actors have some fun and don't take themselves too seriously.I laughed a lot at this film, i think that if you have a Family Guy sense of humour you will enjoy it.Of course there are some sections that are weaker than others, but that is to be expected, not all great comedies are a constant laugh riot, but the flow of the film is pretty good in general.Must also note i saw the British edit of this film which is much different the the US vserion (no pitch here) anyhoo, watch, cringe, try not to be an uptight critic, laugh and enjoy
One of my favorite comedy's. Toilet humor done with some wit!

reviews.review_title: Thought is was a very funny film
reviews.content: I am guessing some of the people who derided this film have never actually watched it, I may be wrong. I thought it was a very funny film and the critics killed it. I'd recommend it to anyone, just give it a try.

reviews.review_title: Only watch this if you are seriously screwed up in the head, like me.
reviews.content:
This movie will probably offend most people. If they aren't offended, then they probably think it's pointless/gratuitous bordering on chaos.
For those of us with a case of the crazies, you'll enjoy this.
Though the true lovers of chaos will still be left wanting in the end.

I just saw the movie and to be honest it is like a drunk writer with a bunch of different scripts decided to mash up all his scripts into one movie that was not very good and apparently has different versions. Its not a movie I would recommend but only some of the clips are worth watching. However, the only story line that was worth watching was the 3 kids searching for a movie that supposedly didn't exist and turns out to actually exist. Maybe the writer should explore some ideas with that short story and then donate whatever he has to a good writer who will turn it into the script of the year. LOL. I can't believe how many famous ppl they got to actually act in this movie, personally I think the one with Hugh Jackman was the funniest.

My husband and I laughed a lot while watching this. Some segments are very funny and others are very dumb. I cannot believe how many famous people that are in this movie. I usually hate stupid movies but this had my attention throughout. Give this movie 30 min.....

reviews.review_title: The First guys on the review have surface level understanding
reviews.content: It's a very VERY excellent movie. Those who says it was awful. They were uhhh like I said "surface level". They have a very low understanding and yet talk really big. Ironic is it not? They overlooked the very purpose of the movie and look only the physical means and I must say, they haven't really notice at all at least one message of the MOvie43. They talk like critics but thinks like one midschool kids. sorry not sorry but it is the ugly truth. They haven't notice how they were mislead by the story and not being able to predict the ending(which is one characteristics great movies have in common)and how they do such an epic plot twist not to mention those brilliant artist who participated on this movie. For all those who read this, See for yourself and observe how the thumbs up and thumbs down reviewers look through this brilliant movie .

Whomever watched this movie and did not enjoy it is a clear no-drugs-ever kinda person or plain and simple too serious or old for this kinda humour...definitely a stoner movie,its freaking hilarious!The cast where all amazing and its sad it got so many raspberry awards cause people didnt get that kinda humour,kinda funny and sarcastic it got so many raspberry awards,because really?It so bad you absolutely love it!Personally consider it one of the funniest movies I've ever seen even after all these years but only for those with a more rowdy kinda way,humour etc...

reviews.review_title: Not entirely sure what I just watched
reviews.content: While I certainly give the writers credit for creativity, I'm fairly confident this film shouldn't even be considered a movie. A series of skits, ranging from a man with a scrotum on his chin engaging in a blind date, to a basketball coach confidently explaining to his all black team that they can win because they are black, the film captures a passerby's curiosity without fulfilling it. There is little to no substance, with zero plot, but it is mildly amusing throughout the entirety of the film and benefits from the variety brought on by the abundance of skits. It has its merits, but is not more valuable than series of amusing youtube videos as a replacement.

Congratulations to everyone involved. Perhaps one of the funniest movies out there due to the pure insanity of it all.
1 star - #1

Black humour at its best.I like how some people think that this movie is stupid.Creating this type of creative nonsense takes talent and greate sense of humour.And seeing megastars acting here makes it even better.

reviews.review_title: Funniest movie I've seen in years
reviews.content: I must admit i started watching this not knowing what i was watching, and at first i didn't really think i was going to enjoy it, but stick with it folks,it gets better and better. Big name stars appear throughout and once you get the idea of the movie, and relax you will if you have any sense of humor in you at all find parts of this movie hilarious, i know i did. My favourite part is the Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant truth or dare skit, which was Brillllliant! You rarely get a film with a cast list that reads like this one, so they must have thought it was good, just don't take the world so seriously for the 90 mins its on and you'll love it, Watch it and see for yourself.

reviews.review_title: Learn what a fairy does for Leprechaun gold
reviews.content: A throwback to the craziness of the good ol' 1970's film, Kentucky Fried Movie. It's greatness lies in how awful Movie 43 is. It is not easy making a bad film that's so good. Yes, it's not a ten, nor a nine or a eight, BUT it's quite entertaining, especially if you don't feign offense at some of the humor, which you will most likely do if you watch this film with other humans. Due to this, I recommend watching this film by yourself or with any of your friends whom love Blazing Saddles . . . or Kentucky Fried Movie. The famous actors in this film get it, you should lighten up and get it too. Why would they purposely place themselves in a horrible film? They've read the script. It's because they're risk takers and that's what makes this film awesome. Again, not a 10 awesome, but a 7 kind of awesome.

I consider movies in two categories. You have the overall scale, which this movie would only get a four in, and then you have the entertainment scale, which I think would earn this flick a six. The difference is in the fact that this is not a typical film; it has a little story progression, though it is truly more a series of sketches. The humor is purposefully "crude" and it pushes at the viewer's tolerance for indecency. Such issues as the awkwardness of first dates, addressing peculiar desires in the bedroom, and boundaries of a company's take on the old "sex sells" motto and pet / owner relationships are about half of the topics addressed, all in a raunchy, offensively comedic manner. Certainly not everyone's cup of tea, I none-the-less found it funny, and though at the beginning I wanted to close my eyes from sheer embarrassment, I realized that my reaction was what the movie intended. Do not watch this film if your desire is to see a favorite actor or actress, as they are all absurdly out of their normal character, parodies really, but give it a chance if you've ever thought that an SNL skit was funny, or if you can laugh at an exploding colostomy bag. Just keep in mind that though the circumstances might be bizarre, every joke has a nugget of truth, and in order to enjoy this movie, one has to see the word "nugget", and think "poop", which should then inspire laughter. If it doesn't, this movie is probably not for you.

I was just so curious and that's why I went to see this movie. It was outrageous (to put it mildly) and it made me laugh because I was so shocked at how outrageous it was. But if you're looking to see a classic movie or something out of this world, what with all the big names in the movie, you'd be disappointed. I would not totally trash it since at least it got me laughing. But I tell you, it was the silliest, most meaningless movie I've ever seen in my life. Oh, and at some point I found myself waking up from a short nap while in the theater. Can you believe I slept off?! In summary, its up to anyone to make up their mind if they want to see it out of curiosity or just to see it in error.

reviews.review_title: Hilarious... Especially if you have a sense of humor
reviews.content: This movie is seriously underrated. It's hilarious! I laugh every time I watch it.. Hoping it being on Netflix will bring in some new fans.

If you're not laughing your ass off through the first 15 minutes then just shut it down, it's not for you. For me. I had to pause several moments just to compose myself. Does it make sense? Nope. Is it just a sit back and have to think too much and have a great time. Yes. Don't take it serious. Just enjoy.

Forget the granular analysis, the nuances of each performer. I didn't know what to expect especially with the 4.4 (currently) rating. I laughed out loud pretty much through the whole thing. I wondered how they were going to top the first story! I wasn't disappointed. Each and every actor who took part in the project is a good sport! Put down your journal, grab some popcorn and enjoy the ride!Crass? Yes! Irreverent? Yes! If you're expecting Gone with the Wind, look elsewhere. This is a park-your-brain comedy fest. I would suggest the unrated version. Just when you think it can't go any lower, it does. I especially liked the out takes. You can tell the cast and crew enjoyed making this one.

reviews.review_title: "Worst movie I've ever seen", are you serious???
reviews.content: I see a lot of reviews here saying "Worst movie I've ever seen", what the hell? Really?? Worst movie you have seen, how many movies have you seen, like three? There's no way this is the worst movie that anybody has seen, I mean, have you seen, for example, Jack and Jill from Adam Sandler? Don't get me wrong, I love Adam, but "Jack and Jill" is an example of a bad movie and a bad comedy, and there're thousands more. So you are saying that movies like "Jack and Jill" are better than this?? If you are saying so, don't waste your time seeing comedies anymore, your sense of humor is wasted. Movie 43 is funny as hell, if you didn't laugh with this movie, either you didn't get the jokes, or you sense of humor is waaaay wrong. Sorry about my english, but I couldn't stand this ridiculous reviews. If you wanna have some laughs, and if you liked movies like The Onion Movie (great one!), whatch this one, it is GREAT!

In one word, Brilliant. This is without a doubt the most over the top movie I have watched in a very long time. The humor is childish and grotesque, But i still loved it. I just sad with a giggle for 90 mins and had some good laugh on the way. And that's the point. Most of these reviews complaint that there is no story line and no plot to the movie. DUH, that is the point. It's like watching 10 lame videos on YouTube combined into one. If you want a movie that doesn't require a lot of thinking afterwards and is not easily offended (like most people in these reviews) then this is a movie for you :) Would watch again. PS. combine it with a couple of beers, i'm sure that would make it even funnier

reviews.review_title: Not as bad as everyone says...
reviews.content: I had originally seen a trailer for this before some movie, and essentially thought, "I'll definitely make sure to not see that one". But in one of my 2nd movie of the night moments on Netflix, and after a particularly long day where I was hoping for a good laugh, I put on Movie 43.I think it's pretty damn funny actually. It's stupid comedy kinda for a lot of it, but tons of comedy is simplistic. If that's a metric for saying it's bad, it's a hypocritical one. Obviously humor is subjective though. One of the other things I dig about the movie is the shear amount of famous actors and actresses in it, many of which are doing roles you'd never imagine them stooping too, and it kind of makes me like them more. With putting in a spoiler, the opening skit with Hugh Jackman hits that one right on the head.So anyway, I'm not saying I died laughing, but once I saw this got nominated to The Razzies and I like at it's fellow companion film that were all HORRIBLE I think people need to cut this movie some slack. I laughed out loud several times.

reviews.review_title: it's not as bad as most people said
reviews.content: i thought this is meant to be funny? this movie is a rare occasion in which all stars can be so tacky. it's almost like a excuse for them, to be part of a funny 'thing', the ones you do with your friends simply because you find it fun. true, they get paid; but that doesn't mean 'having fun' isn't a factor they considered. as a movie, it kinda sucks, because its lack of structure; but it sure got a few good jokes in it. i read an article (by Bud Ming)talking about films that some people find offensive/tacky. the author described them as 'Junk Food'. we all know chips are junk food, but we'll still have them sometime. the reason? you like the taste of it! Same here, sometimes we are tired, and would like to loosen up; our choices are probably jut some pointless movies, and get things out of our mind.will i recommend to others? maybe. i think it's really funny, but pointless and lack of structure; so watch it when you simply need a laugh.(spoiler)i like the part where basketball players gathered in the locker room. the coach, instead of telling sort of cliché lines you see in other films(though said by the players), he told the 'truth'; somehow i find it more amusing.

I found this to be a great movie if you are a fan of Robot Chicken. To me this was just live Robot Chicken and I did find it to be quite funny. Its interesting in life how its funny if, a cartoon or stop motion animation goes a bit to far we all laugh but if its live action it loses its humor. To me it looked like most of the actors actually had fun making this. The sketch with Anna Faris actually had my wife in pain from laughing so hard. The Tampon sketch I almost wet myself a little. The sketch with Knoxville and Sean William Scott had us both laughing out loud. I found a few of the sketches to be a bit Meeeh but over all this film gave my wife and I quite a few laughs.
Lots of bad reviews so I guess it isn't for everyone, but I found this movie to be absolutely hilarious.

reviews.review_title: Funniest Movie I've seen in Awhile
reviews.content: Five or six shorts that will leave you pee you pants laughing, provided you're not easily offended. If that is who you are watch Titanic again.

reviews.review_title: Irreverent and beautiful, a film for the Hollywood cynic.
reviews.content: Movie 43, it's not a good film. Will it be a cult favorite in the future, maybe. I feel what it is wasn't intentional, and applaud it reservedly. I can only serve a subjective response.As a theatrical release, it fails on so many key aspects. Movie goers as a whole, could not have been expected to like this. Critics would have certainly been expected to pan this. That said, I'm unclear of the motives behind all involved in developing such a train-wreck.It's an amusing experience for the open minded. As the story goes, pretty much all of the actors were either guilted or coerced into participating. That in and of itself is pure gold. Knowing this before hand is not critical to enjoyment, but for those sick of the celebrity treatment it is paramount.Not one bit is a clever execution of comedy, each story seems a rather daft exploitation of it's talent. The shock value comes from witnessing A-list celebrities performing as the trained show monkeys they really are. This is where the magic happens, at least for the cynical who are sick of the shlock of Hollywood productions these days.Would I recommend Movie 43 for everyone? Certainly not. For those who find entertainment in the "so bad, it's good" type of cinema, one viewing wouldn't be a complete waste of time.

Filthy, trashy, and vulgar high school humor. I think that was the whole intent, because it turned out to be pretty creative and funny. It's meant to be a parody of some of the dumber movies, ads, and ideas that have come out of Hollywood over the years. It's obviously not politically correct or sensitive and will offend a lot of people. This movie came out over a decade ago. I am pretty sure that this movie could not be produced today, in 2023. Back then you could get away with a lot of things that are deemed offensive and unacceptable today. But remember, this is really a purely 
 satirical product. Anyway, if you want to go back in your time machine, have thicker skin, want to watch some politically incorrect toilet humor, you might enjoy watching these series of skits that are lumped into one movie.
There are several skits that are the funniest I've ever seen.  It's really really out there and cringy but absolutely hilarious.

In film making, to break the rules is the key to create amazing new experimental products. Ultimately, it is the freedom of the film maker to bend and break the laws. Movie 43 is an experimental comedy movie containing a couple of short films, some are curious and watchable, some don't make any sense. At the end of the day, you wonder what was it all about.
Incredible movie, truly a piece of cinematic history. Should be considered a classic. Recommend watching it with friends and/or family. Suitable for every age.

I first heard of this back around the time it was being made or released and then I forgot about.  Fast forward six years and I am loading up my ‘favorites' list ONDEMAND with movies I've never seen or not seen in awhile.  After a year or two of waiting to be watched, it finally came on which means I didn't have to make the decision to watch it other than punch the channel number into the remote because I refuse to talk to my remote.  So, finally, I get to see ‘Movie 43' AND give it a review...

A loose satire of internet porn sites, it‘s a series of unrelated short clips covering everything from testicular misplacement, flamboyant child abuse, incest, defecation fetish, dirty talk fetish, sex dolls, cosplay, child labor, genital mutilation, torture, menstruation, blood, leprechauns, sex faeries, truth or dare, bbc, cartoon bestiality, to internet porn.  I have never had more of a headache or felt as physically ill watching a movie as I was while watching this.  It's actually a fairly competent and coherent satire but it made me physically ill, I did want to turn it off after 15 minutes, I was relieved when it was over and do not plan to ever watch it again.
Absolutely a great film... better if stoned! Solid 10/10!

I love 'over the top' humor. The more outrageous... the better. I want a comedy movie to be in terrible taste. That said, this movie kinda sucks. Yes, it's way outside the bounds of good taste (hooray!) BUT It's too freaking JUVENILE (boo!). The jokes are like what my friends and I laughed at when we were kids. A girl getting her first period and staining the sofa just ain't funny. To be fair, I laughed about three times - one laugh every half hour - way too low. The rest of the time, I wondered how they got A-list Hollywood stars to play straight men/women in this silly production. This movie had the on screen talent to be a new Airplane! It's too bad it lacked experienced, clever, and imaginative writers.

It attempts to be Kentucky Fried Movie, or something own this genre, but it is not.   The most I could muster from this film was an occasional smile-but not enough to amount to anything.   Skip this.   It is a waste of time and money.
Seriously so funny. The skits are over the top and really entertaining. I think people are taking it too seriously, it's light and funny and worth a watch!

Hugh Jackman has genitals on his neck. That's the entire segment. A teenage boy is abused by his parents. That's the entire segment. Coprophilia. That's the entire segment. At that point I turned it off. There's no humour here, no development, just one bad idea per scene going nowhere and being unpleasant.

I have to admit that I chuckled a lot more at Movie 43 than I do most stand-up comedies and practically all Saturday Night Live episodes I've ever seen. I'm often exasperated at the 55 minutes of filler SNL shoves into a 90-minute show. And the majority of that remaining "good" time accounts for commercials, too.

There's a lot of tasteless humor in Movie 43. As a film, I don't think it's very good; as a bunch of bit pieces, there are some things that made me laugh.

How absurd, "Movie 43" is a cinematic shame, you can't believe that names like Kate Winslet, Hugh Jackman, Chris Pratt, Anna Faris, Emma Stone, Julianne Moore, Richard Gere, Naomi Watts and Chloe Grace Moretz wanted to expose themselves so much  tragically to ridicule, fortunately some of those involved managed to surrender to good roles after that shit.

I like the blemish on that perfect man, it looked so special...but i don't like the dates.

"Movie 43" is one of the best comedies I have ever seen. I have found it because I was looking through the cast, as I was amazed of how many good actors took part in it, as well as I have went through reviews and seen that most of them talk about how disgusting the movie is, so I have decided to check it out and I was not disappointed! The only scene that was not really funny was with Chris Pratt, as you could see how silly it is and how it desperately tries to push out at least some kind of a joke, but otherwise, all the other scenes are brilliant. I found myself laughing at nearly every single phrase someone said. Yes, it may seem gross for someone, but who said that gross can't be funny? I just believe that many people lie about their perception of this movie, just so that they could look smarter in everybody else's eyes. I believe that it is just a tradition at this point for people to leave a bad review about this movie, without even seeing it. There were so many memes about this movie just some 10 years ago and I clearly remember them. Most of the scenes are iconic, especially Halle Berry plastic surgery and Hugh Jackman nutsack. The plot starts off not very entertaining, as you await it's silliness, but afterwards it skyrockets you into the darkest humor possible. A very strong, very brave comedy analogue of which you will never find ever again. It is still a mystery on how so many good actors agreed on taking part in such a stupid movie with such a low budget. Definitely worth checking this out, an 8/10, still relevant, still hilarious.

Omnibus films featuring big names can work as long as the product works well, but Movie 43 fails as it combines the series of shorts into one narrative. There are two versions of the film: One takes place in a producer's conference and the other takes place at a teenager's home before an apocalypse. Some segments have missing payoffs like the one where a grocery clerk Neil (Kiernan Culkin) falls in love with Veronica (Emma Stone) or Batman (Jason Sedakis) giving dating advice to Robin (Justin Long). Others, like the one where Beth (Kate Winslet) goes on a date with millionaire Davis (Hugh Jackman), the one where Amanda (Chloe Moretz) experiences her first menstrual cycle, and the one where a man (Chris Pratt) takes laxatives to show his love for his fiancée (Anna Faris) are just an excuse to throw out gross-out jokes. Meanwhile, it throws in socio-political commentary in these sketches, like the sexist ad executive (Richard Gere) pitching the product iBabe to his staff or the 1950's coach (Terrence Howard) teaching the first all-black basketball team. However, other segments are okay, like the game of truth of dare between Stephen Merchant and Halle Berry, the one featuring a gay cartoon cat or a birthday present involving a leprechaun (Gerard Butler). You know your project is in trouble when you title it Movie 43 because these rejected CollegeHumor sketches seem like they were filmed before the producers came up with the title. It especially doesn't work when they bookend these vignettes with a lazy and last minute narrative. I do not object to shock and gross-out comedy, in fact, as a teen, I watched a good chunk of lowbrow shows like "Robot Chicken" and "Family Guy." Whereas those were handled with contextual intelligence, Movie 43 is a limp, desperate attempt from over fifteen directors to throw every adult humor on the screen resulting in a giant mess. (1 ½ Balls on Chins out of 5)

The 'has-been' film-maker (Dennis Quaid) swindles his way into an interview with a film executive (Greg Kinnear) in order to pitch an outrageous and controversial comedy manuscript. After pitching the first of his thirteen offbeat fables, the dejected artist forces the rest of his disjointed allegory on the executive at gunpoint...

"Movie 43" was panned by critics, with Richard Roeper calling it "the Citizen Kane of awful", joining others who labeled it as one of the worst films of all time. The film won three awards at the 34th Golden Raspberry Awards, including Worst Picture. Rotten Tomatoes consensus states: "A star-studded turkey, Movie 43 is loaded with gleefully offensive and often scatological gags, but it's largely bereft of laughs." IGN's Gregg Katzman gave the film a 1/10, with the main criticisms being its unfunny jokes and the waste of its all star cast, and the only positive being its sub two hour running time. It would go on to tie with Scary Movie 5 for worst movie of 2013. In his guest review for Roger Ebert's website, Richard Roeper of the Chicago Sun-Times outright panned the film, giving it zero out of four stars, calling it "aggressively tasteless", and going so far as to say "Movie 43 is the Citizen Kane of awful". He wrote that the film has nothing in common with The Groove Tube and The Kentucky Fried Movie, two "very funny and influential" sketch-comedy films. He additionally criticized Movie 43 for what he calls "female humiliation", saying that although the men are "jerks, idiots, dolts and fools", the women have it even worse. Robbie Collin of The Daily Telegraph described Farrelly's film as "the work of a confused man thrashing around in an industry he no longer understands". Peter Howell of the Toronto Star gave the film zero out of four stars and called it the worst film he had ever seen. Elizabeth Weitzman of the New York Daily News gave it a negative review, saying, "As a film critic, I've seen nearly 4,000 movies over the last fifteen years. Right now, I can't think of one worse than Movie 43."

"Movie 43" (The title of the film has no actual meaning to it) was filmed over a span of four years. Production took so long because filming had to be done around the actors' busy schedules. Not screened in advance for critics, because Rouge Pictures was afraid of bad reviews making audiences miss the film. The film was ultimately considered as one of the worst films ever made. But, no.... "Movie 43" is a disaster from all angles. I simply can´t describe it nor understand it. It´s just offensive, stupid, unfunny and pointless.

GREG: (Greg Smith, Founder of Agile Writers of Richmond, VA) Just in time for the new year, it s Movie 43!

SCOTT: (Dr. Scott Allison, Professor of Psychology, University of Richmond) And what a way to recover from Christmas. Deck the halls with bowels of holly.

GREG: Movie 43 almost defies explanation. It is an anthology of sixteen (16!) different storylines. Each one raunchier and more ridiculous than the last. The running gag in the movie is that each scene is actually a pitch for a movie idea by struggling screenwriter Charlie Wessler (Dennis Quaid). He s holding a movie producer Griffin Schraeder (Greg Kinear) hostage forcing him to listen to each and every story idea, regardless of how horrible it may be.

SCOTT: And man, are the stories horrible.  And dumb, and ultra-vulgar.  At gunpoint, Schraeder brings Wessler s movie idea to the studios chief executive, who ridicules and embarrasses Schraeder.  To get even, Schraeder decides to invest huge resources into the film, knowing it will cost the movie studio millions.

GREG: I don t think we ll have time to review all the stories here. But to give you an idea, the first one deals with a woman (Kate Winslet) on a blind date with a surprisingly eligible bachelor (Hugh Jackman). The only problem: he has testicles on his chin and nobody but she seems to notice. Then there s the one where a girlfriend (Anna Faris) is so in love with her boyfriend (Chris Pratt) that she wants him to poop on her chest. He, in his desire to do the deed properly, eats enormous amounts of Indian food and overdoses on laxatives. The end result is the most massive explosion of diarrhea in film history.

SCOTT: Yes.  For this scene, I thank the makers of this film from the bottom of my.... well, from my bottom. The premise of Movie 43 pretty much guarantees the movies failure.  We know that Wessler s ideas are terrible as he is pitching them to Schraeder, and yet 95% of Movie 43 is spent showing these bad ideas in their full, ahem, glory.  At one point, Wessler suggests that Kate Winslet play the role of the chin-balls  date, to which Schraeder points out that Winslet would never agree to such a role.  But in this movie, where ridiculous reigns supreme, Winslet does indeed play this character. Movie 43 is full of hits and misses, and unfortunately, the ratio of hits to misses is about 1 to 4.  Much of the content of the skits is revolting and bloated with shock value.  Nothing is sacred here.  Jokes about incest, menstruation, and feces abound.  The more outrageous, the better.  In any bad movie, vulgarity is a proxy for good writing, and that s certainly true here.

GREG: Movie 43 comes to us from Peter Farrelly of the Farrelly Brothers (who brought us last years The Three Stooges). The Farrellys are known for their low-brow humor and Movie 43 seals that reputation. This is the worst movie ever - but that is what it is aiming for. Many of the actors originally slated to be in the film found a way to opt-out. It took nearly 10 years to bring the whole picture together as reluctant luminaries were brought in to fulfill their obligations. There is no rhyme nor reason to these vignettes. Although I get the impression that several of them were actual movie synopses that were turned down. If you like Saturday Night Live, you just might like Movie 43. However watching 90 minutes of SNL rejects may be more than you can take. Still, knowing is half the battle. I found Movie 43 delivered on its promise to be lewd, crude, and indecent. And I respect that. I give Movie 43 1 Reel out of 5. No heroes were harmed in the making of Movie 43 so I award it 0 Heroes out of 5. Movie: Hero:

SCOTT: Anthology movies rarely work because there is insufficient time to develop characters and storylines.  Each story is reduced to a single thematic gimmick that is milked for about 5 or 10 minutes and then runs out of steam.  And if the gimmick is truly dumb to begin with, 5 or 10 minutes feels like forever.  The iBabe story is an example of a bad idea that went nowhere.  It s one long sexual joke dragged out to 10 minutes.  Ugh.  Then theres the aforementioned defecation story.  While the idea of pooping on someone is shocking and perhaps even mildly funny, we re subjected to this fecal theme for 10 tortuous minutes.  No thank you. Movie 43 is 90 minutes of shocking attempts at humor that are clever at times but miss the mark far too often.  The conflict between Schraeder and Wessler was uninteresting and served as a bad, bad excuse to film so many truly tasteless mini-stories.  Like you, Greg, I award Movie 43 just 1 measly Reel, with the film on the reel donated to the exploding-bowel man to use as toilet paper.  There were no heroes here, only victims.  And so zero Heroes out of 5 from me, too.

Underutilising its ensemble cast, Movie 43 has some laughs (The skits with Robin speed-dating and Anna Faris wanting Chris Pratt to poop on her are the skits that actually work) but is ultimately not a good movie. The UK version has an occasionally clever way to connect the skits together but ultimately this film is a piece of crap. The jokes are so offensive they're disturbing (at least Kate Winslet displayed self-awareness of Hugh Jackman's creepy testicle-chin), the scripts are bad, the humour will make you groan and facepalm and the stories that revolve around each skit are offensive, implausible and unoriginal. Not every skit was earth shattering, but there were some brilliant points to be made here!  Absurd: of course!  How else to treat some of the most absurd parts of our accepted culture but with an equal dose of absurdity!  Brilliantly poignant! Perhaps especially the iBabe, Homeschooled, and Middleschool Date (menstruation) skits, for their jab at the mindless, pathological corporatization of our lives, our brutal institutionalized education system, and misogyny, respectively! Some very funny moments to boot -- assuming you don't take yourself and life too seriously...

The Catch, admittedly, had me a little unnerved, which is great! Hard to do with something so basically banal.  Nicely done.  And a little insightful social commentary to boot.

Propositioned was ok.  But maybe you can see here, more than anywhere, how this movie was targeted to the mainest of the main stream. And that's it's biggest flaw: that "underground" themes were presented to the masses.  If it's not Marvel or DC, so we don't want it.

Veronica was ok.

Super Hero Dating:  This was just some good old SNL fun!

Machine Kids: Felt disturbed. Powerful!  Loved it!  Kid with tear running down her face: brutal!

Happy Birthday (the leprechaun): meh.

Truth or Dare: not bad. A few good laughs. Nice light social commentary.  (mind you, blowing out blind kid's candles: brilliant!)

Victory's Glory: Some good hard laughs on this one!  Good social commentary too.  The final free throw was nice touch!

Beezel: no social commentary, but another good one for SNL...

But seeing all these people in this movie, I'm convinced this was someone calling in a favor. Maybe it was like the nephew of a distribution company. 

The plot is about as lazy as you can get for a movie. A crazed Dennis Quaid is pitching these rejected MadTV sketches to Greg Kinnear. Forcing Kinnear to listen at gunpoint, until some little moment between Kinnear and Common becomes the focus of the plot. The end of the movie becomes the "a movie about filming a movie" trope, someone yells cut and then it just kind of ends. But then there's another short. And then it ends.

Everyone of the shorts is directed by someone else. So there is zero continuity in between any of the scenes. Yes, by the movie's standard, this is a crazy person writing these, but actually it is not because they break fourth wall at the end. So Quaid isn't actually crazy, they are filming a movie in which Quaid plays a crazy person. So what's the point of that? To tell you that you watched shitty comedic sketches for an hour all because it was a dream...er....it was all a movie? Boo.

All these shorts reminded me of horrible improv scenes. The scene between Knoxville and Stiffler is the one that comes to mind. The scene starts with these guys as bros who live together. Knoxville apologizes for fucking Stiffler's girlfriend. Then Knoxville makes a joke about his apology. But this douchebag has a surprise for Stiffler. Knoxville captured a leprechaun for Stiffler so he could have the best birthday ever. This is going to be the best day ever. WOOOOO. 

Pretty much every other skit was the same. But let's not skip over some important cinematic performances. For example, Hugh Jackman having CGI balls on his neck and Kate Winslet agreeing to be in a scene where Hugh Jackman has balls for chins. There was Halle Berry smashing guacamole with her tit and Stephen Merchant becoming a racist asian stereotype. There was the  cartoon cat that wanted to fuck Josh Duhamel. 

Even when there were laughs, the scene would go an extraordinary length to kill its own joke. Terrance Howard is a coach of an all black basketball team in the 1950s. The whole joke is that the students are unsure of their skills as this is the first white team they are playing, and basically Terrance Howard is just reinforcing the stereotype that black people can outball white people. Okay concept, but this sketch lasted so long. This reminded me of a reject Chappelle show sketch. 

Every scene of this movie is offensive. Whether it be because of how offensively stereotypical or juvenile the comedy is, or just how lazy the dialog or the filming is.

I'm just gonna be honest: I did chuckle for a couple times in the movie, but DAMN, this is AWFUL. To me, 43 is not a movie. If you ask me what Movie 43 is about, I don't know how to answer. All I can say is that Movie 43 has a bunch of funny (sometimes it isn't even funny) YouTube clips played by stars all combined into a full-length movie. 
	First of all, I would rather watched a bunch of videos on YouTube that I would enjoy rather than watching this. Each clip in Movie 43 has nothing to do with one another, not even a link. All it gives you is a crappy premise that a bunch of ass-kids are finding Movie 43 and that it will end the world. Seriously, nothing makes sense in this movie. It involves time traveling, apocalypse, and explosions that will just leave you thinking WTF. 
	One thing that I hated the most is that how did so many celebrities ended up in this movie? In the first clip, Kate Winslet is having a dinner date with Hugh Jackman who got balls hanging on his chin. C'mon Hollywood, having an Oscar- nominated actor and an Oscar winning actress in this garbage isn't a good idea. All I can say is that Hugh Jackman does have balls taking this role.
Basically, each clip after the first one is either the same level with the first or even worse. I might even considering the first one as one of the funnier ones. Later in the movie, you got Naomi Watts and Leiv Schreiber humiliating their homeschooling son, Chris Pratt shitting on Anna Faris, Johnny Knoxville and Seann William Scott kidnapping Leprechauns for gold coins, and Halle Berry making guacamole with her boobs.
 That's all you got from Movie 43 and now I spoiled it so that you won't have to see this movie. You're going to thank me later. Just sayin'.

One of the worst movies I've ever seen. A colossal embarrassment. Awful. Disastrous. Humiliating. What's the funniest scene? Is it when Hugh Jackman has testicles under his chin? Or when Chloe Grace Moretz periods herself across a wall? Or when Chris Pratt tries to poop on Anna Faris? Shame. I'm not at all surprised that many of the actors have refused to participate in the promotion for Movie 43.

Movie 43 is worth watching simply for the commitment to a bit.  These are master class performances, shoved into some of the most tasteless sketches I've ever seen in a mainstream movie.  It's also quite obvious that there's an element of satire going on here, making fun of sports movies, dumb male humor, gross out humor, and anything else mainstream America eats up.  And yet, mainstream America hated this movie, which just goes to show that we like our humor neither too stupid or too smart, but juuuuust stupid enough.

Words cannot describe how bad "Movie 43" is and I am offended that it even exists.  It is literally intended to be the worst movie ever made.  The story is about a desperate writer pitching the worst movie idea ever and forcing a studio executive to listen under gunpoint.  Each segment is worse than the last with their themes of violence, extreme bathroom humor, immorality, and things too explicit to discuss in this review.  It amazes me that thirteen directors managed to create such a distasteful series of shorts.  You would have to consider this an anti-movie without an ounce of entertainment value.  It is criminal that they were able to get the following list of stars to appear:
Dennis Quaid, Greg Kinnear, Seth MacFarlane (well, no surprise there), Hugh Jackman, Kate Winslet, Naomi Watts, Liev Schreiber, Anna Faris, Chris Pratt, Emma Stone, Justin Long, Jason Sudeikis, Uma Thurman, Kristen Bell, Richard Gere, Kate Bosworth, Jack McBrayer, Chloë Grace Moretz, Patrick Warburton, leprechaun Gerard Butler, Johnny Knoxville (again, no surprise), Seann William Scott, Halle Berry, Terrence Howard, Elizabeth Banks
Reading this cast list, you have to wonder how they could combine for such an unpleasant filmgoing experience.  The pointless 90 minutes of crude, obscene, offensive material drags on and on without reprieve.  Some of the actors tried to get out of it but they were stuck.  I watched this film out of curiosity, having developed an appreciation for terrible movies like "Birdemic" over the years.  This is not like that.  Instead of it being so bad that it is entertaining, "Movie 43" is so bad that it will make you question whether you want to watch another movie ever again.

I have seen a lot of bad of bad movies in my life (from Battlefield Earth to The Garbage Pail Kids to Plan 9 From Outer Space). However, none of those movies come close to the mind-numbingness, atrociousness, and god-awfulness of Movie 43. For the ones who seen this movie, I feel your pain. For the ones who did not see this movie, thank god for you. However, I am going to explain the plot (if you want to call it a plot). 

It is basically follows a mad producer (Dennis Quaid) who pitches his ideas to a executive producer (Greg Kinnear) who is put into gun point because he did not want to put his ideas into film. The ideas is basically of shorts including Hugh Jackman and Kate Winslet going on a date and Winslet sees Jackman with a set of privates hanging from his chin. And Terrence Howard is lecturing his team on how they going to beat this white team because they are black. And the movie also have little informercials (if you want to call them informercials). And there ten or maybe eleven skits that I did not. Why? Because they are not worth for me to mention.

Well, Movie 43 is easily one of the of the worst movies in recent memory. It is so baffling that a "movie" like this gets made and release into theaters for everybody to see. The segments, skits, shorts, or whatever you want to call them (if you seen the movie). They are not funny what so ever. The only funny (or somewhat funny) skit, segment, short, and etc. in Movie 43 is (the one that I just mention) the one with Terrence Howard. Yes, it goes to racial stereotyping but it is the one that made me laugh or chuckle. The worst goes to the one involving Josh Duhamel having a cartoon cat who falls in love with him and is coming between Duhamel and Elizabeth Banks (who is one of the directors sadly).

Another thing that is baffling about Movie 43 besides it has been in production for 3-4 years is the fact that there is such much talent wasted and embarrassing themselves. Most of them were nominated for or won an Oscar or maybe an Academy. It is such a shame that Movie 43 could have been decent or a guilty pleasure but it is not. If anyone have any common sense, please avoid Movie 43 like the plague. It is a waste of time, money, and talent. You will be upset like I was.

Not every vignette is comedy gold (Hugh jackman's sketch was unwatchable, and the truth or dare sketch was arguably worse), but there's social commentary throughout. whether it's how big movie studios throw money and garbage movies without caring (Greg kinear's Howard the duck reference was a meta explanation of movie 43), how girls are forced to learn about their bodies in a male-centered society, or the idiocy of the consumer populace, this movie had something to say. maybe ive looked far too deeply into this as a way to rationalize the 97 minutes of poop and gore I watched, but good or bad it's worth a watch.

A horrifyingly terrible misfire with so much talent yet so little laughs and fun. Movie 43 is a cautionary tale on the disastrous results of an overly ambitious project.

Some have suggested that it's intentionally awful, that it's some sort of meta-essay deconstructing Hollywood tropes. There is some credence to that argument - the film itself is about two friends searching for the worst movie ever made, known only as Movie 43. While they might have just found it, the hard truth is that it's not funny. I did laugh once, at Stephen Merchant.

This is not a good movie. I will admit that I laughed a few times at this. The shock value of the jokes is effective sometimes, and the humor mainly came from when there was a character that recognized how terrible the things the happened were. Their reactions were often funny and I could relate to them. However, all the jokes are so gross or lazy that I honestly felt disgusted with myself for liking them, and that's not a good feeling. Most of the time it wasn't funny anyway.

Being a collection of skits has some positives, but mostly negatives. A lot of comedies suffer from being able to be funny at first, but lose steam as things progress. By breaking it up into many stories, had the jokes been good, the writers wouldn't have had to ignore a lack of jokes for the sake of moving the plot forward. It mostly sucks though that there's no time to build up lasting, memorable characters, and that there's little sense of progression. I honestly liked the overreaching plot that tied the skits together and wished they saw it through to the end instead of doing that lame fourth-wall joke.

So, I watched Movie 43. Yes, I know. I had read some pretty scathing reviews from the entire universe and the film had been critically trashed. And I get it. The gags are obvious and childish and vulgar. The acting, especially considering the pedigree, is somewhat static in that nothing ever evolves. And all in all, the direction of everyone involved is simply rendered moot. Plainly put: this is not a well made film. And yet, I still felt like it retained some of the aesthetic of regular Hollywood comedies. I sat through the whole thing and you know what? I laughed. It was just so ironic that these sublime actors were in such a ridiculously awful film. Somehow that made it better. At about this point in my review I have about 98% of the world at my house with pitchforks and torches. But, and I know this is actually off putting for many of you, it seemed like they were all having fun. Nobody seemed stressed or anxious. I just don't think it's one of the worst films ever, although please don't think I'm arguing the opposite. Up there with catwoman, batman and robin and transformers films? I simply don't think so. It's actually weird, because these are usually films I despise with every bone in my body and it gave me good reason to as well. Yet something kept me glued to the screen.....................perhaps I have turned over to the Dark Side of the force?

Some of the shock-humor could have actually registered a laugh or two if there were the slightest momentary bits of elevation but every single sketch, and the central "story" hub leaves the viewer's sense of humor feeling raped and intelligence grossly insulted. A gross-out comedy starring the likes of Bob Odenkirk, Patrick Warburton, Matt Walsh, Tony Shalhoub, Stephen Merchant, Elizabeth Banks, Halle Berry, Anna Faris, Stiffler, Johnny Knoxville, Chris Pratt, Uma Thurman, McLovin, Naomi Watts, Julianne Moore, Richard Gere, Hugh Jackman, and Kate Winslet directed by Peter Farrelly (There's Something About Mary, Dumb and Dumber, Me, Myself and Irene) must be fantastic, correct?! Wrong. I watched the European cut of this anthology which is hemmed together by a story of three teen boys searching for "Movie 43" online, supposedly pestilent for society if viewed by anyone. The trio end up watching all these dumb clips, the only two of which that caused me the slightest chuckle were the superhero speed dating scene and the blind date scene (there were a lot of date scenes, for whatever reason). So, the infamous Movie 43 has come and gone, won worst picture at the Razzies, and generally humiliated all who were involved with it. So the question for many readers may be, "Is it really that bad?" Well, after seeing it I can only answer yes, sort of. While Movie 43 is a terrible film that is unfunny, filled with occasionally offensive and embarrassing humor, the honest truth is that despite expectations, there are far worse films out there. I have ended films angry and I have ended films endlessly bored. I ended this film neither. I think if I ever made a worst films ever list this wouldn't even be on it. Don't mistake my meaning though, the film is still terrible. Movie 43 is a collection of sketches staring a-list stars that are meant to be gross, offensive, and gerenally low-brow. While they achieve the low-brow part, they fail to make it in any way funny. I'll admit I smirked or chuckled a few times, but the majority of the film is either boring or just plain irritating. I really believe that many of the stars are putting honest effort into their sketches, trying to make them funny, but it's still evident that they are embarrassed to be there. The best sketch in the film is Emma Stones, because it's short and actually approaches something like comedy. The worst would either have to be the iBabe or Halle Berry's and Stephen Merchent's truth or dare sketch. The ibabe one was a little bit sexist and the Truth or dare was just embarrassing. Still, the movie was blessedly short and I couldn't quite call it boring. Ultimately, I walked into Movie 43 with very low expectation and it met every one of them, but after it ended I truly thought that it could have been a lot more painful.

When I saw the trailer for this movie, due to obvious reasons, I figured it was going to flop, and it did. But curiosity got the better of me and I decided to give it a viewing. There are 3 types of movies; there are good movies, bad movies and a small fraction of bad movies that are so bad that they can be enjoyed with the right mindset. Funnily enough, Movie 43 is the latter. Let me start off by saying this movie is not for everyone; only for a small audience who likes incredibly ridiculous vulgar and immature humour. The movie's broken up into various segments of scenes played out by famous actors with a backdrop of a ridiculous plot that isn't even worth mentioning. The thing about it is; some of the scenes were actually funny. I could have just been in the mood to watch it, but some made me laugh out loud. Highlights were the superhero segment, Hugh Jackman who seems to be able to make even balls on a neck funny, amongst others. The movie's so disgusting that I don't expect people to make it through the first half hour. I have no idea how they convinced so many big names to take part in this movie but if it weren't for them, I probably wouldn't have watched it. But with every funny part, there is a really bad part. Some segments were just trying too hard or not funny at all, and they ended the movie on a weird note. It crossed some lines making fun of racism and child abuse, which is probably one of the reasons why it didn't go over well with critics; that and well, the fact that it's not a good movie. This is a special genre of movie that comes along every once in a while that's so bad that if approached in the right way, can actually make it watchable. But for everyone else; avoid. 3/10

"Movie 43" - Inconsistently funny and mostly boring 

Robert: It's very important to us that Kevin has a normal and complete high school experience.

"Movie 43" is not really a movie. Not *really*. It's a collection of comedy sketches featuring various celebrities. If you wanted to see a movie that has a great cast, this is not one of them. No matter how many times they throw names at you, don't believe it. These highly recognized celebrities make an appearance, but only a few at a time. They don't all tie into a single story and you don't see all of them work together.

I've already stated that this "movie" is just a collection of short films. Now about the quality of the individual films. There's quite a few of them, but only one or two will actually be worth a few laughs. The rest are painfully unfunny and poorly written, so bad that it becomes embarrassing to watch some of these actors and actresses. 

The whole point of including recognizable names is to give them characters that people will go see. Here there is virtually no characterization, not that there would be any time for it anyway. Our favorite actors are only here for a few minutes to play a small part and then just like that, they're gone. On top of being short-lived, most of the sketches aren't even funny. And for the ones that are; I'm sure you could find them on YouTube or something.

Overall, "Movie 43" is not very funny and it's really wasting a great group of actors. I'm not sure what it's supposed to be really.

I...am truly...PISSED!!! This is not a joke and it is neither an act nor a rant. In fact, this a warning to anyone out there that plans on seeing this film then don't. Because if you do plan to then be prepared for the most grueling hour and thirty seven minutes of your life. This movie is so bad that there is not enough booze in the world to help you forget about it and believe me I tried. The fact that any actor would be a part of this movie must have either been desperate for a quick pay check or wanted to have a shitty movie on their resume portfolio. I have never had an experience watching a film quite like this in my entire...FUCKING...LIFE! And this is coming from someone who has seen A LOT of bad movies in my life thus far. I hope that as I post this review today that I would save as many lives as I can from wasting their precious hours on a piece of shit movie like this. Movie 43 has finally done it making me believe that not only is this the worst movie of 2013, but it is officially in my Top 15 worst films of all time. It really does exceed your tolerance for every single sin that you can possibly think of in a movie and tests the very core of how you watch a bad movie. You know what; I am going to spare you the usual lengthy review for today and just straight up tell you what I thought about this film. The plot sucks, the characters in here suck, the jokes suck, and everything about this (as a whole) sucks major big dicks! This movie sucks dick so much that it sucks dick at sucking dick, that's how bad I think it is. What's even more amazing is that not only were they able to acquire of handful of A-list celebrities and waste their God given talent on this movie, but the fact that this film ever made it off the green light and into the big screen is uncanny to me. This movie needs to burn in Hell along with the many writers who wrote this movie. Fuck this movie and fuck everything about it!

What the fuck was I on back in 2013 giving this 90%? In the cinema the shock value was what sold it to me, the star power and outrageous laughs had me and my mates leaving the cinema in stitches, but a year on the jokes are wearing thin and becoming less and less funny and being more of a chore to watch. As the months have gone by and a few more viewings the score has gradually sunk and now it's at my lowest score of 50%, and most likely to get lower and lower.

The structure is one of the main problems, there are two stories that set up the skits. There is "The Pitch", starring Greg Kinnear and Dennis Quaid, and then the other one with annoying teenagers trying to find the most banned videos online. These two different segments couldn't be anymore outlandish and disjointed, they literally have the weakest link to introducing Movie 43's skits, yet in all it's outrageous greatness The Pitch is mildly entertaining and a whole lot more tolerable than the scenes with the teens. 

This bad pitch sees Dennis Quaid introduce his new film which consists of different stars in different situations, claiming that it's a family movie which is funny because it really isn't. As he divulges into his "masterpiece lining up to be the next Howard The Duck", the skits in begin. That's it, there's no underlying story or reason for it all, it's pure shock value and tastelessness, do not watch it with family. The worst part is the scene where you actually see Quaid and Kinnear in the parking lot, and the camera turns to the crew where Farrelly makes a quip, never before has a joke been so flat and unfunny. Here come the skits.

An all-star humiliate themselves and act like you've never seen before, almost down to the standards of a Rob Schneider flick, that didn't attract me to the movie but what did was the insane cast list, and I won't lie but I laughed an awful lot. The opening with Kate Winslet and Hugh Jackman is unlike anything you've ever seen, it left me speechless, I didn't see it coming. The homeschool skit with Naomi Watts and Liev Schrieber is cringe and rather twisted, and the i-Babe skit is raucously funny, Kate Bosworth acts as if she has just realised what movie she has got herself involved with. You shouldn't laugh at Movie 43, but I did, the truth or dare with Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant is priceless for all the wrong reasons. This movie scooped up several Razzies and rightfully so, there's no craft or attention to any detail here, just one big joke wrapped up into a 90 minute movie that seems even longer. I'm one of the few that liked this and its crudeness yet it barely defines the saying "so bad it's good", it has much bad about yet there are some glimmers of good slapped around.

What a silly movie! Reminds me of silly movie from the 70's and 80's. It's basically a bunch of short skits sewn together by a retarded and poorly executed narrative. The skits themselves are pretty damn edgy by America standards and feature some well-known actors who obviously enjoyed performing in this movie. They know it's shit, but that's why they had so much fun with it.
Despite the low-brow humour, poor script and some terrible acting I kinda enjoyed this movie and I'm ashamed to say it made me laugh quite a couple of times.

Have you ever been ashamed to see a Movie?
Movie 43 is that movie.

I don't understand why this movie got such bad reviews, I haven't laughed so hard in a long time.  People that didn't like it should watch it again with some friends.  It is raunchy and tasteless comedy, but I love how they got a stat studded cast to play these parts.

This movie was twisted, raunchy, and utterly unconventional, and isn't meant to fit into your typical movie review format. I'm glad you don't get it. I'm glad you were offended. I'm glad you're too mature. You are so above this one. Move on to the next one. Betcha love Lee Daniel's The Butler, oh you're all so well rounded, and articulate. Well so did I, but I loved this one too - so off the cuff, and made me uncomfortable multiple times, oh, and hilarious.
don't see what the big deal is. people hate stupid things that make fun of themselves, don't see how this movie should be hated.

An honest 4 stars - even though I wanted to give it 5 to even out all the negative reviews. Seriously, this movie is NOT as bad as people say. I don't know why but it seems like some critics have a personal vendetta against it and everyone else has just jumped on the bandwagon. It is lewd, gross, juvenile at times, and shocking / tasteless, BUT it is original, definitely unique, and more than anything else ENTERTAINING ! I'm serious! Give it a chance and try not to let the bad reviews sway your thinking. Just check your brain at the door and don't expect to see something on par with Citizen Kane. I promise it's better than all the brainless and overdone remakes and sequels Hollywood is putting out these days.

Movie 43 is the 43rd movie in a series of movies...

I'm sure I'm the first one to make that joke.

But seriously; Movie 43 is a comedy that has been considered by many to be one of the worst movies ever made, and this came out like...a year ago.

Okay, I'm just going to cut to the chase; this movie is bad, downright horrible, and yet at the same time, I was disappointed, I expected this movie to be completely terrible the whole way through, and...yeah it was for about 98% of the movie, I only laughed once and it wasn't even during a sketch.

However, the actors in this movie are...really...REALLY trying to work with what they got, poor Hugh Jackman.

Basically, Movie 43 is like my marriage; no matter how pathetic it is, I still continue to tr- I mean the movie continues to try.

Movie 43 is predictable, un-funny, and strange enough; completely forgettable.

1.5 stars are for the initial Kate Winslet / Hugh Jackman neckballs short. The other half star is for Halle Berry and Stephen Merchant's truth or dare sequence. I mean, I did laugh in the first two skits: the Winslet/Jackman balls one and Home-schooled one. Movie 43 is a waste of effort for me. I didn't enjoy every minute of everything this garbage depicted. I checked it out on netflix so I could come up with my own opinion about it. I knew it was going to be a bad movie, but I wanted to see why everyone didn't like it. Upon seeing it, I have come to a conclusion that the reason this movie was made was because the people were desperate for money. By having all those all-star actors/actress in play, it was obvious they cared less about making a good enough story and jokes, and cared more about the A-List cast. Most of them are pretty talented, but they were all waisted here.

Now where should I start? I guess the plot. Unfortunately, it didn't have a story. It follows two guys who are desperately trying to get their script approved by a producer who keeps denying it, after he discovers that each skits are offensive, and that it lacks meaning. That's right, the movie is a series of skits that are totally gross, unfunny, and illogical. I only laughed twice throughout the whole movie, but that still didn't say much. 

The movie seemed like it was made by someone who saw two girls and one cup and most of the spoof movies from this generation. Most of the skits deals with potty humor, genitals, sex, and many other junk. Of course it's a rated-R movie, meaning the filmmakers are free to do whatever they want, but adding a lot of female breasts, poop jokes, sex, and a bunch of F-Bombs don't make a comedy movie funny. I did not laugh at anything that happened here, except for the two skit that were slightly funny. The one where the parents were treating their homeschooled son like crap, and the last one where Terrance Howard's character talked about racism in a basketball game made me chuckled, but that was it. 

The movie was so disgusting, it made me feel totally grossed out. Most of the moments from the film were too gross to look at. I'm not going to bother describing the ones that were nasty to me because I don't want to be reminded. The only good thing about me seeing it on netflix is that I didn't have to pay for it. Sure it was a waste of time on my part, but it was better than wasting my money on a film that I didn't find worthwhile.

I couldn't believe the A-List actors/actress agreed to be in this movie. If I was one of those people, I would reject it as soon as possible. They were all wasted here. There wasn't a single cast member that stood out to me. This wasn't the first movie to add people in a higher status. Valentine's Day did it, then comes New Years Eve. Talk about having to try too hard to appeal teenagers and 20somethings.

As a whole, I didn't enjoy it. This is just as bad as most of Adam Sandler's newer movies. I'd rather watch Key and Peele than having to spend a little over an hour and a half seeing this piece of filth. At least they know how to make better skits and humor than this so-called comedy. If you want to see a comedy movie that's smart and hilarious, you will not find it here. It would be rediculous for me to hear someone says it's funny because it's not.
Far worse than possibly imaginable!

Movie 43 is an absolutely bewildering trainwreck. Stubbornly refusing to rise above humor we all left back in middle school, it shoves one overdone "joke" in our face after another, painfully stretching the often mean-spirited skits into 10 minutes or more when 10 seconds would have been too much. We are treated to crass, overly offensive attempts at comedy involving literally nothing besides bodily functions, body parts and long-winded, poorly acted monologues. After 55 minutes in, I turned it off, because if this was all the movie had to show me for the first bulk of the run time the rest of it was likely just as worthless. 
One of my questions about this piece of garbage will eternally be, how did they get these people to be in this film? Did Hugh Jackman really think it was that inspired, original and hilarious to film a horrifically stupid scene revolving completely around his genitals being on his neck? In case we didn't see your balls dip into the gravy the first time, Hugh, luckily the directors zoomed close up several times so we could witness every moment of rib-cracking hilarity. I, for one, have never seen a finer sequence in a movie than when a pubic hair fell into your bowl and you (did he actually do that?! OMG) accidentally ate it! Hilarious.

Movie 43 is the epitome of everything that is wrong with Hollywood, and Brett Ratner is the Tommy Wiseau of comedy. This is six million dollars of money that literally would have been put to better use being thrown randomly off of rooftops. When someone asks me why the stereotype of fat, stupid americans exists, all I have to do is point them to this movie. With an absolute plethora of completely moronic skits and a stupid underlying plot that doesn't even attempt to tie the stupid skits together, one has to wonder what comedy geniuses such as Seth MacFarlane are doing in this garbage. Although the skits are drawn out 10 minutes or oftentimes longer, they wouldn't be funny even in the shortest Family Guy cutaway gag, and Seth, I'm sure, is well aware of this. His constant look of consternation implies an ulterior motive that begins with Pay and ends with Check. Others, like McLovin, simply flail around wildly, their career speeding down the drain with every passing, painful second. 

If you just can't get enough of entire segments revolving around Anna Faris begging Chris Pratt to defecate on her, if you burst into hysterical laughter every time you hear the words "poop," or "balls," or if you guffaw even at the thought of a young girl having her first period at a friend's house, Movie 43 is the perfect movie for you. The rest of us would rather keep our brain cells. It is with great honor that I officially declare Movie 43 The Worst Movie of 2013.

There is a lot to risk when writing an over-the-top, shock value comedy.  So, if you are going to take that risk, make sure that it has... wait for it... over-the-top, shock value comedy.  Movie 43 does have shock, and it can be over-the-top at times.  However, it lacks comedy.  This movie is filed under comedy, right?  It is as if a bunch of 11-year old boys had a slumber party, got bored at 3am, and wrote a screenplay.  It is unfortunate to see such a crass attempt at a comedy loaded with stars.  Simply put, Movie 43 should have been a video uploaded on youtube, tagged as "garbage".

A depressed, destitute group of cocaine addicts with one camera could make a better "film" than this morbid, extraordinarily lazy, pernicious piece of trash (which remarkably features some of Hollywood's top names).

I have got nothing to say...I honestly have got nothing to say at all! If you seriously want to waste your time, money and effort on one of the biggest shitstorms in movie history...Movie 43. But first a little history- the bastards who made this piece of shit apparently said they wanted a movie-length version of online sketch comedies such as FunnyorDie and so they got as many actors as possible. Some accepted the script thinking it was really funny, some instantly declined and others were forced by the studios; how sad where most of them will hopefully have this film as the lowest point in their career! Not only that, if you want to want to make a movie that resembles online sketch comedies like FunnyorDie, fine but do it in a way that makes sense and not in a way that is so off-putting and offensive! And did I mention this thing has a story as well? Apparently it's about some guy whose younger brother keeps pranking him so him and his best friend get their revenge on the brother by saying that there's a worldwide banned movie out there called Movie 43 and he has to look for it so therefore he comes across these clips that I swear to god if I ever watch them again, I will turn that thing off instantly! One gag involves Kate Winslet on a blind date where he meets Hugh Jackman who has testicles on his neck- that's not funny! That's disgusting! Another gag involves Naomi Watts and Liev Schreiber as parents and they treat their house in a high-school environment because of their teenage boy- get it? Because he's a teenager and therefore they treat him and the house like he's in high school? Another involves Chris Pratt being forced to do a cleveland steamer on his bitch played by Anna Faris and he is told by his friends during a barbecue that if he does a poop then she's his soulmate and if he does a shit, then she's his whore and it ends with Chris Pratt shitting all over some guy's car. This was just unfunny and boring as hell. And if Chris Pratt doesn't bring me his A-game as Star Lord in Guardians Of The Galaxy in 2014, he will officially blow! Another involves Halle Berry playing Truth or Dare with some guy I don't care about and it was just unbearable to watch! There's a fucking slogan on the poster asking you "What is Movie 43?" and the answer is obviously nothing! This movie is just a big piece of nothing! It is just a bunch of horrible clips put together with no story, no context, no whatsoever! Oh and at the end of the movie, Some bad guys warn the teenage douchebags that if they find this movie, the world will end but they find it as it somehow exists for real and an apocalypse arrives and kills everyone except for the older brother who survives in a wheelchair with a cripple and finds his laptop with a cracked screen and watches Terrence Howard give a basketball speech- for fuck's sake quit dragging it out and end this damn thing! You know if this was supposed to be the gross-out comedy special, then Adam Sandler is god compared to this! I don't expect to walk into this thinking a gross-out comedy that is actually funny OK! To be honest, I like gross-out comedies; The American Pie series were hilarious, Ted was hilarious and some of Seth Rogen's comedies such as Knocked Up, Superbad, Pineapple Express and more recently This Is The End were great but this movie doesn't know what it wants to be and therefore crams everything in, throws everything at us and thinks we can take it. Overall Movie 43 is a disgusting, unpleasant, uncomfortable, queasy, sickening, non-sensical, abominational piece of trash that you should steer away from and I know you will obviously watch it to think what the hell am I even saying AND let's hope they don't make a Movie 43: The Sequel, Movie 44 and Movie 45! Movie 43 gets a Some Old Bullshit/10 and I'm tired from bitching at this movie!

I find that every now and then--and this is really an ongoing thing--that movies that are made in this day and age are truly loosing their sense of exuberance when it comes to lowering the bar in theatrically-distributed exhibitions. Now, for those not keeping score, my thought on whether to assign the theme to this particular document is up in the air, so to speak. 

I swear, its more like an amateur dentist miserably attempting cavity fillings on an old jack-ass only to fail with repugnant and embarrassing results galore. 

Screw it, I'll just go ahead and say it. Despite what was said about "After Last Season" being THE worst movie I've ever seen is a statement that I begrudgingly still stand behind, but barely by the skin of its teeth. What I did find, and I'm frustratingly sad to report, that I found another movie that even dared to attempt to lower the bar even further. 

This abomination that I dare utter to speak of is "Movie 43."

After some time mulling over on what theme to assign this utter piece of garbage, I came to the logical conclusion that not only this movie isn't even deserving of any sort of theme and/or label, but the only thing that this movie deserves is to buy up every DVD from a local area superstore and completely defile each and every copy. The movie is that bad. 

This movie is so bad, Ed Wood's corpse would just rise from the dead and cackle at us and say "See? My movies weren't that bad!" Okay, that comparison may not go to that extreme but c'mon!

One line summary: A compilation of short vignettes, mostly of the earthy humour type.

-----------------------------------------

    Charlie Wessler pitches Griffin Schraeder a more than screwed up movie idea.

    That's the conceit of the film.  Griffin objects, but Charlie pulls a gun on him.  Via some misadventures, Griffin's boss insists that Griffin go ahead with the project.

    The segments are many and short.

    Most of the segments are rude, crude, and barbaric.

    Luckily most of the shorts are laugh out loud funny.

    However, don't pursue if you do not like earthy humor.

--------Scores---------

    Cinematography: 10/10 Sharp.

    Sound: 10/10 No problems.

    Acting: 7/10 Mixed.  Some hilarious; some incredibly irritating.

    Screenplay: 5/10 A better name for this film would be 'Miscellaneous crap from the Cutting Room Floor.'

I like that this movie is proud of how tasteless, repulsive, and stupid it is, but that doesn't stop it from being tasteless, repulsive, and stupid. Overall, I give it a pass, but it's not for the faint of heart. Some skits will make you laugh out loud, while others will make you cringe uncontrollably (in particular, the last one will make you feel like you have to take a shower afterwards). Say what you want, but the film constantly subverts your expectations and that's what makes it so fun to watch.
